loans.name: Sobenty Group

texts.en: Ibrahim is the Sobenty group leader who has been with the program for 2 years. He is 29 years old and married with 3 children. He sells clothes in Magburaka town, and his business is the sole source of income for the family. Like other group members, he would like to increase his stock for more income. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 3,200,000 for the purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to increase inventory

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Mr. Oscar is 35 years old and he lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He’s married and has two children who are in grade school. His wife is a homemaker. Mr. Oscar works in a company as a security guard, and he’s been working as such for two years. He hopes to build a kitchen in his home with the loan that he is asking for. In this way his family will have more room and be more comfortable. He plans on continuing to make improvements to his home and to provide his children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Oscar tiene 35 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, es casado y tienen dos niños, los cuales están estudiando la primaria, su esposa es ama de casa. El Sr. Oscar trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad, tiene dos años de estar dedicándose a esta profesión.Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera poder construir la cocina de su vivienda, para así tener más espacio y comodidad para su familia. Su planes son seguir haciendo mejoras en su casa y brindar educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy construction materials in order to build a kitchen in his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increased capital to grow her business.

loans.name: Kayainktheke Group

texts.en: Issa B. T. is a pharmacist who sells essential medicines in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone. As a group leader, he is a very successful businessman who started at a very small scale and, with a previous loan, he has expanded his business. Other group members are also engaged in various businesses. Issa is 37 years old and married with 3 children. He would like to increase his stock and, together with his group members, they are requesting a loan of Le. 3,800,000.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of essential medicines

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David's determination, diligence and perseverance is always emphasized by the activities to which he dedicates himself. In the time that he has devoted to his business of sales and purchases of second-hand tricycles and bicycles, David has found great satisfaction. Over a very short period of time he has begun to reap great benefits with which he is now able to accomplish many of his goals. In reality, this hard-working young man is continuing his studies. In order to cover his education costs he needs to have better investment in his business, investment that will facilitate the effortless completion of his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

El empeño, diligencia y perseverancia de David siempre lo hicieron destacar en las actividades a las que se dedicó, durante el tiempo que viene consagrándose a su negocio de compra y venta de triciclos y bicicletas de segunda mano fue atesorando mucha satisfacción por que en muy corto tiempo consiguió obtener buenos beneficios con el que está logrando concretar muchos de sus planes.Actualmente este laborioso joven viene siguiendo sus estudios superiores, para cubrir sus gastos de educación desea tener un mayor monto de inversión en su negocio, inversión que le facilitará concluir con tranquilidad sus estudios.

loans.use: Increased capital to offer higher quantity of tricycles and bicycles.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
Eleutreria exemplifies strength and constant effort. Since her husband passed away she cares for her dear daughter, of whom she is very proud and happy, and wants to provided a good education. Elueteria is dedicated to seasonal fruit sales and offers delicious oranges, limes and mandarins that are frequently consumed by the local population. Nevertheless, she is only able to acquire a small quantity that she offers to customers on foot in a push-cart, only allowing her modest earnings. This noble woman's wish is to improve her income, for that she requires higher volume of her produce and happily hopes that you will make her request possible.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Doña Eleuteria, es ejemplo de fuerza y esfuerzo constante, desde que enviudó se hizo cargo de su querida hija de quien se siente orgullosa, contenta y a quien desea ofrecerle una buena educación.Eleuteria se dedica a la venta de frutas por temporadas y actualmente viene ofertando deliciosas naranjas, limas y mandarinas que son consumidas con bastante frecuencia por la población, sin embargo solamente adquiere en pequeñas cantidades y los ofrece en forma ambulatoria en su triciclo lo que hace que sus ganancias sean menores. El deseo de esta noble mujer es poder incrementar sus ganancias, para ello requiere aumentar el volumen de su mercadería y espera con mucha alegría se posibilite su petición.

loans.use: Increased capital to obtain larger quantity of produce.

loans.name: Ataya Group

texts.en: Chernoh J. is the group leader and has been with his friend Osman for a long time. Both friends sell roasted meat and green tea in the open-air market in Magburaka town. Chernoh is 40 years old and married with 5 children and has been running his business for more than 3 years. With his previous loan from SMT, he was able to purchase the items wholesale, thus generating more income and increasing his family's living status. The group members would like to expand their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of Le. 2000000 to purchase goats, sugar, and tea leaves.

loans.use: To purchase daily ingredients, tea leaves, sugar, and meat

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a very enterprising woman who forges her future with her own hands daily. She has watched her family progress, little by little, using her talents in the kitchen to generate a stable income that grants her the opportunity to fulfill the desires of her beloved family. Her husband, on the other hand, is dedicated to selling meat in the market and both desire to improve their work spaces to improve their earnings and as a result the quality of life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Julia es una mujer emprendedora que con sus manos forja diariamente su futuro y ha conseguido poco c poco que su familia progrese utilizando el talento que tiene en la cocina para generar un ingreso estable que le otorgue la posibilidad de colaborar con el cumplimiento de los deseos de su amada familia. Su esposo por otro lado se dedica a vender carne en el mercado y ambos están deseosos de mejorar sus espacios de trabajo a fin de incrementar sus ganancias y en consecuencia la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

loans.use: Capital to improve daily work space.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia is a woman who has a long history in the commercial field, which have been useful in starting many businesses such as a store in the downtown area; with this job and in the management of transportation vehicles she can satisfactorily maintain her home. She hopes to make her store bigger and that is why she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Dionicia es una mujer D. amplia trayectoria en el campo comercial que a lo largo D. los años le han servido para emprender múltiples negocios como el D. una bodega en el centro D. la ciudad; con esta ocupación y con la administración del alquiler D. algunas unidades D. transporte pueD. sostener su hogar con satisfacción. Desea implementar su espacio D. ventas y por esta razón solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: To increase her income and to implement her small store.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Doña Pelagia is a woman of humble heart and position who works very hard every day in her fields to produce her family’s sustenance, planting and tending her potatoes, beans, ulloco, corn, wheat, oats, and barley. Despite the losses Doña Pelagia and her family have suffered, they persevere, motivated by their desire for a better life, and that is why Doña Pelagia is asking for a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer to prepare one of her fields for cultivation. Show your solidarity with this noble but backbreaking cause!

Translated from Spanish by Ian, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Pelagia es una mujer de humilde condición y corazón que trabaja incesantemente en las duras tareas del campo las cuales labra diariamente para conseguir el sustento diario de su familia, trabaja diariamente vigilando sus campos de cultivo donde se dedica a sembrar papa, habas, olluco, maíz trigo, avena y cebada. Con el tiempo y a pesar de las pérdidas que sufrió Doña Pelagia y su familia perseveran motivados por sus deseos de superación, es por ello que solicitan un préstamo para comprar sacos de abono para preparar uno de sus terrenos de cultivo. Solidarízate a esta causa noble de trabajo esforzado.

loans.use:
Compra de abono//

Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng S. is 31 years old and a mother of four. She is a widow living with her four young children in Prekmohatep Village, Battambang Province. For income, Mrs. Sreng works at the local office of a non-governmental organization (NGO) and also rents out rooms in her house. She earns a combined $6.80 per day from these activities.

Mrs. Sreng seeks a $500 loan to purchase tools to construct more rooms and decorate existing rooms for her tenants. The loan will allow her to attract more tenants and possibly increase rental rates for rooms in her home.

loans.use: To purchase tools to construct more rooms in her house as well as decorate existing rooms to cater  to tenants.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy U. lives in Snour Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She buys rice to keep in stock and resell for a reasonable price. Her business now is very improved; unfortunately, Mrs. Chanthy U. has insufficient money to invest in more rice to keep in stock. Thus, Mrs. Chanthy U. asked for a loan for this goal. Her husband, Mr. Thoeurn Son, always assists his wife in business. Aside from this business, Mr. Thoeurn Son is a pig breeder. Mrs. Chanthy U. is 23 and married without any children. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell rice for a reasonable price.

loans.name: Somen

texts.en: Mrs. Somen M. lives in Kan Yuon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She usually buys rice to keep in stock and sell it for a good price. Mrs. Somen M. is 45 and the mother of four children, one of whom is a farmer while two others are employed in a garment factory. The youngest one is attending school. Mrs. Somen M.’s business now is improving, but she does not have enough money to purchase more rice to keep; thus, Mrs. Somen M. asked for a loan to buy more rice in order to keep some in stock. Her husband, Mr. Sophat Tep, is a farmer and pig breeder. Previously, Mrs. Somen M. obtained a loan to buy Cambodian cheese to resell. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice to keep in stock and sell it for a good price.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang R. is a middleman who usually buys rice to keep in stock. Aside from this business activity, Mrs. Neang R. is a fish seller. She lives in Kan Yuon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Mrs. Neang R. has six childR., three of whom are employed in a garment factory while one other is studying in a local school. The remaining two are staying at home because they are too young to work or attend school. Last year, Mrs. Neang R. obtained a loan from AMK to start her middleman business. Her business now is improved; Mrs. Neang R. now wants to buy more rice to resell for a reasonable price. Unfortunately, Mrs. Neang R. has insufficient money to purchase more rice. Thus, Mrs. Neang R. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Bil Er, is a fisherman. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell for a reasonable price.

loans.name: Proeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Proeurn S. lives in Kan Yuon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a middleman who buys rice to keep in stock in order to resell for a reasonable price. Aside from this, she is a cheese seller in the local market. Her first business activity is now improved, so Mrs. Proeurn S. would like to buy a huge supply of rice to keep in stock. Unfortunately, Mrs. Proeurn S. does not have enough money to purchase it; therefore, she asked for a loan for this goal. Mrs. Proeurn S. has eight children, three of whom are construction workers while two others are laborers. The remaining three are enrolling in school. Her husband, Mr. Sary Kong, is a subsistence farmer. Previously, Mrs. Proeurn S. obtained a loan from AMK to start her cheese-selling business. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a huge supply of rice to keep in stock and resell for a reasonable price.

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en: Mrs. Chhim N. is a poultry farmer in Khnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the three others are attending school. Mrs. Chhim N.’s business is now improved; thus, she wants to start another pig breeding business. So Mrs. Chhim N. asked for a loan to buy pigs to raise, and the rest of money she would use to buy pig food. Previously, Mrs. Chhim N. obtained a loan from AMK to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise, and the rest of money would be used to buy pig food.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan E. is a Khmer cake seller in Tie Buon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She usually buys Khmer cakes to resell for income. Aside from this business, Mrs. Chan E. is a subsistence farmer. Her husband, Mr. Bora Long, is a cart horse driver in the village, but his business has faced a small problem because his horse had died of a disease. In order to make Mr. Bora Long’s business start again, Mrs. Chan E. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new horse to work with her husband's business. Mrs. Chan E. has two children, both of whom are too young to work or attend school. Previously, Mrs. Chan E. obtained a loan from AMK to fuel for her pump to water her rice field. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new horse to work with her husband's business.

loans.name: Net

texts.en: Mrs. Net K. lives in Khnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a basket maker in the local village. Aside of this business activity, Mrs. Net K. is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Theng Pen, is a fisherman. They have one child who is studying in a state school. The family members now are in poor conditions and they live in an old house. Additionally, Mrs. Net K. now is building a new house; unfortunately, she has insufficient money to build it. Thus, Mrs. Net K. decided to ask for a loan to add with her profit in order to build a new house to replace the old one. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Moeurn H. is a basket seller and farmer in Khnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Huor Hom, is a fisherman. They have eight children, two of whom are basket makers while three others transport soil to sell for income. The remaining three are enrolling in school. Although Mrs. Moeurn H.’s family members have different business activities, they are still in poor living conditions. So Mrs. Moeurn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy pigs for breeding in order to improve their conditions. Previously, Mrs. Moeurn H. obtained a loan to buy an "electric cow" to plow her rice, field as well as to hire it for a profit. Her husband is on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pigs for breeding

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat S. became a client at MicroInvest earlier this year, when she applied for a loan to expand her business. She was born in 1969 in the Taboshar region of Tajikistan and is married with two children. Her family was not able to give her a higher education, but she is very skilled at raising livestock, something she has done for the past 12 years and learned from her mother. She supports her family by selling various milk products in the local bazaar, where she has many customers. Mrs. S. has applied to Kiva for a loan to develop her business by buying special equipment used to make products from milk.

loans.use: to buy special equipment to make products from milk.

loans.name: Raila

texts.en: Raila N. lives in the Kairokkum region of Tajikistan and is married with six children. For the last 30 years, Mrs. N. has made a living by raising livestock and selling various products made from milk. She went into this line of work when she was a child helping her mother. Her many years of experience in this trade have made her very skilled at what she does. Mrs. N. has applied to Kiva for a loan to buy one more cow for milking. She will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: to buy a new cow to produce milk.

loans.name: Tuyakboy

texts.en: Tuyakboy T. is 51 years old and the father of four children. He lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan, where he has raised livestock for the past 35 years. He has a good herd of cows and rams, and supports his family by caring for them and selling their products. His wife and children help him by selling milk, meat and various items made from yarn. Mr. T. recently learned about Kiva, and has applied for a six-month loan to build a barn to house his cows. He thanks Kiva for its work and support, and wishes Kiva lenders all the best.

loans.use: to build a barn to house his cows.

loans.name: Vali

texts.en: Forty-one-year-old Vali V. breeds sheep in the Bilasuvar region. He has more than 15 years of experience in sheep breeding. Selling the sheep for meat is the main source of income to support his wife and five children. Vali works as builder, but this work is not permanent and he works only if any local people build new houses or cafés, which happens very rarely. He is applying for $1000 US to purchase 15 sheep and fodder. This loan will help him to increase his income because summer is high season for weddings and the main meal at that event is mutton.Vali has a good chance to improve his life condition by selling sheep during this period.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep

loans.name: Ernesto Francisco

texts.pt:
Ernesto is 55 years old and was born in the province of Gaza. He was trained to be an elementary school teacher. He is married and the father of 4 children, 2 girls and 2 boys, all are adults (the oldest is 32 years old and the youngest is 22). The first two are already employed, and the other 2 are studying at the university but are still his responsibility.

Ernesto and his family moved from the province of Gaza to Namaacha in 1986 due to a job transfer so he could work as a professor in the teacher-training school located in Namaacha. Since then Ernesto and his family have lived there and he works in the same school.

Ernesto has a monthly salary of 7,400MTn and works from 7:30am to 10:00pm with a 2-hour lunch break. Besides 2 of his children, Ernesto supports two nephews in the Chibuto province of Gaza sending them 1,500MTn monthly. Still he is able to save approximately 2,500MTn per month with the help of receipts from a small stand he possesses.

It has been 10 years since Ernesto began his selling activities in a small stand (store) in response to the increase in the cost of living. His activities consist of selling a variety of drinks and basic staple products. The best seller is a national beer with a 2M mark that is acquired for 200MTn per box and sold for 300MTn. The monthly receipts vary between 2,000MTn and 3,000MTn depending on the time of year (winter or summer, respectively).

Ernesto has his own home. This is his second loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. The first loan for 20,000MTn was used to purchase construction materials to build a coop to raise chickens, a business that still isn't up and running. Ernesto paid that loan off early and without difficulties.

With this loan Ernesto intends to purchase products for his stand, increasing his stocks as well as his sales. In the future Ernesto would like to purchase baby chicks to begin his poultry business now that the coop is almost finished.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Ernesto tem 55 anos de idade e nasceu na província de Gaza. Ernesto fez a formação de professor primário, é casado e pai de 4 filhos, sendo duas meninas e dois rapazes, todos já maiores de idade (o primeiro filho tem 32 anos de idade e o ultimo 22 anos). Os dois primeiros já estão empregados e os dois últimos estudam na universidade sob sua responsabilidade. Ernesto e sua família mudaram-se da província de Gaza para Namaacha em 1986 devido a transferência que ele teve para ir trabalhar na escola de formação dos professores situado em Namaacha como professor. Desde então Ernesto e sua família lá vivem, Ernesto ainda trabalhando na mesma escola. Ernesto tem um salário mensal de MTn 7,400, trabalhando das 7:30h as 22:00h com intervalo de 2 horas de almoço. Ernesto para alem dos dois filhos sustenta mais dois sobrinhos que se encontram em Chibuto província de Gaza, enviando mensalmente MTn 1,500. Ainda assim consegue poupar do salário aproximadamente MTn 2,500 com ajuda das receitas da pequena barraca que possui. Há dez anos Ernesto iniciou a atividade de venda em uma pequena barraca (loja) como resposta a subida do custo de vida. A atividade consiste na venda de variedades de bebidas e produtos de necessidade básica, onde destaca com mais saída a cerveja nacional de marca 2M que é adquirida por MTn 200 a caixa e vendida por MTn 300. A receita liquida mensal varia entre MTn 2,000 a MTn 3,000, dependendo do período do ano (inverno ou verão, respectivamente). Ernesto tem casa própria. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro empréstimo de MTn 20,000 foi usado para compra de material de construção para construir uma capoeira para criação de frangos, negocio ainda não iniciado. Ernesto pagou este empréstimo sem dificuldades antes do tempo. Com este empréstimo Ernesto pretende comprar produtos para sua barraca, aumentando assim o estoque e as vendas. No futuro Ernesto gostaria de comprar pintos para iniciar sua atividade avícola, já que esta quase concluída a capoeira.

loans.use: Purchase goods to restock his store

loans.name: Telli

texts.en: Telli Y. is a 44-year-old woman who has been selling various goods such as bread, cigarettes, candies and tea for more than 20 years. She lives with her husband and three daughters in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. Telli is applying for $700 US to improve the condition of her shop and diversify the goods she sells. As an Internally Displaced Person, she receives financial support of about $70 US from the government. This amount is too low even to feed her family, and her main source of income is this shop.

loans.use: To improve the condition of the shop and diversify goods

loans.name: Lucinda Vasco

texts.pt:
Lucinda is 41 years old, married, and the mother of a 25 year old daughter who is taking a nursing course in the capital of Maputo. Lucinda married her husband after her first fiance went to South Africa and never returned. She lives in her own home with her husband, two step sons, and one nephew, and her daughter is in Maputo.

Lucinda is a native of the province of Gaza and moved to Namaacha with her husband when he was transferred with his work. Because it is a mountainous region and on the border with Swaziland they decided to stay permanently in this area. Lucinda studied through the 4th grade and stopped due to the difficult financial condition of her family.

She has been a trader for many years having decided to start a business to help her husband with the household expenses. She has a stand in the front yard of her home and works from 7:00am until 7:00pm. The products with the most sell-through are the basic necessities like rice, peanuts, beans, and corn flour.

Lucinda has a monthly income of approximately 2,000MTn. Through a neighbor who is already a client, Lucinda discovered Hluvuku. As her money for moving stock was low, she contacted Hluvuku to solicit this loan for 25,000MTn with which she will grow the volume of her business. The primary objectives are to improve her business and enlarge her stand. In the future Lucinda would like to see her daughter and her step sons enrolled in college, and she would like to expand her home to make her family more comfortable.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Lucinda tem 41 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de uma filha de 25 anos de idade que freqüenta um curso de enfermagem na capital Maputo. Lucinda se casou com o atual marido depois que seu primeiro noivo foi para a África do Sul e nunca mais retornou. Lucinda vive em sua própria casa com o marido, dois enteados e um sobrinho, dado que sua filha mora em Maputo. Lucinda é natural da província de Gaza, e mudou-se para Namaacha com o marido, que foi transferido no trabalho. Por ser uma região montanhosa e na fronteira com a Swazilandia, decidiram fixar-se definitivamente nesta zona. Lucinda estudou somente ate a 4a classe e parou devido a difícil condição financeira de sua família. Lucinda é comerciante faz muitos anos, decidiu abrir um negocio para ajudar o marido com as despesas de casa. Ela tem uma barraca no quintal em frente a sua casa e trabalha das 7:00 horas as 19:00 horas. Os produtos com mais saída são os de necessidade básica, como arroz, amendoim, feijão e farinha de milho. Lucinda tem um lucro mensal de aproximadamente MTn 2,000. Através de uma vizinha que já é cliente, Lucinda soube da existência da Hluvuku. Como o dinheiro para a movimentação do estoque era baixo, contatou a Hluvuku para solicitar este empréstimo no valor de MTn 25,000 com qual vai aumentar o volume do seu negocio. Os objetivos primários de Lucinda são melhorar o seu negocio e ampliar a sua barraca. No futuro Lucinda gostaria de ver sua filha e seus enteados formados na faculdade e também gostaria de ampliar a sua casa para dar mais conforto a sua família.

loans.use: Purchase goods to restock her store

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
U. Zaynura is 54 years old. She is a widow and has three adult children. Zaynura is an economist. She works as an operator of the subscriber department in Tojiiktelelecom for more than 15 years. After the death of her husband it was difficult for her to raise and to educate her children alone. Thus, she decided to run the business. 

With the help of IMON she purchased a small store where she sold video cassettes. Now with the help of her son, she provides computer services and also sells DVD disks and MP3 disks. Today Zaynura requests 1700 Somoni (500 $ US Dollars) with the purpose of purchasing new DVD disks to increase the variety of goods. Also, with part of the loan, she plans to spend for a new printer. She promises to repay the loan within 10 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Zaynura’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing a new printer and DVD disks for increasing the variety of goods.

loans.name: Marta Chavela

texts.pt:
Marta is 39 years old and a native of Namaacha, a district that borders with Swaziland. Marta is married and the mother of 3 sons the oldest of which is 17 years old, the second is 11, and the third is 4. Marta studied until the 7th grade, not continuing due to mandatory military service which lasted 2 years.

After her discharge she returned with her husband that she met in the army to the town of Namaacha. Marta learned the business through her father in law who was a great trader in the area. The establishment that she runs was from her father in law who is deceased. Marta says that the products with the most sell-through are beer, that she buys for 21MTn and resells for 25MTn, and sugar.

Marta has had a monthly income of 2,500MTn and is able to save a little by the end of the month. Besides the business of selling staple products she also raises cattle, and currently has 24 head. Marta has 2 employees, one for each activity, and she pays 1,200MTn per month to each one.

This is her first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. She has never had a loan before. She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is a client. With this loan, Marta intends to purchase basic staple products to resell in her establishment. She would like to refurbish and paint her stand, increase her animal count as well as recoup a tractor that was her father in law's.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Marta tem 39 anos de idade e é natural de Namaacha, distrito que faz fronteira com a Swazilandia. Marta é casada e mãe de três filhos, sendo a primeira com 17 anos, a segunda com 11 anos e a terceira com 4 anos. Marta estudou ate 7ª classe, não tendo continuado devido ao serviço militar obrigatório no qual permaneceu lá durante 2 anos. Com a sua desmobilização voltou com o marido que conhecera lá na tropa para vila de Namaacha. Marta aprendeu o negocio através do seu sogro que foi um grande comerciante na zona. O estabelecimento que explora foi do falecido sogro. Marta diz que o produtos que tem mais saída são a cerveja que compra por MTn 21 e revende por MTn 25 e o açúcar. Marta tem tido um lucro mensal de MTn 2,500 e consegue poupar um pouco no fim do mês. Marta para alem do negocio de venD. de produtos da primeira necessidade dedica se a criação de gado bovino, contando atualmente com 24 cabeças. Marta tem dois empregados, um para cada atividade, e paga MTn 1,200 por mês para cada um. Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Marta com Hluvuku e Kiva. Marta nunca teve outro empréstimo antes e conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que é cliente. Com o empréstimo, Marta pretende comprar produtos de necessidade básica para revender em seu estabelecimento. Constitui sonho para ela reabilitar a sua barraca pintar e ampliar, aumentar o seu efectivo animal, alem de recuperar um trator do falecido sogro.

loans.use: Purchase goods to restock her store

loans.name: Ake's Group

texts.en:
This group from Faala Palauli is a new group in which the members work individually on their businesses but, when it comes to the time of payments, they are very kind to each other. Most of them work on plantations and vegetable gardens because their land is fertile. Their husbands weed the grasses and plant the taro (called "taamu" in Samoa), while the women are responsible for marketing and sales. This is their first loan and also the first time for them to run their own businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of equipments, tools, chemicals and fertilizers for the businesses

loans.name: Filifilia's Group

texts.en:
The women in this group are engaged in planting and selling taro and bananas. Their husbands actually do the farming, while the women sell and look for markets. This operates much like a family business in which everyone participates through different tasks. This is a new group and the members are very hard working and honest women. They participate and attend weekly meetings and they have started their businesses well. These are their first loans and will be their first experiences in running their own money.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, knives, weed killing spray, and tools for their businesses.

loans.name: Sharof

texts.en:
U. Sharof is 32 years old. He is married with two children of school age. His wife is a housekeeper and she is taking care of their children. Thus Sharof is the main bread-winner in the family. Sharof’s children are small now, but already today he is working hard to ensure the best future for them.

For more than a year Sharof has been baking the national bread “lepeshka.” He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonable ups and down. He gets up early to bake the lepeshka and bread so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

All materials like the flour, salt, and yeast he purchases at the local market. Now Sharof requests 3400 Somoni (1000 $ US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing flour and coal for baking the lepeshka. Sharof has already had two loans, and demonstrated himself as an honest client, and he promises to repay the current loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase flour for baking the national bread “lepeshka”

loans.name: Wiliamo José

texts.pt:
Wiliamo is 26 years old and is a native of Namaacha, a town on the border with Swaziland, where he lives today. Wiliamo is married and has a 6 year old daughter. He lives in his own home with his parents and his 6 younger brothers. His mother and his wife are both unemployed, and his brothers are in school. His daughter is not in school because the school she would be able to attend is very far from home.

Wiliamo went to school until the 10th grade and abandoned his studies to search for work so he could care for his family, principally for his brothers since he lost his father very early and his mother has been without work for a long time. Wiliamo works for the local radio station named Cascata 9.5FM from 5:50am to 2:00pm on Tuesdays and Thursdays and the rest of the days he works from 2:00pm until 5:00pm.

As a journalist for more than 6 years, Wiliamo is a permanent employee and receives a monthly salary of 1,500MTn. To help increase his monthly income Wiliamo also works for himself excavating stones that are used on walls or as house decorations...etc. Besides this Wiliamo is also President of the Association of BeeKeepers of the District of Namaacha.

Since his stone business wasn't very busy he decided to open a small store to sell drinks and basic staple products. Through his brother's influence who already had a store, Wiliamo opened his store in the region where he lives because according to him there is a lack of stores. The product that has the most sell through is corn flour that he sells for 25MTn per kilo. Wiliamo has a monthly income of approximately 2,000MTn and is able to save between 300MTn and 500MTn per month. This will be the second loan that Wiliamo has with Hluvuku, however it is the first with Kiva.

With the first loan he purchased materials to assist with the excavation of stone. With this loan of 10,000MTn he intends to restock his store with products thus increasing his sales and his income. Wiliamo dreams of improving his business and helping his community by reducing the distance to procure staple products.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Wiliamo tem 26 anos de idade e é natural de Namaacha, uma vila na fronteira com a Swazilandia onde vive ate hoje. Wiliamo é casado e pai de uma filha de 6 anos. Vive em sua própria casa com seus pais e seus 6 irmãos mais novos. A mãe e sua esposa estão desempregadas e os irmãos estudam exceto a sua filha porque pela idade a escola que poderia freqüentar se encontra muito distante da casa. Wiliamo estudo até 10ª classe, e abandonou os estudos para procurar emprego de forma a cuidar da família, principalmente dos irmãos uma vez que perdeu o pai muito sedo e a mãe ficou por muito tempo desempregada. Wiliamo trabalha na radio local de nome Cascata 9.5FM com horário das 5:50h as 14:00h nas terças e quartas feiras e o resto dos dias trabalha das 14:00h as 17:00h. Como jornalista faz mais de 6 anos, Wiliamo é funcionário permanente e recebe um salário mensal de MTn 1,500. Para ajudar a aumentar o seu rendimento mensal, Wiliamo também faz por conta própria a extração de pedra que se usa como langes nas paredes para decorações de casas etc. Alem disso, Wiliamo é também presidente da Associação de Apicultores do Distrito de Namaacha. Como o negocio de extração de pedras não era freqüente, Wiliamo decidiu abrir uma pequena loja para vender bebidas e produtos de necessidade básica. Por influencia de seu irmão que já tinha uma loja, Wiliamo abriu a sua loja na região em que mora, dado que segundo Wiliamo é uma zona com falta de lojas. O produto com mais saída é a farinha de milho, que vende por MTn 25 o kilo. Wiliamo tem um rendimento mensal de aproximadamente MTn 2,000 e consegue poupar entre MTn 300 e MTn 500 por mês. Este será o segundo empréstimo de Wiliamo com a Hluvuku, porem o primeiro com o Kiva. Com o primeiro empréstimo comprou materiais para auxiliar na extração de pedras. Com este empréstimo de MTn 10,000 pretende reforçar a mercadoria de sua loja, aumentando assim as vendas e seu rendimento. Wiliamo tem com sonho melhorar o seu negocio ajudando a sua comunidade reduzindo as distancias a procura de produtos da primeira necessidade.

loans.use: Purchase goods for his store

loans.name: Mouna Market 2012-5 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Rose M., who makes a weekly profit of about 240 Sudanese pounds from her business of selling water at the hotel and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Rose is 20 years old, married to a policeman, and the mother of two children, ages four and eight, both of whom attend school.

Rose is joined in her small group by Susan J., Nanjina A., Charity A., and Viola Roben. Susan J. sells green vegetables and wants to buy a bicycle to more efficiently conduct her business. Nanjina A. operates a business selling text books and exercise books and seeks a loan to buy a photo-copying machine. Charity A. operates a business selling vegetables and wants to buy a grinding mill. Viola Roben is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to buy beds to resell.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar K. is a 41-year-old man who has been breeding calves for meat production and selling milk to the local people and milk factory since 1999. He lives with his family in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. As an Internally Displaced Person, Ilgar receives financial monthly support of $70 US from the government. But it does not cover the family's main needs. To improve his main source of income, Ilgar is applying for $1200 US to purchase two calves for $300 US each and one milk cow for $600 US.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and one milk cow

loans.name: Sapasui's Group

texts.en:
This group from Fatausi was started in April 2008 when Sapasui T., the group leader, heard the talk-back about microloans on the radio and spread the news to her neighbors. Their primary businesses are growing and selling taro and operating canteens. They work hard and they expect to pay off their first loan and get their second one.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guaranT. one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, equipments, food, drinks and stock for their businesses.

loans.name: Xavier Francisco

texts.pt:
Xavier is 33 years old and was born in the town of Matola (Province of Maputo). He is married and the father of 5 children, 2 girls and 3 boys. The oldest is a 15 year old girl and the youngest is 2. The first four are already in school. His parents also live with him in his house.

In 1984 Xavier moved to Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, because his father was transferred with his job. Xavier attended school until the 11th grade, and afterwards completed a course for assistant customs officer that lasted only 6 months. He worked in customs as a first category assistant customs officer and earned a monthly salary of 3,500MTn working from 7am to 8pm except on weekends.

Since his salary was not sufficient to sustain his family, Xavier decided to open a stand off his house where he could sell various products. Ones that stand out are rice that he buys for 14MTn and sells for 17.5MTn and drinks (beer that he buys for 21MTn and sells for 25MTn, and wine that he buys for 50MTn and sells for 85MTn.)

Xavier has a monthly income of approximately 2,500MTn and he saves a maximum of 1,000MTn. This is the second loan that he has taken from Hluvuku and the first from Kiva. The first was for 15,000MTn and was used to begin his selling activities. Xavier was able to pay it off early and returned to solicit this loan that will also to be used for growing his inventory and increasing his sales.

He has a dream to continue with his studies and in the first phase conclude with the middle level. Only with a higher level can he climb in his career and one day become a customs delegate.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Xavier tem 33 anos de idade e nasceu na vila da Matola (Província de Maputo). Xavier é casado e pai de 5 filhos, sendo duas meninas e três rapazes. A maior é uma menina de 15 anos e o mais novo tem 2 anos. Os quatros primeiros já vão a escola. Em sua casa vivem também os seus pais. Em 1984 Xavier mudou-se para Namaacha, uma vila na fronteira com a Swazilandia porque seu pai foi transferido no trabalho. Xavier estudou ate a 11a classe, e depois fez um curso de auxiliar aduaneiro nas alfândegas que durou apenas 6 meses. Xavier trabalha nas alfândegas como auxiliar aduaneiro de primeira categoria e aufere um salário mensal de MTn 3,500, trabalhando das 7:00h as 20:00h excepto nos finais de semana. Como o salário não era suficiente para sustentar sua família, Xavier decidiu abrir uma barra no recinto da casa onde vende produtos diversos da primeira necessidade. Destaca-se o arroz ngonhama que compra por MTn 14 e vende por MTn 17.50 e as bebidas (cervejas, que compra por MTn 21 e vende por MTn 25, e vinhos, que compra por MTn 50 e vende por MTn 85). Xavier tem um rendimento liquido mensal de aproximadamente MTn 2,500 e poupa deste no máximo MTn 1,000. Este é o segundo empréstimo de Xavier na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro foi de MTn 15,000 e foi usado para iniciar as atividades de vendas. Xavier conseguiu pagar antes do tempo e voltou a solicitar este que também destina o para ampliar o estoque e aumentar suas vendas. Tem como sonho continuar com os estudos e numa primeira fase concluir o nível médio. Somente com nível superior Xavier poderá subir em sua carreira e um dia se tornar delegado alfandegário.

loans.use: To purchase inventory to sell in his store

loans.name: Potma

texts.en:
A. Potma is 49 years old. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a taxi driver, and they are both loving parents. Potma and her husband are working hard to ensure the future for their children.

Potma has her own business for 15 years already. She started as the seller of clothing. Gradually she was becoming more involved in this business and dreaming to open her own trading place. Now she sells men's suits, coats, trousers and shirts in the central local market. Potma’s elder daughter, who is pictured on the photo, helps her with the business. Potma is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify the range of goods to satisfy the needs of the clients with the various levels of income.

The business is stable, allowing Potma to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. Her children are growing up and their expenses are increasing. Thus she wants to develop her business. With this purpose, Potma requests 1600 Somoni (475 $ US Dollars) for purchasing new modern suits and shirts for selling. The loan will be repaid within 4 months. Potma thanks all supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to increase her stock

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur A., 46, breeds calves for meat production in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field. It is very hard to cover the family needs of his wife and four children, as Seymur is unemployed and receives only monthly financial support of $70 US from the government. His main source of income does not bring him enough of a profit to expand this business. Seymur is applying for $1000 US to purchase three calves, at $300 US each, and fodder to speed up their growth.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en: Iskandar B.  became a client of MicroInvest earlier this year, and has quickly proved himself to be a capable and serious businessman. He made good use of a previous loan to increase his income and expand his business.  Mr. B. lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan, and is married with four children. He makes a living raising livestock, including cows, bulls and several rams. His wife helps him care for the animals and sell their produce. Mr. B. has applied to Kiva for a loan to further expand his business by buying one more pedigree bull.

loans.use: to buy a pedigree bull.

loans.name: Vali

texts.en: Vali K. was born in 1960 in the J.Ismoil region of Tajikistan. He is married and has five children. For the last 30 years, he has made a living raising livestock. He also works in the local collective farm, but this is not his main occupation. Mr. K. has three brothers, all of whom also raise livestock for a living. Mr. K. has a good herd which consists of three cows and one bull, and would like to try the business of raising and selling rams. He has applied for a loan, which he will pay back in six months, to make this possible.

loans.use: to buy rams

loans.name: Abduvahid

texts.en:
D. Abduvahid is 39 years old. He is married with six children. Abduvahid’s wife is a housekeeper and she is taking care of their children. Abduvahid is the main bread-winner in the family

Abduvahid sells dried fruits in the central local market. He has been in this business for 16 years. The dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan. All hostesses have dried fruits in store for serving, in case there are guests in the house. Moreover, the dried fruits are as a rule served during all the family occasions like wedding parties, birthday parties and others. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, the business is quite successful and brings stable income for the family. Now Abduvahid wants to increase the stock of his goods to be able to supply all the demands of his buyers.

With this purpose, Abduvahid requests 3400 Somoni (1000 $ US Dollars) for the term of 10 months. He is going to spend the loan to purchase dried fruits like raisins, apricots and nuts (almonds and pistachios) with the purpose of increasing the range of goods to sell. Abduvahid has already proved himself to be a good client with a positive credit history, and now he also would like to thank all for support, and to promise to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruits like raisins, apricots, and almonds, and pistachios in order to increase the variety of goods for selling.

loans.name: Gulasal

texts.en:
M. Gulasal is 53 years old. She is married with five children.

Gulasal sells dried fruits in the central local market. She has been in this business already for 11 years and has gained rich experience in this business. In Tajikistan people are extremely hospitable. When there are visitors, every hostess serves the national bread, “lepeshka,” tea, candies, and dried fruits. Thus, dried fruits have always found a market, and day by day the price for this kind of fruits is raising. Gulasal tries to have a wide range of goods, and serves the clients with a smile. The business is stable and generates a considerable income for the family.

Today Gulasal requests 3400 Somoni (1000 $ US Dollars) for the term of 10 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing dried fruits like raisins, apricots and almonds, pistachios, and peanuts for increasing the variety of goods for selling. Having proved herself as a reliable client, Gulasal promises to pay the current loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruits like raisins, apricots, almonds, pistachios, and peanuts to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Gani

texts.en: Gani K. was born in 1958 in the J.Ismoil region of Tajikistan. He is married and has four children. For the last 40 years, Mr. K. has made a living raising livestock. He also works on a collective farm, but this is not his main occupation. Mr. K., whose three brothers who also raise livestock, has a good herd made up of six rams and one cow. He dreams of having a larger flock, and has applied for a Kiva loan to buy a pedigreed bull to make this possible. He will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: to buy a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Yegane

texts.en: Yegane B. is 38 years old. She breeds calves for meat production in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. Married and with three sons, Yegane has bred calves for more than fifteen years. She applied for $800 US to purchase two calves for $300 US each and fodder with the remaining money.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif A. is a 52-year-old man who breeds sheep in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of the Bilasuvar region and who has more than 20 years of experience in this field. He is married and has four children. Arif applied for $1200 US to purchase 20 sheep. This will help to improve his life condition because summer is a good time to increase his income. It is the high season for wedding parties in Azerbaijan and mutton as the main meal is very popular.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad K. was born in 1984 in the Ismoil region of Tajikistan. He is married and has six children. For the last 10 years, Mr. K. has raised livestock and worked in a collective farm. But his main business is raising livestock, and he does this by helping his father, who has six rams and one cow. Mr. K. dreams of one day having his own large herd, and has applied for a loan to build a barn to house his family's animals. He will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: to build a barn to house his livestock

loans.name: Enosse Fernando

texts.pt:
Enosse is 41 years old and he is from the province of Inhambane. Currently, he lives in Namaacha, a village in the province of Maputo which borders Swaziland. Enosse is married and is the father of 2 children -- both are students, the oldest is 13 years old and the youngest is 10 years old. Enosse lives in his own home with his wife, children, a cousin and a nephew. In 1987, he left the province of Inhambe for Maputo to look for work. There, he worked for a company that closed down after two years. Six months later another investor decided to reopen the company and rehired some of the previous employees including Enosse. He took the job because at that time he still had not found employment anywhere else. This business also failed after three years but this time the employees received a severance reward payment. With this reward money Enosse purchased a vehicle and started a chicken raising business. For four years Enosse would raise the chickls for 21 days and then sell them to slaughter houses. However, with the increase in the price of the feed, he decided to let go of that venture and keep his passengers transportation business only, which he achieved by using the vehicle he bought with severance reward. In 2004, he went back into the chicken raising business since prices were once again affordable. Nowadays, Enosse raises at least 400 chicks at a time. According to him the best results come from selling the chicken already slaughtered. He has been selling about 150 chickens every month to the Financial Department of the Namaacha District. The sale of live chickens is also lucrative. Enosse has generated a monthly income between MTN 3,000 and MTn 4,000 but he has not been able to save much due to high family expenses. This will be the second loan Enosse requests from Hluvuku and his fisrt through Kiva. With the first loan of MTn 7,000, Enosse purchased chicks and improved his business. This time, Enosse wants to apply the MTN 10,000 to purchase more chicks so that he can increase his flock and, therefore, profits. He will also fix the fencing which is old and need repairs. In the future Enosse wants to increase his chicken raising ability, purchase additional hens and buy a new vehicle to help transport and sell the chickens. His biggest dream, however, is to see his children graduate from college.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Enosse tem 41 anos de idade e é natural da província de Inhambane. Atualmente reside em Namaacha, uma vila na província de Maputo que faz fronteira com a Swazilandia. Enosse é casado e pai de 2 filhos, ambos estudantes sendo o maior com 13 anos e caçula com 10 anos de idade. Enosse vive na própria casa juntos com a sua esposa, seus filhos, um primo e uma sobrinha. Em 1987 saiu da província de Inhambane para Maputo a procura de emprego onde começa a trabalhar numa empresa que dois anos depois faliu. Assim seis meses depois houve outro empresário que decide abrir e chamar os antigos trabalhadores e ele foi um deles, já que não tinha arranjado ainda outro emprego. Este negocio também fechou 3 anos depois, mas desta vez indenizou os trabalhadores. Com o valor desta indenização Enosse comprou uma viatura e começou também com o negocio de criação de frangos de corte. Por quatro anos Enosse criava os frangos por 21 dias e vendia para outros criadores fazerem o abate. Porem, com a rápida elevação dos preços da ração, decide abandonar o negocio de criação de pintos e focar somente no transporte semi-coletivo de passageiro usando a viatura comprada pelo valor da indenização. Em 2004 decide voltar com a criação de frangos dado que os preços já estavam mais acessíveis. Enosse cria atualmente no mínimo 400 frangos de uma só vez. O melhor negocio segundo Enosse é vender já o frango abatido: tem vendido uns 150 frangos por mês para o Departamento de Finanças do Distrito de Namaacha. Porem a venda de frangos vivos também é lucrativa. Enosse tem tido um rendimento mensal entre MTn 3,000 e MTn 4,000 e não consegue poupar muito devido as despesas familiares. Este será o segundo empréstimo de Enosse com a Hluvuku, porem o primeiro com o Kiva. Com o primeiro empréstimo de MTn 7,000 Enosse comprou pintos e melhorou o seu negocio. Agora Enosse pretende usar os MTn 10,000 para novamente comprar pintos, aumentando a criação e os lucros. Assim conseguira reabilitar as capoeiras que já são antigas e precisam de reparos. No futuro Enosse gostaria de aumentar a sua criação de pintos, começar a criar poedeiras e comprar uma nova viatura para facilitar as vendas dos frangos. Seu maior sonho, porem, é ver um dia seus filhos formados na universidade.

loans.use: Purchase chicks for raising.

loans.name: Candido Herculano

texts.pt:
Candido is 55 years old and he is from the province of Inhambane. He was never married. Candido has 12 children: 6 girls and 6 boys. He lives with 5 of them with ages between 5 and 14 years old. The other and oldest ones are all employed and have their own families. Candido is also responsible for his parents who still live in Inhambane; he sends them MTn 600 every month. In 1974, Candido decided to go to Namaacha, a village from the province of Maputo which borders Swaziland, to look for work. He was hired as a permanent teacher there because he had completed high school plus a 2-year education training program. Candido has worked in the same school for 33 years as a teacher and also as a principal. He works from 6:45am until 12:10pm and then from 3:30pm until 6:30pm earning a monthly salary of MTn 8,015. The maximum he has been able to save from that is MTn 2,000 but this does not happen frequently. This is Candido's first loan request from Hluvuku and Kiva. Candido already lives in his own home but he is building a second one for his children and his second wife. After hearing about Hluvuku from friends, Candido decided to make the request in the amount of MTn 10,000 that will help in the construction. He wishes to purchase more material and speed up the work. The greatest dream Candido has is the completion of his children's education, preferably at the university level.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Candido tem 55 anos de idade e é natural da província de Inhambane. Solteiro porque nunca casou oficialmente, Candido tem 12 filhos, 6 meninas e 6 rapazes, mas vive somente com 5 deles, com idades entre 14 e 5 anos. Os mais velhos já são empregados e tem suas famílias. Alem disso, Candido tem sob sua responsabilidade os pais que ainda moram em Inhambane, enviando-lhes mensalmente MTn 600. Em 1974 Candido decide ir a Namaacha, uma vila na província de Maputo e na fronteira com a Swazilandia, a procura de emprego. Foi contratado como professor permanente por já ter concluído o ensino médio e a formação de professores de 2 anos. Candido trabalha na mesma escola como professor, e hoje em dia como diretor também, fazem 33 anos. Trabalha das 6:45h as 12:10h e das 15:30h as 18:30h e recebe um salário mensal de MTn 8,015. Candido consegue poupar no máximo MTn 2,000 por mês, mas não frequentemente. Este será o primeiro empréstimo de Candido com a Hluvuku e com Kiva. Candido já mora em sua própria casa, mas esta construindo uma segunda casa para seus filhos e segunda mulher. Apos ouvir sobre a Hluvuku com colegas de trabalho, Candido decidiu pedir este empréstimo de MTn 10,000 para ajudar na construção. Pretende comprar material de construção e acelerar a obra. Candido tem como grande sonho na vida a formação dos seus filhos, preferencialmente na universidade.

loans.use: Purchase construction material.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Jose is 41 years old and he is from Catembem, a fishers' village located 10 minutes away by barge from the capital Maputo. Jose is married and is the father of 5 children: 3 girls and 2 boys. The odest one is 15 years old and the youngest is only 5 months old. The three oldest ones go to school. Besides his wife and children, Jose also supports a 9-year-old nephew that lives with him. Jose attended school up until the 7th grade when he joined the army for serve a mandatory tour. He was in military service for 5 years until 1987. FOr the next 5 years he worked with agriculture and in 1992 he started to work for the Caminhos Ferreos Moambique (CFM) -- a Mozambique's rail company. where he still works earning a monthly salary of MTn 3,500 as an operator. Jose lives in a house built with local materials. With this loan he plans on improving his family's housing conditions by building one using masonry. With this loan he will purchase construction materials and he will the wait for a second loan in order to start building his house. This will be Jose's fourth loan with Hluvuku. The prior three loans were used to build his mother's home and they were paid back without any difficulties. He dreams about building a house made of out masonry and, in the future, buying a vehicle. Since Jose lives in a community located 45 minutes away from his mother house, he believes this vehicle will make it easier for him to visit her. Besides that, one of his daughters will have to move in with her grandmother because the local school does not offer high school classes and she will be in tenth grade two years from now.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Jose tem 41 anos de idade e é natural da Catembe, uma vila de pescadores a 10 minutos de balsa da capital Maputo. Jose é casado maritalmente e pai de 5 filhos, sendo 3 meninas e 2 meninos. O mais velho tem 15 anos e o mais novo 5 meses. Os 3 mais velhos já vão para a escola. Alem de sua esposa e filhos, Jose sustenta também um sobrinho de 9 anos que vive com ele. José estudou até 7ª classe e não continuou porque integrou o serviço militar obrigatório, onde permaneceu durante 5 anos ate 1987. Durante 5 anos dedicou trabalhar com agricultura de subsistência e 1992 começa a trabalhar nos Caminhos de Ferro de Moçambique (CFM), onde trabalha até a data hoje auferindo um salário mensal de MTn 3,500 como operador de manobras. José vive na casa própria de material local. Com este empréstimo pretende melhorar as condições habitacionais da família, construindo uma casa de alvenaria. Com este primeiro empréstimo vai comprar material de construção, e aguardara um segundo empréstimo para começar a edificar a casa. Este será o 4º empréstimo de Jose com a Hluvuku. Os três primeiros foram usados para construir a casa de sua mãe, e foram pagos sem dificuldades. Tem como sonho construir a sua casa de alvenaria e futuramente comprar uma viatura. Como Jose vive noutra comunidade que dista a 45 km da casa da mãe, pretende com a viatura facilitar as visitas. Alem disso, em breve a sua filha vai residir com a avo por que localmente não tem o nível secundário caso ela passe da 10ª classe daqui a dois anos.

loans.use: Purchase cosntruction material.

loans.name: Rabeca

texts.pt:
Rabeca is 28 years old and she is from Matutine, in the province os Maputo. She is married and mother of 3 children with ages ranging from 1 through 10 years old. Rabeca lives with her husband, her children and two stepsons. Rabeca worked as a housekeeper for a while and later she got a position as a janitor with T.D.M (Mozambique Telecommunications), where she was paid a monthly salary of MNt 1,400. Her husband started remodeling their house but he grew wary of it and Rabeca decided to request this loan to keep the construction moving forward using locally produced construction materials. Rabeca requests her first loan in the amonut of MTn 8,000 to purchase material for this construction. She is certain she will be able to pay back the loan since their living expenses are still her husband's sole responsibility. One of Rabeca's greatest dream is to finish remodeling and to buy furniture for her house. Rabeca plans on requesting another loan to open up a basic products retail business in front of the house so that she can make her dream of purchasing furniture to her home come true.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Rabeca tem 28 anos de idade e é natural de Matutuine, na província do Maputo. Casada maritalmente, Rabeca é mãe de 3 filhos, com idades entre 10 anos e 1 ano de idade. Rabeca vive com o seu marido, os 3 filhos e dois enteados. Rabeca trabalhou como empregada domestica durante um tempo, mas depois conseguiu um emprego como faxineira da T.D.M. (Telecomunicações de Moçambique), onde recebe um salário mensal de MTn 1,400. Seu marido começou a construção de sua casa, mas depois se desinteressou, e por isso Rabeca decide pedir este empréstimo para continuar a construção da casa com material local. Rabeca pede o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku de MTn 8,000 para comprar material local de construção. Ela tem certeza que conseguira pagar o empréstimo, dado que as despesas da casa ainda são de responsabilidade do marido. Constitui grande sonho para Rabeca ver a casa concluída e mobiliada. Assim que concluir este empréstimo e ver sua casa pronta, Rabeca pretende pedir outro empréstimo para abrir um pequeno negocio de venda de produtos da primeira necessidade em frente de casa, com vista a realizar mais cedo o sonho de mobiliar a casa.

loans.use: Purchase construction material.

loans.name: Erkinboy

texts.en: Erkinboy K. is 42 years old, married and has six children. He began working with MicroInvest earlier this year, and has shown himself to be a reliable and hard-working client who knows how to use his loans. Mr. K. and his brother raise livestock and are known locally for having a good flock of rams and one milk cow. In order to raise more livestock, Mr. K. wants to buy a pedigreed bull, and has applied to Kiva for a loan to make this possible. He will repay the loan in six months, and is committed to grow the size of his herd.

loans.use: to buy a pedigree bull

loans.name: Mirzoaly

texts.en: Mr. Mirzoaly M. does not have a lot of formal education, but 30 years of working with livestock has made him very experienced in this trade. Like many people in his village, he has a big, well-cared-for flock and would love to own a large farm. The farm he owns today is a family business in which he wife works with him to care for their animals, and his children sell milk and yarn produced at home. Mr. M. has a good reputation and is widely known as a very hard-working man and a loving father of six children. Mr. M. dreams of giving a good education to his sons and helping his daughters have successful marriages, and is committed to work hard to make that happen. Mr. M. has applied for a loan from Kiva to build a new barn in which to house his cows.

loans.use: to build a new barn in which to house his cows.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurn M. is a subsistence farmer in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Hoeurn M. is also a traditional healer. She is a widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the one other is studying in state school. Mrs. Hoeurn M.’s family members have different business activities, but they cannot afford to build a new house to replace the old one. Mrs. Hoeurn M. is requesting a loan so she can build a new house. Previously, Mrs. Hoeurn M. obtained a loan from AMK for a breeding cow.

loans.use: For home construction

loans.name: Chhovon

texts.en: Mrs. Chhovon C. is 37 and a subsistence farmer in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Chhovon C. obtained a loan from Prassac Co., Ltd to buy  part of a rice field. Now, her plantation business needs a draft animal. Mrs. Chhovon C. is requesting a loan to buy a second cow to plow her rice field more efficiently. Her husband, Mr. Sam At Im, is a farmer. They have five children, three of whom are attending a local school while the two others are too young to work or enroll in school.

loans.use: To buy a second cow for rice field plowing

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon K. is a subsistence farmer in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Her rice revenue is very small because Mrs. Lon K. the plot of cultivatable land she owns is very small. She now wants to expand her plantation. Mrs. Lon K. is requesting a loan to buy a part of rice field to grow rice and vegetables. Besides farming, Mrs. Lon K. sews a palm leaves together to re-sell for a profit. Mrs. Lon K. is 47 and a widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the two others are attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy a part of rice field for growing rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Munirahon

texts.en: Munirahon M. is 22 years old and has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. When she started her business, she sold clothing door to door, but now she sells children's clothing at the local bazaar. She does very well there and has lots of customers because she imports her clothing from China, which gives her a significant cost advantage over her competitors.  Mrs. M.  has applied for a loan from Kiva to meet the demands of her customers and buy new seasonal apparel. She will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: to import new seasonal clothing

loans.name: Gam A 2021-3 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Zebeda J., who is in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to construct a swimming pool at her home. Married to a policeman, Zebeda is 35 years old and the mother of three children ranging from age 2 to 20 who all attend school. Each week Zebeda makes approximately 200 Sudanese pounds in profits, and her goal is to expand the business.

Zebeda is joined in her small group by Susan Y., Esther K., Antonata S., and Mary K.. Susan Y. has a business selling charcoal and wants to buy goats for rearing. Esther K. sells charcoal and other goods including milk and sweets at her shop and wants a loan to expand her business. Antonata S. operates a business selling green vegetable and wants to create a small irrigation system for the farm. Mary K. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To construct a swimming pool at her home.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. is a Khmer cake seller in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Dun Mork, is a construction worker. They have two children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the other is studying in state school. Although Mrs. Chea S.’s family members work hard, they are still in a poor condition. Mrs. Chea S. wishes to start a plantation business, so she is requesting a loan so she obtain land for this purpose

loans.use: To buy a part of a rice field

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim U. lives in Trang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Mrs. Sim U. is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the two others are enrolledd in school. She sells Khmer cake that she makes. She is also a farmer. She is requesting a loan to buy a second cow so she can plow her field.

loans.use: To buy a second cow

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim S. is Khmer cake seller in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 36 and a widow with two children, both of whom are staying at home to help their mother's business. The whole family now relies on Mrs. Yim S. and the family is in poor financial circumstances.  They live in an old house and during the rainy season the roof always leaks. Mrs. Yim S. is requesting a loan to buy zinc sheet metal to replace the old roof.

loans.use: To buy zinc sheet metal to replace the old roof

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Mr. Von V. is a subsistence farmer in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Sambath Nhem, is a grocer in the local market. Mrs. Sambath Nhem's business is doing well, so she wants to expand it. Mr. Von V. is requesting a loan to buy more stock for his wife's grocery business. Mr. Von V. and his wife have a child who is a garment worker.

loans.use: To buy more stock for grocery store

loans.name: Abdushukur

texts.en: S. Abdushukur is not highly educated, but he is very skilled at raising livestock, a field he has been active in for the last 30 years. Like many of his neighbors, he raises and trades farm animals, has a good, well-cared-for flock and dreams of enlarging his farm. This is a family business, and his wife helps him in his work and his children sell and trade milk and yarn produced on the farm. Mr. Abdushukur has a good reputation among his neighbors, and is thought of as a very hard-working man and loving father of five. Above all, he would like to give his children a good education, and that is the reason why he works so hard. He has applied to Kiva for a loan to develop his business by buying a pedigree bull and building a barn to house his cows.  He will repay the loan in 8 months.

loans.use: to buy a pedigree bull and build a new barn to house his cows.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong S. lives in Krang Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a subsistence farmer and a vegetable seller. She also sells fish. Her husband, Mr. Pin Boch, is a farmer and a construction worker. They have three children, two of whom are attending a local school while the youngest one is too young to work or enroll in school. The whole family relies on Mrs. Kong S. and her husband. They would like to build a new house to replace an old one, and are requesting a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy more lumber to build a house.

loans.name: Saifudin

texts.en: Mr. R. Saifudin was born in 1958 in the Utkansoi region of Tajikistan and is married with five children. His family was not able to provide him with a higher education, but he has raised and sold livestock for the past 40 years and is very skilled at it. Mr. Saifudin has applied to Kiva for a loan to expand his business by buying a new bull. This is his second loan through MicroInvest. He used his first loan, which he received earlier this year, for the same purpose of expanding his business.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying a pedigree bull

loans.name: Tuima

texts.en: Tuima K. lives in the Taboshar region of Tajikistan with her husband and five children. For the past 40 years, she has supported herself and her family by raising livestock and using their milk to make various products. She learned this trade from her mother and is very good at it.  Mrs. K. has applied to Kiva for a loan that she will use to buy a new cow. She plans to pay the loan back in six months.

loans.use: To buy a cow for milking.

loans.name: Zendia A 2008-2 Group

texts.en:
Patriselda T., 45 years old and married to a teacher, is the leader of this small group. She is in the business of selling charcoal, earning approximately 200 Sudanese pounds in profits each week. She is now requesting a loan to pay the school fees of her two children, aged 6 and 20.

Patriselda is joined in her group by Joice J., Marlina M., Lina D., and Sara D.. Joice J. sells charcoal and vegetables and wants to expand her business. Marlina M. operates a business selling vegetables at the market and wants a loan to open up a clinic. Lina D. sells bread and cool water and wants to expand her shop. Sara D. currently sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Sothyma

texts.en: Mrs. Sothyma N. is a beefsteak seller in Andoung Snay Village in Kampong Chhnang. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is an accountant officer while the two others are attending school. Mrs. Sothyma N. obtained a loan from AMK to start her business. She is requesting a second loan to buy a piece of village land for re-sale at a profit. This will increase her income and help her family.

loans.use: To buy a part of village land for re-sell

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru:
Sadullo N. is married and has 5 children. He works at the regional market. He has a place where he sells building materials. He is a retail salesman. Now is the season when demand is high, and Sadullo needs to be able to buy more goods by obtaining a loan. This will help attract new clients and bring additional profit, which his family needs. To achieve his goal, Sadullo needs to obtain a loan. He plans to repay it within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Нарзуллоев Саъдулло женат, имеет пятерых детей. Работает на рынке района . Имеет торговую точку, где торгует стройматериалами. Продает в розницу. Но в сезон продаж ему необходимо увеличить товарооборот, путем получения кредита. Это поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов и принесет дополнительный доход, необходимый его семье. Для достижения цели он должен получить кредит, а погасить его в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: Mrs. N. Shoira was born in 1981 in the Taboshar region of Tajikistan, and is married and has one child. Her family was not able to give her a higher education, but she is very good at raising livestock, which she has been doing for the past five years. Mrs. Shoira makes various products from the milk produced by the animals she raises, and sells those products in the local bazaar, where she has many happy customers. Mrs. Shoira has applied to KIVA for a six-month loan that will allow her to buy equipment which she will use to make these products. This is her second loan from MicroInvest.

loans.use: To buy equipment needed to products from milk.

loans.name: Solehjon

texts.ru:
Solehjon N. is a teacher. He graduated from Tajik Pedagogical Institute. He does not work in his profession, but works in retail. He has a store at the market where he sells building materials. It is now the season when people fix their homes and begin building, which is why it is necessary for Solehjon to increase his sales and variety of goods. This will help raise his profits, which his family needs very much. Solehjon is married and has 5 children. This is why he does not have any personal savings, and receiving a loan would help him improve financial situation of the family. He plans to repay the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Нарзуллоев Солехджон педагог.Закончил Таджикский педагогический институт. По специальности не работает. А занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин на рынке, где продает строительные материалы. Сейчас сезон, когда люди делают ремонт и начинают стройки , поэтому ему необходимо увеличить товарооборот и ассортимент товара. Это поможет ему увеличить прибыль, которая так необходима его семье. Солехджон женат и имеет 5 детей. Поэтому своих сбережений он не имеет, а получение кредита очень помогло бы ему улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase variety of goods

loans.name: Zulayho

texts.ru:
Zulayho R. lives in the region of Shahrinau. She is married and has 5 children. Zulaiho finished high school. She sells dishes and other household items. Zulayho wants to repair her shop in order to improve the service. This will help attract new customers and receive additional profit. In order to do this, she needs a loan. Zulayho plans to pay back the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Рахмонова Зулайхо жительница района Шахринау , замужем и имеет 5 детей. Имеет среднее образование.Занимается торговлей . Имеет небольшой магазинчик рядом с домом. Торгует посудой и другими бытовыми предметами. Хочет отремонтировать магазан для того . чтобы улучшить условия обслуживания. Это поможет привлеч новых клиентов и получить дополнительную прибыль. Дляэтого необходимо получить кредит. Погасить его он планирует в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: To repair the shop

loans.name: Nermina

texts.en:
Nermina is a 19-year-old married woman. She is from the village Berkovići, near the town Lukavac. She is a housewife and has one 6-month-old child.

With this loan in the amount of 1,200 KM (Bosnian Marks) ($950), Nermina wants to buy cosmetic products and then sell them. Her husband has a full-time job, and sometimes works privately.

Nermina wants to fill her free time with this activity, because her husband is at work most of the day, and to contribute to her household's income.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
