Saida B. lives in Dushanbe. She is 57. She is married and has 3 children. She teaches in the Institute of Ecology. Her son is getting married, and she would like to receive a $1000 loan. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Бурхонова Саида жительница города Душанбе. Возраст 57 лет . Замужем , имеет троих детей. Образование высшее . Работает преподавателем в Институте экологии. Собираетсчя женить сына и поэтому хочет получить кредит в размере 1000 долларов США. Погасить кредит он планирует погасить в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Son's marriage

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and she lives with her in the village Tupkovići, near the town Živinice.

Like most women in this area, Jasmina does agriculture and in that way she can earn some money. Her husband has a full-time job, but his income is not enough for the two of them and their three children.

This is her third loan at MCO Zene za Zene (Women for Women) International and she intends to buy a heifer. Her wish is to fatten this heifer and then to sell it in order to earn some money.

loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.ru:
Abdulhakim I. lives in the Vakhsh region. He has a university diploma and works as a teacher in the middle school. He also works on his land. He plants watermelons and melons. He urgently needs to purchase equipment to water his land. This costs $1000 dollars. This is why he decided to come to us for a loan. After purchasing the equipment Abdulhakim will be able to water his land at any time. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months. Abdulhakim is married and has 3 children. They all live together and help each other.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Ишмуродов Абдулхаким житель района Вахш. Имеет высшее образование и работает учителем начальных классов в средней школе. Кроме того работает на своем участке. Сажает арбузы и дыни. Срочно необходимо купить мотор для полива земли. Но на это нужно1000 долларов США. Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам за кредитом. Купив мотор он облегчит себе труд и сможет в любое время поливать землю. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев. Абдулхаким женат и имеет 3 детей. Они все живут очень дружно и помогают друг другу.

loans.use: To purchase irrigation equipment

loans.name: Muzzafar

texts.ru:
Muzzafar H. is a farmer. He has already been practicing agriculture for two years, and he has several cows, whose milk he sells wholesale. Now he would like to buy another dairy cow, which will increase production and his profit. His business also helps secure access to fresh milk for local residents. In order to buy another cow, he decided to take out a loan. It will be paid back over a period of 12 months. Muzzafar is married with four children. The family is large and high spirited.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Холиков Музаффар –фермер. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 2 года. Имсеет несколько коров . Молоко , которых продает оптом. Хочет купить еще одну корову , которая будет давать молоко. Этим он увеличит объем получаемой продукции и соответственно прибыль. Кроме того его бизнес помогает населенгию приобретать свежее молоко. Но для того чтобы купить еще одну корову он решил воспользоваться кредитом , погасить который сможет в течении 12 месяцев.Музаффар женат и имеет 4 детей. Семья большая , но веселая.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru:
Umeda S. is a businesswoman, married but without children, who took up business three years ago to help her parents. She sells children’s clothing at her stall in central market of the Abdurahmon Jomi district. She has a very cheerful personality, and shows great friendliness toward her customers. Now she would like to increase the volume of sales at her stall, which will only be possible with the help of a loan. With a loan, she will be able to expand her range of goods. This will help her attract new customers and increase profit. She will repay the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Шодиева Умеда бизнесмен. Занялась бизнесом три года назад, для того , чтобы помогать родителям. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района Абдурахмони Джоми. Торгует детской одеждой. Сейчас хочет увеличить товарооборот, но для этого ей может помочь только кредит. Получив кредит она сможет завести новый ассортимент товара . Это поможет ей привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить свои доходы. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.Она очень жизнерадостна и добродушно относится к своим покупателям.

loans.use: Increase Sales Volume

loans.name: Jabeleu Emilio

texts.pt:
Jabeleu is 45 years old and he is from Boane, located in the province of Maputo. Jabeleu is married and has 10 children. The oldest is 21 years old and the youngest are 3-year-old twin brothers. All of them, except the oldest one, attend school. Jabeleu lives in his own house with his family, although 4 of his children only stay with him during school breaks, because they attend a live-in school. Jabeleu went to school up to the 12th grade e then he sought a technical degree in Public Management. Jubeleu stopped going to school to prioritizes his children's education. He worked for the state for a few years throughout 4 districts within the Maputo province. Since 2004 Jabeleu set up a small commercial establishment where he sells beverages and basic need products. The best selling product are the national beers. The 2M brand is sold for Mtn 23 each or MTn 230 per case. The Laurentina brand is sold for MTn 25 each or MTn 250 per case. Jabeleu generates MTn 9000 in sales and he is able to save MTN 3000 from that if he does not put too much back into the business. Jabeleu does not have any employees, help comes from his sons and daughters when they are not in school. This will be his second loan from Hluvuku, and his first through Kiva. The first loan in the amount MTn 15,000 was used to purchase merchandise, increase product stock for his commercial establishment so that monthly sales could be improved. In 2006 Jabeleu had already obtained a loan from another small business lender called Tchuma, but he was not happy with it because the credit was given to a group of borrowers. This loan of MTn 20,000 will be used to purchase construction materials to remodel his commercial establishment. Jabeleu wants to attract more students and, in the future, he intends to add a copying machine, a pool table and other games to the school. In the future, Jabeleu wishes to officially get married, improve his family living standards and also start a driving school.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Jabeleu tem 45 anos de idade e é natural de Boane na da província de Maputo. Jabeleu é casado maritalmente e pai de 10 filhos, sendo a mais velha com 21 anos e os menores gêmeos de 3 anos. Todos freqüentam a escola, com exceção da mais velha que já esta no lar. Jabeleu vive em sua própria casa com a família, porem 4 filhos só moram com ele nas ferias, porque estão estudando em internato. Jabeleu estudou até 12ª classe e depois seguiu uma formação técnica em Administração Publica. Jabeleu parou de estudar para dar prioridade a educação de seus filhos. Trabalhou para o estado por alguns anos, tendo andado por 4 distritos da província de Maputo. Desde 2004 Jabeleu abriu um pequeno estabelecimento comercial onde vende bebidas e produtos de necessidade básica. Os produtos mais vendidos são as cervejas nacionais: a 2M é vendida por MTn 23 a unidade e MTn 230 a caixa, a Laurentina é vendida por MTn 25 a unidade e MTn 250 a caixa. Jabeleu tem um rendimento mensal de aproximadamente MTn 9,000, dos quais consegue poupar uns MTn 3,000 caso não invista muito no estabelecimento comercial. Jabeleu não tem empregados, conta somente com a ajuda de seus filhos quando estes não estão na escola. Este será o segundo empréstimo de Jabeleu com Hluvuku, primeiro com o Kiva. O primeiro empréstimo de MTn 15,000 foi usado para compra de mercadoria, para aumentar o estoque do estabelecimento comercial e assim aumentar as vendas. Em 2006 Jabeleu já havia contado com um empréstimo de outra instituição de microfinanças chamada Tchuma, mas como os créditos eram em grupo não gostou muito. Este empréstimo de MTn 20,000 será usado para comprar material de construção para reformar o estabelecimento comercial. Jabeleu quer atrair mais estudantes, e pretende no futuro colocar uma foto-copiadora, uma mesa de bilhar e um jogo de matrequilha. No futuro Jabeleu gostaria de casar-se oficialmente, melhorar as condições de vida de sua família e também fundar uma escola de condução.

loans.use: Purchase construction material to remodel commercial establishment.

loans.name: Jeremias Mauli

texts.pt:
Jeremias is 33 years old, and a native of Boane, a town in the province of Maputo, 30 km from the capital. He is married and has three children, ages, 11, 8, and 6. All three attend school. Jeremias completed high school at IMAP in Matola, a town 10 km from Boane, and has worked as a teacher for 10 years. He currently teaches in the Escola dos Antigos Combatente in Boane from 7:00 to 12:30. He lives with his family in his own home, which is still under construction. The construction was financed by loans.

Previously, Jeremias received a loan in the amount of 10,000 MZN from another microfinance institution named Pro-Credito. It was after he completed this loan and after he heard about Hluvuku from friends that he decided to pursue a loan from Hluvuku, which is closer to his home and work. Jeremias’s first Hluvuku loan was for 10,200 MZN, and it was also used for home construction. This will be his second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. With the amount of 13,000 MZN, he plans to buy more construction materials and continue his dream of one day finishing his home. In the future, Jeremias would like to furnish his home and also build a wall around the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer.

Jeremias tem 33 anos de idade e é natural de Boane, uma vila a 30Km de distancia da capital Maputo na província Maputo. Jeremias é casado maritalmente e pai de três filhos: primeiro com 11 anos, o segundo com 8 anos e caçula com 6 anos. Todos vão a escola. Jeremias completou o ensino médio no IMAP da Matola (vila a 10Km de Boane) e trabalha como professor fazem 10 anos. Atualmente dá aulas na Escola dos Antigos Combatente em Boane das 7:00h as 12:30h. Jeremias vive em sua própria casa com sua família, casa esta ainda em construção a base de empréstimos. Primeiramente Jeremias contou com um empréstimo de outra instituição de microfinanças chamada Pro-Credit no valor de MTn 10,000. Foi apos a conclusão deste empréstimo e apos ouvir sobre a Hluvuku por amigos que decidiu pedir um empréstimo na Hluvuku que era mais perto de sua casa e trabalho. O primeiro empréstimo de Jeremias na Hluvuku foi de MTn 10,200 e também foi usado para a construção da casa. Este será o segundo empréstimo de Jeremias na Hluvuku, e o primeiro no Kiva. Com o valor de MTn 13,000 pretende comprar mais material de construção e continuar o seu sonho de um dia terminar a casa. No futuro Jeremias gostaria de construiu um muro ao redor de sua casa e também mobiliar a casa.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials for borrower's home

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru:
Tohir Q. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is a middle school teacher, and has been working for many years, but his salary is so small that he must make extra money on the side. He has been working in retail sales for seven years. His business helps him support his family – he is married with two children. He would like to expand the range of goods at his market stall, to increase his customer base and make needed goods available in this area, which is far from the city. To do this he decided to get a loan, which he will repay over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Кайнаров Тохир житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Учитель в средней школе. Работает уже много лет , но заработная плата очень маленькая , поэтому ему приходится подрабатывать. Уже семь лет . как он занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. И этот бизнес помогает ему обеспечивать свою семью. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Хочет завести на свою торговую точку другой ассортимент товара, для того , чтобы увеличить количество клиентов , а так же обеспечить рынок дальнего от города района наобходимыми товарами. Для этого он запланировал получить кредит , погасить который планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase range of goods

loans.name: Radojka

texts.en:
Radojka B. is a widow living in the small village of Plocniku.

She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 600 KM (Bosnian Marks) ($475) to support her small farming business, where she raises poultry and sells eggs.

Her business is her main income in addition to her pension. She has no children or spouse. Radojka plans to use the loan to expand her business and buy more chickens for fattening.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Bahtiyor I. lives in the Kolhozabad district. He is 39 years old, married with 2 children, and has finished college. He is a taxi driver, but also raises animals. This side business helps him earn additional income. A hot summer has caused problems with the animals’ feed supply. Hay is expensive, and stocking up on it requires money. So this entrepreneur decided to take out a loan. He will repay it over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Ибрагимов Бахтиер житель района Коллхозабад. Возраст 39 лет , женат и имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее. Работает таксистом. Кроме того занимается животноводством .Параллельный бизнес помогает ему получать дополнительный доход. В связи с жарким летом возникла проблема с кормом для животных. Покупка сена стоит дорого, а для того , чтобы запастись сеном нужны деньги. Для этого клиент планирует получить кредит. Погасить его он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Feed Purchase

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
Jorge is 51 years old and is originally from the district of Matola in the province of Maputo. He is married and has 6 children: the oldest is 31 years old and the youngest is 13. At the moment only 4 of his children go to school. Jorge lives in his own house with his family and two grandchildren.

He attended middle school until the 6th grade but didn't continue his studies due to his parents' financial situation. He has worked as a permanent employee at the reception desk of the IAB (Instituto Agrário de Boane - Agricultural Institute of Boane) for 20 years.

This will be Jorge's third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He used his first loan of 5,000 MZN to buy construction material to begin the expansion of his house. His second loan of 7,800 MZN was used to buy a freezer. Jorge intends to use this third loan of 20,000 MZN to purchase construction materials and to pay stonemasons in order to continue extending his house. He has previously had a loan from another micro-lending organization named Tchuma, but he didn't like the group-lending scheme they operated.

In future, Jorge would like to build a small commercial establishment infront of his house so that his wife can sell drinks and everyday items, therefore suplementing the family's income. He will be counting on future loans from Hvuluku to do this.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Jorge tem 51 anos de idade e é natural do distrito da Matola, na província de Maputo. Jorge é casado oficialmente e pai de 6 filhos: o mais velho tem 31 anos de idade e o menor tem 13 anos. Atualmente somente 4 filhos vão a escola. Jorge vive em sua própria casa junto com a família e mais dois netos.

Jorge estudou até 6ª classe e não continuou mais devido as condições financeiras dos pais. Fazem 20 anos que trabalha como funcionário permanente do IAB (Instituto Agrário de Boane), onde é servente na secretaria.

Este será o terceiro empréstimo de Jorge na Hluvuku, porem o primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro empréstimo de MTn 5,000 Jorge usou para comprar material de construção e começar a expansão de sua casa. O segundo empréstimo de MTn 7,800 foi usado para a compra de um congelador. Jorge pretende usar este terceiro empréstimo de MTn 20,000 para continuar ampliar a sua casa, comprando material de construção e pagando os pedreiros. No passado Jorge já teve um empréstimo com outra instituição de microfinanças chamada Tchuma, mas como os créditos eram em grupo não gostou.

No futuro Jorge gostaria de construir um pequeno estabelecimento comercial em frente a sua casa para a sua esposa poder vender bebidas e produtos de necessidade básica, aumentando assim a renda da família. Para isso Jorge pretende sempre contar com os empréstimos da Hluvuku.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to extend his home.

loans.name: Julio Julião

texts.pt:
Julio is 29 years old and is from Manjacaze in the province of Gaza. He is married and is the father of 2 boys, the oldest of which is 9 and the youngest, 6. Only his oldest son goes to school as in Mozambique children don't start going to school until they are 7 years old.

In 1999 Julio and his family moved to Boane in the province of Maputo, looking for work and to better their quality of life. Initially, Julio worked as a traveling salesman, but in 2001 he decided to open his own stall in front of the main market in Boane. Julio sells various products such as household utensils and some clothes. His most popular products are plates (which he sells at 25 MZN each), spoons (which he sells at 10 MZN each) and drinking glasses (which he sells at between 12.5 MZN and 20 MZN). Julio goes to the capital of Maputo by bus twice a week to buy products. He earns between 300 MZN and 1,000 MZN a week, depending on the season and how much it rains. He earns around 7,800 MZN a month but has not yet managed to start saving any money as he has re-invested everything in his stall.

This will be his first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. Prior to this, Julio had a loan of 6,900 MZN from another microcredit institution named Pro-Credit. He used this money to expand his stall. Julio heard of Hluvuku from friends and chose to ask for a loan as Hluvuku is nearer his place of work.

Julio intends to grow and expand his commercial activities and one day build his own fixed store within the market.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer

Julio tem 29 anos e é natural de Manjacaze na província de Gaza. Julio é casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos, o mais velho tem 9 anos e o segundo tem 6 anos. Somente o primeiro estuda, dado que a idade inicial de estudo em Moçambique é 7 anos de idade.

Em 1999 Julio e sua família se mudaram para Boane na província de Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida, isto é, de trabalho. Inicialmente Julio trabalhava como vendedor ambulante, mas em 2001 decidiu ter sua própria banca na frente do mercado central de Boane. Julio vende produtos diversos como utensílios domésticos e algumas roupas. Os produtos mais vendidos são os pratos (vende a MTn 25 cada), colheres (vende a MTn 10 cada) e copos, que são vendidos entre MTn 12.5 e MTn 20. Julio vai 2 vezes por semana a capital Maputo para comprar produtos, utilizando-se dos mini-ônibus públicos. Julio tem um rendimento semanal entre MTn 300 e MTn 1,000, dependente muito da estação do ano e das chuvas. Por mês consegue aproximadamente MTn 7,800, mas por enquanto não consegue poupar porque tem investido tudo o que sobra na própria banca.

Este será o primeiro empréstimo de Julio na Hluvuku e com o Kiva. No passado Julio teve um empréstimo de outra instituição de microfinanças chamada Pro-Credit, no valor de MTn 6,900. Este dinheiro foi usado para a ampliação de sua banca. Julio ouviu falar da Hluvuku por amigos e optou por pedir um empréstimo por ser mais perto de onde trabalha.

Julio tem por objetivo crescer e ampliar sua atividade comercial, um dia construindo o seu próprio estabelecimento fixo dentro de um mercado.

loans.use: Purchase of products for sale

loans.name: Ivanka

texts.en: Ivanka Soknić is a widow from the village of Pločniku near the town of Doboj. She receives a small pension, after which her farm is the main means of support. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 600 BAM to buy more chickens for her farm. By buying more chickens, she hopes to expand her farm.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Halima B. lives in the city of Yavan. She is married and has five children. Although she is not employed, she does practice agriculture. She raises vegetables and sells the harvest at the market. This is a business she has been involved in for 10 years, and it helps her family earn additional income. She would like to receive a loan in order to buy high quality fertilizer. She plans to repay the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Бердикулова Халима жительница города Яван. Замужем и имеет 5 детей. Нигде не работает , но занимается сельским хозяйством. Сажает овощи и полученный урожай продает на базаоре. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Ее деятельнеость помогает ее семье получать дополнительный доход. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить качественные удобрения . Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Fertilizer purchase

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.ru:
Karimjon H. lives in Yavan, Tajikistan. He is married with two children. Karimjon is a farmer. He grows vegetables on a piece of his own land and sells them on the market. He sells his harvest wholesale and uses the profits to support his family. This business serves as an additional source of income. To successfully run this business he needs to buy quality fertilizer. Karimjon is requesting a loan of $1025, which he plans to pay off in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Холбоев Каримджон проживает в городе Яван. Женат и имеет 2 детей. Занимается земледелием. Имеет землю , которую засеивает овощами. Получаемый урожай продает на рынке. Сдает товар оптом. Прибыль использует для своей семьи. Этот бизнес является дополнительным источником дохода. Поэтому для того , чтобы наладить весь бизнес ему нужно купить качественные удобрения . Для покупки удобрений клиент планирует получить кредит в размере 1025 долларов США. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Manuel Alexandre

texts.pt:
Manuel is 41 years old and is from Marracuene in the province of Maputo. Manuel is a widower and father of two daughters who both attend high school. His eldest is 16 and is in 10th grade (there are 12 grades in total) whilst his youngest is 13 and in 6th grade.

Manuel finished high school and took a teacher training course at IMAP (Institute of Elementary Teaching) for 2 years. As he didn't find a vacancy at the federal university, he decided to wait for a scholarship from his employer in order to continue his studies. Manuel has been a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education for 17 years. He usually works in the afternoons and receives a monthly salary of 6,000 MZN, from which he manages to save 1,200 MZN unless there are many household expenses.

This will be his first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. With the loan of 15,000MZN he plans to buy construction materials to continue building/expanding his house. Last month Manuel received loans from other microlending institutions, but decided to approach Hluvuku when he heard about it from friends.

Manuel doesn't think this loan will be enough to finish the construction of his house and plans to obtain future loans until the project is finished. Once this is done, Manuel also intends to build a small aviary in order to rear chickens.

Translated from Portugueses by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer

Manuel tem 41 anos de idade e eh natural de Marracuene, na província de Maputo. Manual eh viúvo e pai de 2 filhas: a mais velha de 16 anos esta na 10a classe e a mais nova de 13 anos esta na 6a classe.

Manuel terminou o ensino médio e fez um curso técnico de educação no IMAP por 2 anos. Como não conseguiu uma vaga na universidade federal, decidiu esperar uma bolsa de seu empregador para continuar os estudos. Manual é funcionário permanente do Ministério da Educação fazem 17 anos. Trabalha normalmente nos períodos das tardes e recebe um salário mensal de MTn 6,000, dos quais consegue poupar uns MTn 1,200 caso não tenha muitas despesas em casa.

Este será o primeiro empréstimo de Manuel com a Hluvuku e com o Kiva. Com o valor de MTn 15,000 pretende comprar material de construção para continuar a construção / expansão de sua casa. No passado Manuel já contou com empréstimos de outras instituições de microfinanças, mas ao ouvir por amigos da Hluvuku decidiu aproximar-se da instituição. Como Manuel não acredita que este empréstimo será suficiente para terminar a construção da casa, pretende pedir outros empréstimos no futuro ate concluir este projeto. No futuro Manuel pretende construir um pequeno aviário nos fundos de sua casa para a criação de frangos.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to finish building house

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru:
Sulton S. lives with his family in Yavan, Tajikistan. He is a 40 years old farmer, married with 6 children. Sulton grows vegetables on a piece of land which he owns. Currently this is a harvesting season after which the land has to be fertilized before sowing new crops. Sulton needs money to buy some good quality fertilizer. This is why he is applying for a loan. The loan will help him to reach his goal of making more money and providing for better life for his children. He is planning to pay the loan off in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Шамсиддинов Султон житель города Яван. Живет вместе со своей семьей. Ему 40 лет , он женат и имеет 6 детей. Занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли, который засеивает овощами. Наступил сезон сбора урожая и посева новых овощей. Для этого необходимо обработать , закупив удобрения . Для закупки качественных удобрений и получения качественного урожая , нужны деньги. Поэтому Султон обратился к нм за помощью. Получив . кредит он сможет достичь своех целей , которые дадут возможность заработать больше и дать своим детям лучшие условия. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Refika

texts.en:
Refika Mulavdić was born in 1965. She is married and lives in the village of Gnojnici.

Her husband works clearing mines that were left over from the war, while she works raising vegetables for their farm.

Refika has a greenhouse, but needs a water pump to cultivate the vegetables that she plans to grow. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 KM (Bosnian Marks) ($950) to buy the water pump and grow her farming business.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Dilbarnisso.

texts.ru:
Dilbarnisso S. lives with her family in Yavan, Tajikistan. Dilbarnisso is married with 3 children. She is a housewife and helps her husband to earn money to support their family. Dilbarnisso has a small piece of land where she grows vegetables. She sells the crops and uses the profits for her household needs. She wants to get a loan to buy some fertilizer. She is planning to pay the loan back in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Шамсиддинова Дилбарниссо жительница города Яван . Живет со своей семьей . Она замужем и имеет 3 детей.домохозяйка . но помогает своему мужу зарабатывать деньги. Имеет небольшой участок земли . Засеивает его овощами . Получаемый урожай продает , а полученные деньги испаользует для хозяйства. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить удобрения . Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Emina

texts.en:
Emina Ćasurović is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives in the town of Tupković.

Her husband works in a coal mine. She also has one son who lives in Slovenia.

Emina works at her farm, growing strawberries for sale. This is her second loan, which she requested in the amount of 600 KM (Bosnian Marks) ($475). She plans to grow her strawberry fields with this loan and hopefully increase their family income.

loans.use: To buy strawberry seedlings.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap L. (shown in the picture with her daughter, who is weaving), 45, and her husband, Mr. Ry Chan, 46, live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, two weave silk at home, and the other three are still young and stay at home.

Mrs. Sopheap has been a silk weaver for twenty-five years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Ry has been a farmer for twenty-five years, and grows rice and raises cows. Mrs. Sopheap is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom B., 50, and her husband, Mr. Savuth Sor, 51, live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both children are married, and one lives in the family home.

Mrs. Mom has been selling vegetables for twelve years. She buys tomatoes, corn, and bananas from the farmers in the village for resale at Phnom Penh. Beside selling vegetables, she also raises pigs at home. Mr. Savuth has been driving a motor taxi for over twenty years and also assists his wife with her business. Currently, he wants to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one, but does not have enough funds. Mrs. Mom is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband so he can continue driving a motor taxi and also carry vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one to operate a motor taxi.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mrs. Hai H., 46, and her husband, Mr. Savun Vor, 43, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married when she was twenty years old and have six children, three sons and three daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. Other four children, two of whom weave silk at home, other one have full time employment, and the last one is in school.

Mrs. Hai has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Savun has been a farmer for sixteen years and also assisting his wife in weaving business.

Now Hai is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan Y., 26, and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Hem, 28, live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of her children is in school and other two are still at home.

Mrs. Nan has been a silk weaver for five years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Besides weaving, she also raises pigs, and Mr. Bunthoeun has sold ice for five years and also assists his wife to raise pigs. Mrs. Nan is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en: Qadir N. is a 51-year-old man who has been breeding calves in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of Bilasuvar region since 1993. He is married and has five children. Qadir receives financial support of $70 US monthly from the government. But this is not enough considering the fact that Qadir is unemployed. His main source of income is calf breeding. He is applying for $1000 US to expand his number of calves by purchasing three calves for $300 US and fodder with the remaining money for $100 US.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Jahangir

texts.en: Jahangir N., 31 years old, breeds calves in the internally displaced people (IDP) settlement in the Bilasuvar region. He has nine years of experience in this field. In addition to the breeding business, Jahangir works as a taxi driver and receives social support from the government in the amount of  $70 US per month. Local people are very poor and use taxi services very rarely. So the main source of income in Jahangir's family is calf breeding. He is applying for $1200 US to purchase four calves.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Abulfat

texts.en: Abulfat A. is 58 years old and sells milk and yoghurt in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of Bilasuvar region. He has more than 25 years of experience in this field. Abulfat, who is married and has six children, works as a teacher in a local school. His permanent income depends on his school salary, which is about $40 US, and on social support from the government as an Internally Displaced Person, which is $70 US. But his main income is still milk sales to the local milk factory. To increase sales and gain more profits, Abulfat applied for $1200 US. He will purchase two milk cows with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Mursal

texts.en: Mursal H. is a 27-year-old man who keeps a food market in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of Bilasuvar region. He started the business in 1999, but also works as a policeman. Mursal's monthly salary is about $80 US. Mursal, who lives with his parents and younger brothers, provides the only income for his family. He is applying for $1200 US to expand the number of goods he sells.

loans.use: To increase the number of goods

loans.name: Alishov

texts.en: Alishov E. is a 28-year-old man who has a food store in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of Bilasuvar region. He has seven years of experience in this field and works as both director and seller. As summer closes in, beverages will be in high demand in the southern part of Azerbaijan; this part of Azerbaijan is extremely hot and people purchase cold drinks all summer. Alishov is applying for $1200 US to purchase beverages.

loans.use: To purchase beverages

loans.name: Diame

texts.fr:
Diame Seme is a married farmer with several children. Next to his fields, which only keep him busy three months out of the year, he raises cattle to increase his income. With a first loan of 100,000F cfa, he started raising cattle. Currently, he is on his sixth loan. His latest loan was for 400,000F cfa.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Diame S. est un cultivateur marié et pere de plusieurs enfants .A cote de ses champs qui ne l'occupent que pendant trois mois durant l'année ,il pratique l'embouche bovine pour accroitre ses revenus. Avec un premier pret de 100000F cfa il a demarré l'embouche aujourd'hui il est à son sixiéme pret .son dernier pret est de 400.000f cfa.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward M. sells Pepsi. He is married, but his wife's income from her job as a typist is not sufficient enough for Edward and his seven children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase her profits.

He is asking for additional capital in order to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret P. sells bulk smoked fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient enough for Margaret and her four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a small entrepreneur from Kherson, Ukraine. She runs a venture selling different types of perfumes in a busy market called Dneprovskyi. Alla’s inventory always sells well because she offers a nice selection at reasonable prices. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Today she has over $13,000 invested in her business. Her net profit is about $3600 each month.

Alla is very accurate in all her business policies. She always weighs every pro and con before she takes any risk and puts her money at stake. This cautiousness has helped Alla to promptly repay eleven loans from Nadiya Ukraine. We believe this current loan will assist in the stable expansion of Alla’s business and will help guarantee her economic independence, which has always been her ultimate goal as an entrepreneur.

(Note: this is a short-term “express” loan that will be repaid in two months.)

loans.use: To restock inventory

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is married with two teenage sons. She and her family live in Kamenka, where Yevgeniya runs her own venture selling household items in the local market. She has been in this business for 10 years. Yevgeniya currently has invested about $8,000 in the business, and her net profit is about $1,400 each month.

Yevgeniya has been a client with Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine since its founding in the mid-1990s. She has proven to be a stable and trustworthy client. Yevgeniya has started the reconstruction of a facility that will serve as a store after it’s finished. The store will give her a serious advantage over other outdoor market vendors. Yevgeniya is hoping to use the current loan to help her finish this reconstruction project and expand her business as a result.

(Note: this is a short term “express” loan that will be paid back in one month.)

loans.use: To finish reconstruction of her store

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.en:
Dmytryi is married with one daughter named Lizzy. He lives in Kherson, Ukraine, and sells children’s clothing in the Dneprovskyi market. Dmytryi’s discipline and orderliness have helped his business grow steadily over the past 7 years. Today he has about $3,000 invested in his business. His monthly net profit is about $2,000.

Dmytryi is very good with people. He has a unique gift of understanding people and building relationships with them. These characteristics have helped him be successful in the competitive clothing market. Dmytryi’s biggest dream is to have financial independence and a decent livelihood for his family. He hopes the current loan will promote further growth in his business and help him see his dream come true.

(Note: this is a short term “express” loan that will be paid back in two months.)

loans.use: To restock inventory

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with a grown son. She started her business selling knitted wear a year ago. Low competition and high market demand have enabled rapid growth in the business. Currently Marina has about $2,400 in turnover capital. Her monthly profit is about $1,400.

Marina is a very hard worker. She has proven to be a very prudent client of Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine – she never asks for a bigger loan than she can pay back. These loans, in combination with her perseverance, trustworthiness and responsibility, have helped to guarantee success in her business. Marina is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivna to increase her inventory. She would like to purchase assorted knitted wear at wholesale prices to resell in her store. Marina is able to reduce her transportation expenses by purchasing more inventory in bulk when she travels to remote wholesale centers. Marina’s long-term goal is the continued expansion of her business. She would like to purchase more vending facilities in the Nikolaev area and eventually open a whole network of knitted wear stores in Nikolaev.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and has two children. Her previous income was not sufficient to meet the needs of her family, so Yelena decided to take a risk and start her own business selling leather goods, gloves and purses in one of the busiest city markets of Zaporozhye. She rented a kiosk, purchased some merchandise to sell and started to work.

Yelena has been persistent and worked hard. She has promptly repaid each of her loans from Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine. She has now been in business for 8 years and currently has around $3,000 in working capital for her business. Her monthly net profit amounts to around $500. Yelena has requested a loan of 1,500 UAH to increase her stock in preparation for the summer season. She is planning to buy straw beach bags and bright purses that will be both durable and trendy. Having a wider assortment of merchandise available will boost her sales and expand Yelena’s business. This loan will not only improve the quality of her selection and attract more customers, but will go further to help Yelena meet the needs of her family and provide a better livelihood for them.

(Note: this is a short-term loan that will be paid back in one month.)

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel B. sells provisions. He is married, but his wife's income from selling fish is not sufficient for Samuel and his three children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase her profits.

He is asking for additional capital in order to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel B. sells provisions. He is married, but his wife's income from selling fish is not sufficient for Samuel and his three children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.
He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Kwamina

texts.en:
Kwamina A. sells bulk fish. He is married, but his wife's income from selling fish is not sufficient enough for Kwamina and his two children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital in order to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia has many dreams to follow. She has a good work ethic: each day she farms the earth that provides sustenance for her three children, planting potatoes and "olluco" (an Andean tuber) and taking what she harvests directly to the open markets of Concepción and Huancayo to sell it herself. This is how she is compensated for the effort of six months of cultivation. Aurelia hopes to break into the sale of "comidas típicas" (traditional meals) because she has a special gift for cooking. This is the reason that she is making a loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Aurelia, tiene muchos deseos de seguir adelante con su trabajo esforzado de cada día labrando la tierra que le sirve de sustento para la superación de sus 3 hijos, sembrando papa y olluco para llevar lo que cosecha directamente al mercado de Concepción y Huancayo para comercializarlo personalmente y de esa manera compensar el esfuerzo de seis meses de cultivo. Tiene muchos deseos de incursionar en la venta de comidas típicas ya que posee un especial don para la cocina y a esa razón atiende su petición.

loans.use: Capital to break into a new occupation and to buy compost and fertilizers for her cultivated land

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es:
Nilton is a young entrepreneur who, day after day, performs his work with excellence in an agricultural project near his home. After three years of academic preparation he now applies his knowledge to the agricultural project as well as to his own cultivated land. He wishes to support his communal land with an agricultural consultant's office where he can work daily to achieve success. He yearns to improve their harvests with his technical knowledge and is asking for a loan to achieve each of his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Nilton, es un joven emprendedor que día a día ejerce su profesión con calidad en un proyecto agrícola cercano a su localidad y es así que después de 3 años de preparación académica hoy aplica estos conocimientos en su trabajo y en sus propias tierras de cultivo con el deseo de apoyar a su propia comunidad con asesoría agrícola es así que el diariamente trabaja para lograr éxito, su anhelo es mejorar sus cosechas con sus conocimientos técnicos y solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo cada uno de sus planes.

loans.use: Capital to improve harvests on communal land

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer is a young man who, from a very young age, did agricultural work. He always loved to help in his father's small fields until he acquired his own land which he is now dedicated to farming; when harvest season arrives he is completely focused on the harvest of his produce. Wilmer also possesses a store in which his sister works when Wilmer is giving his land the care needed to grow excellent produce. This is why he has asked his sister to temporarily man the little store. When we asked about Wilmer, people commented that he wishes very much to improve his workspace and stock the store with better products because it is the only one in the area and serves the whole community.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

WILMER, es un joven que desde muy niño desarrollo la labor agrícola y siempre le gustó ayudar a su padre en sus chacras hasta que logró adquirir su propio terreno donde ahora se dedica a sembrar y trabajar; cuando llega la temporada de cosecha está permanentemente dedicado a la cosecha de sus productos.También posee una tienda en la cual trabaja su hermana cuando Wilmer se encuentra dándole los cuidados necesarios a sus terrenos para obtener excelentes productos y por ese motivo ubicamos a su hermana administrando temporalmente la pequeña tiendita.Cuando entrevistamos a Wilmer nos comentó también que tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su espacio de labor e implementarlo con mejores productos ya que es la única en mucho espacio que sirve a su comunidad.

loans.use: Improvement of his little store for the satisfaction of the members of his community

loans.name: Amalio

texts.es:
Amalio is a farmer and, along with his wife, he works the land that he inherited from his parents so that they can cultivate it and year after year plant the seeds of their agricultural produce. Because this is his main source of income, Amalio strives to produce suitably excellent vegetables and this is visible from the testimony of his neighbors and relatives who attest to the arduous work that Amalio and his wife carry out. They are not only good farmers, but responsible parents who fight to put their family ahead.

Now this couple needs your support to be able to increase their yields and, due to an increase in the cost of medicine for their fields, they are asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer and compost. We hope that you can help Amalio to improve his produce and increase his yields.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

AMALIO, es agricultor y junto a su esposa trabaja con mucho esfuerzo los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres para que puedan cultivarlos y año tras año siembran en ellos sus productos agrícolas.Siendo ésta su actividad principal se esfuerza para producir adecuadamente excelentes vegetales y esto es visible por el testimonio de sus vecinos y parientes que certifican la ardua labor que desempeñan Amalio y su esposa quienes no son tan solo buenos agricultores sino unos padres responsables que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia.Ahora esta pareja requiere de su apoyo para poder incrementar su producción y debido al incremento de las medicinas para sus sembríos no lo han podido hacer en el tiempo adecuado y solicitan un préstamo que será debidamente invertido en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes.Esperamos que usted pueda ayudar a Amalio a mejorar e incrementar sus productos.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and compost for his farm to improve the quality of vegetables

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder is a farmer and now that he has a family his energy is mostly dedicated to his land. Wilder's land has been fruitful because of his motivating factor: his love for the family that adores him because he earns their daily bread and provides protection and security. It is for them that he is dedicated to growing the quality produce necessary for demanding retailers. These products offer Wilder income alternatives and the better his produce is, the higher the sale price. This is why Wilder wishes to improve his produce and he will only be able to do so if he is able to buy the fertilizer and compost needed to obtain excellent crops.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

WILDER, es agricultor y ahora que tiene una familia sus esfuerzos son mayores y la dedicación a sus terrenos se han multiplicado debido a que tiene un factor motivador, el amor a su familia quienes lo adoran y le muestran todo el cariño y afecto porque les trae el pan de cada día y les brinda protección y seguridad.Es por ello que se dedica a producir productos de calidad necesarios para los comerciantes quienes son tan exigentes y son quienes le brindan alternativas de ingresos económicos y cuanto mejor sean los productos mayores serán los costos de venta.Es así que Wilder desea mejorar sus productos y sólo lo podrá hacer si tiene la posibilidad de comprar los fertilizantes y los abonos necesarios para la obtención de excelentes productos.

loans.use: To buy compost and fertilizer to improve the quality of his farm's produce

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
ADELA is a noble woman who works producing Andean products such as potatoes, corn, peas and other vegetables from her area to then transports them to distant cities where there is greater demand and therefore improves the earnings from her work. It is with these perspectives that she works all season and based on her effort she has gained the respect of her neighbors for her example of commitment and dedication. One of her wishes is to offer a quality education to her children who are in higher education in a city near to their community. It is for them that she seeks to improve her income and requests your support to increase the quality and quantity of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

ADELA, es una noble mujer que se dedica a la producción de productos andinos como papa, maíz, arveja y demás netos de su zona para luego trasportarlos a las ciudades alejadas donde la demanda sea mayor a la de su zona y así adquirir mayores ganancias de su trabajo.Es con estas perspectivas que trabaja toda una temporada y basado en esfuerzo se ha ganado el respeto de sus vecinos por su ejemplo de constancia y dedicación. Y uno de sus deseos es brindarles educación de calidad a sus hijos quienes cursan estudios superiores en una cuidad cercana a su localidad, es por ellos que pretende mejorar sus ingresos económicos y solicita vuestra ayuda para incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase the quality and quantity of her products

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
AGUEDA has been connected to agricultural work from a very young age as her parents cultivated an immense love for the land in her. She is now the mother of two young children and she carries out this work with great diligence, thanks to which she receives her daily sustenance. Her desires for progress motivate her to increase the planting of her products. Now that she is preparing her land and harvesting her production she requests a loan to prepare the seeds and land for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

AGUEDA, desde muy pequeña ha estado relacionada con la labor agrícola, debido a que sus padres cultivaron en ella el inmenso amor por la tierra, ahora que es madre de dos pequeños desarrolla con mucha diligencia esta labor y gracias a ella les otorga el sustento diario y sus deseos de progreso la incentivan a incrementar la siembra de sus productos y ahora que está en plena preparación de sus terrenos y cosecha de productos solicita un préstamo para preparar las semillas y el campo para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: The purchase of seeds and fertilizers to be to able to prepare the land for its crops.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is a responsible and caring mother who maintains her family through her activity as a farmer, producing crops such as potatoes, corn, etc. This activity has helped her to provide for the costs of raising her family. To earn money for a loaf of bread, Margarita spends days in her fields working to ensure that her products are competitive in the marketplace. To do this, she requires both fertilizers and fumigation of her crops and because of the high price of these products and her lack of funds it is difficult for her to acquire these necessary tools. She therefore asks your help to acquire these products which will improve her harvests and, most importantly, protect the crops from a variety of illnesses.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski and Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteers. Description corrected by Daniel Kahn, Kiva staff

MARGARITA, es una madre responsable y cariñosa y su forma de mantener a su familia es a través de su actividad como agricultora produciendo productos agrícolas como: papa, maíz, etc. Esta actividad le ayuda hasta el día de hoy a solventar los gastos de su familia.Margarita para poder llevar un pan a su hogar tiene que pasar días enteros trabajando en sus chacras para que sus productos sean competitivos en el mercado y para ello es necesario las fumigaciones y proveerles de los abonos necesarios a sus cultivos y es por falta de dinero que no puede acceder a estos productos por sus altos costos y requiere de su ayuda para poder adquirirlos y así mejorar y cuidar sus sembríos y sobre todo protegerlos de las diversas enfermedades que tienen los productos

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: America

texts.es:
Description AMERICA is one of the hardest working women in the area who with her great commercial capability works selling cheeses in neighboring villages. These delicious cheeses are obtained thanks to the cows that she raises, which she feeds adequately from early on so that they produce quality milk. While her animals go out to feed she produces her delicious cheeses so that she can later sell them. This activity is very difficult for her because she tries to help her oldest son to raise her granddaughter, who stays with her most of the day while her parents work on their plot of land. To this end, she wants to increase her production and has decided to acquire another calf.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

AMERICA, es una de las mujeres más trabajadoras de la zona quien por su alta capacidad comercial se dedica a la venta de quesos en los pueblos cercanos a su localidad.Estos deliciosos quesos los obtiene gracias a las vaquitas que cría y ordeña desde muy temprano además de alimentarlas adecuadamente para que produzcan leche de calidad y mientras sus animalitos salen a alimentarse ella elabora sus deliciosos quesos para después llevar a comercializarlos. Esta actividad es muy dura para ella porque trata de ayudar a su hijo mayor en la crianza de su nietecita con quien permanece gran parte del día mientras sus padres trabajan en sus terrenos de cultivos. Desea incrementar su producción y ha decidido adquirir una vaquita más para este fin.

loans.use: To purchase a calf.

loans.name: Vencen

texts.es:
VENCEN, who is 18 years old, at a young age had to confront the new challenge of being the head of the household and having to support his family. He inherited land from his parents where he works in agriculture to support his young family. He spends the majority of his time on his land taking care of his agricultural production so that he can obtain quality products in the next harvest. His wife can be found at home diligently taking care of their animals, which also provide economic support for their home. It is she who told us about the need that they have and the urgency to purchase fertilizers to be able to improve the quality and quantity of their vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

VENCEN, es un joven de 18 años que a temprana edad tuvo que afrontar el nuevo reto de ser padre de familia y mantener a una familia y es por ello que sus padres le heredaron un terreno donde se dedica a la agricultura para poder solventar a su joven familia.Es así que pasa el mayor tiempo en sus terrenos de cultivo cuidando su producción agrícola para que pueda obtener productos de calidad en la cosecha próxima y es por ello que encontramos a su esposa en su domicilio cuidando diligentemente a sus animales los cuales también son una ayuda para la economía de su hogar.Y es ella quien nos comentó de la necesidad por la que están atravesando y la urgencia de comprar abonos y fertilizantes para acrecentar la calidad y cantidad de sus vegetales.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana just celebrated 20 years of working in her haberdashery business and of being a mom, she is very loved and has become and example of perseverance in her community because she has overcome numerous family and financial problems. Susana's wish, is to help her 4 younger children with their professional studies, they give her the strength necessary to continue working in her business. The business is located in a busy avenue in the city of Juliaca. While Susana attends her business, her hardworking husband works in a private institution in Juliaca. Susana thinks that by having more capital, their income will increase considerably and they will be able to finish their projects.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Susana, acaba de cumplir 20 años de dedicación a su negocio de mercería y a su ardua labor de madre, ella es muy apreciada y se ha convertido en un ejemplo de constancia en su localidad porque pese a los innumerables problemas familiares y económicos que atravesó ha podido salir adelante con firmeza.El deseo de Susana, es brindarle estudios superiores a sus 4 menores hijos quienes le dan la suficiente fuerza para continuar perseverando en su noble oficio, negocio que está ubicado en una concurrida avenida de la ciudad de Juliaca; mientras Doña Susana se esfuerza en su actividad su laborioso esposo hace lo propio desempeñándose en su trabajo dentro de una institución privada de la ciudad de Juliaca.Susana considera que aumentando el monto de su capital mejorarán considerablemente sus ingresos económicos, y le permitirá concretar sus proyectos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Designing and selling hats is helping Adela improve the quality of life of her beloved children and her hardworking husband, Julian, who has been doing this for 16 years and that now with the support of his wife and children makes beautiful and innovative hats. Adela's shop is located inside their small house, which they've been fixing with hard work and patience; during this time of year, their products are in high demand and thus she has numerous orders, however she doesn't count with enough source materials to meet the orders. This diligent and responsible mother expects to win generous hearts that help her finance her project.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de confección y venta de sombreros le está permitiendo mejorar la calidad de vida de sus queridos hijos a Doña Adela y a su hacendoso esposo Julián, quien desde los 16 años incursionó en ésta noble labor y que ahora con apoyo de su esposa e hijos producen hermosos y novedosos sombreros.Adela tiene ubicado su tallercito en su pequeña vivienda que con esfuerzo y presteza viene haciendo refaccionar; por estas temporadas su mercadería está logrando tener gran demanda y por ende cuenta con innumerables solicitudes pero no posee suficiente materia prima para cumplir con sus pedidos; esta diligente y responsable madre espera conseguir corazones generosos que le permitan financiar su proyecto.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make hats

loans.name: Edy

texts.es:
Edy is originally from the district of Asillo, he is a hardworking young man that knows the true value of work. When he turned 16, he left his town in search of better opportunities, that's how he ended up working for 3 years for a weaving shop in the city of Lima. Currently, he lives in the city of Juliaca and with the money he saved while working he was able to buy 2 weaving machines, thanks to that he has been making beautiful and innovative wool hats and caps that he sells in big amounts at the San Jose market. This young man's wish is to have capital to buy colorful wools and slowly advance with his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Edy, es natural del distrito de Asillo, joven esforzado que conoce el verdadero valor significativo del trabajo, desde los 16 años abandonó su pueblo natal en busca de mejores oportunidades, es así que llegó a trabajar durante 3 años en un taller de artesanía de tejidos en la ciudad de Lima.Actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, con el dinero que ahorró durante el tiempo que trabajó pudo finalmente comprar sus dos máquinas de tejer, gracias a ello viene elaborando hermosos y novedosos chullos y gorras que vende al por mayor en el mercado San José de dicha ciudad, el deseo de este ejemplar joven es contar con mayor capital para adquirir sus coloridas lanas y así poco a poco progresar con su tallercito.

loans.use: Purchase wool of different colors to make hats

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel never imagined that with the beautiful art of weaving she would be able to get ahead. She learned to do this from her brother Erasmo, who promptly passed his knowledge on to her. Isabel and her husband invested their savings in buying weaving machines. Currently they employ four young staff who enjoy what they do and hope to have their own shop one day. Isabel and her staff don't have sufficient raw materials to work with and hope to get a loan from generous people like you to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Nunca imaginó Doña Isabel que con este bello arte del tejido podría salir adelante, aprendió este oficio de su hermano Erasmo quien con presteza fue inculcándole sus conocimientos; los ahorros con los que contaba Doña Isabel y su esposo lo invirtieron en adquirir máquinas de tejer; actualmente tienen a su cargo a cuatro jóvenes trabajadores quienes se sienten muy contentos con la actividad que realizan y esperan algún día contar con su propio taller.En estos momentos Doña Isabel y sus jóvenes trabajadores no tienen suficiente materia prima para desenvolverse en su actividad y esperan recibir el financiamiento de personas generosas como vosotros para alcanzar sus objetivos.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for weaving shop

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba E. sells banku, okro stew, and yams. These are local dishes, which are very popular here in Ghana. She is married, but her husband's income from his job as a police officer is not sufficient enough for Araba and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Since Nelly formed a family she has worked in numerous activities such as the traveling sale of juices, groceries and food, all with the purpose of helping her family and give a good education to her beloved children. Currently Nelly sells used clothing, which she buys in bundles from la Paz, Bolivia and sells in her home city of Juliaca. At the beginning this business was very profitable, but now there is a lot of competition and she sees the need to improve her merchandise and get better quality clothing, Nelly hopes to get your help and your trust and promises to work hard to not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que formó su familia Doña Nelly trabajó en innumerables actividades tales como: la venta de jugos, abarrotes y comida en forma ambulatoria con el fin de sacar adelante y brindarles una buena educación a sus queridos hijos.En este momento Nelly viene dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano, mercadería que trae por fardos de la Paz-Bolivia y vende en su ciudad natal Juliaca, en un principio este negocio le resultaba muy rentable pero ahora viendo la competencia que existe por este rubro se ve en la necesidad de mejorar su mercadería y adquirir prendas de primera, Nelly espera recibir tu apoyo y promete esforzarse y no defraudar la confianza que deposites en ella.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a young mother. When she realized that her husband’s income was not enough to cover the household expenses and their young son’s education she decided to go into business selling American clothing, bedspreads, and blankets. The economic gains she has made from her business have allowed her to improve her quality of life. Yolanda is hoping for your help, since she would like to invest more in her business. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can easily cover the expenses that will come with the birth of her next child.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Yolanda, es una joven madre que al observar lo insuficientes que eran los ingresos que obtenía su esposo para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y educación de su pequeño niño decidió dedicarse al negocio de venta de ropas americanas, frazadas y mantas, los beneficios económicos que obtiene con este negocio le están permitiendo mejorar su calidad de vida.Yolanda espera recibir tu ayuda, debido a que tiene proyectado invertir en su negocio con la esperanza de obtener buenos beneficios y cubrir con tranquilidad los gastos que le demandará la llegada de su próximo bebé.

loans.use: Increasing her capital so she can increase her supply of products

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. sells bulk fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient enough for Grace and her four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina is an admirable woman. Having been orphaned at a very young age and suffered much, she knew that to get ahead in life she would have to make it all on her own. In the course of her life she has become a self-confident woman who wants more than anything to help her 8 children by offering them the opportunity to go to university and become successful. This exemplary mother would like a loan so that she can invest in her business of selling groceries. Her little stall is situated insiD. the Las Mercedes market in the city of Juliaca. Rufina is confident that with this investment she will be able to complete the most important project of her life: to proviD. a good education for her beloved children, of whom she is very proud.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Rufina, es una noble mujer, desD. que se quedó huérfana a muy corta edad sufrió mucho y supo valerse sola para salir adelante, la vida la convirtió en una mujer segura D. sí misma y D. lo que esta dispuesta ha alcanzar por amor a sus 8 queridos hijos, a quienes en su humildad viene brindándoles la oportunidad D. seguir estudios superiores para que en un futuro sean hombres D. bien.El deseo D. esta ejemplar madre es recibir un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, puestito ubicado al interior del mercado Las Mercedes D. la ciudad D. Juliaca.Rufina está segura que con dicha inversión concretará el proyecto más granD. D. su vida, la D. ofrecerles una buena educación a sus queridos hijos, D. quienes se siente muy orgullosa.

loans.use: Increasing her capital so she can increase her stock of products

loans.name: Jam Bugum 1 Group

texts.fr:
These women who live in the same village formed a group to raise cattle. The group obtains a loan and buys cattle, which are raised by the members. After sales, the income is shared among the members of the group. The income drawn from their business allows them to take part in the educational costs of their children. The group has so far benefited from five loans of 500,000 cfa each.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Ces femmes vivant dans le meme village se sont reunues en groupement pour faire de l'embouche bovine.le groupe contracte un pret et achette des boeufs qui sont embouchés par les membres du groupe . A la vente les recettes sont partagées entre les membres du groupe.les revenus tirés de leur activité leur permettent de parciper aux frais d'éducation des enfants.le groupe a bénéficié de cinq prets de 500.000f cfa chacun.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is from the little town of Calapuja. She decided to take what little she had and move to the city of Juliaca with her beloved children in search of better opportunities. Since moving to the city she has made a living selling food on the street, selling chifes (plantain snacks), and these days, making and selling beautiful garments for women and children to wear. Because of her hard work she has been able to improve her quality of life and build a small home, thus providing her two small children with security and a roof over their heads. Right now Hermelinda, a dedicated mother, would like your support to increase the total amount invested in her business. With the profits that she hopes to achieve her business will grow alongside her wonderful family. Hermelinda is living proof that with enthusiasm, perseverance, and determination you can complete many projects.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Calapuja, es el pueblito natal de Doña Hermelinda, quien con lo poco que tenía decidió emigrar hacia la ciudad de Juliaca junto a sus queridos hijos en busca de mejores oportunidades, desde que radica en dicha ciudad se dedicó a la venta de comida al paso, comercio de chiflerías en general y actualmente a la confección y venta de hermosas prendas de vestir para niños y damas, gracias a estas actividades logró mejorar su calidad de vida y construir su pequeña vivienda con el fin de brindarles un techo propio y seguro a sus dos menores hijos.En esta oportunidad ésta dedicada madre desea contar con tu apoyo para incrementar el monto de inversión de su negocio y con los beneficios que espera conseguir crecer junto a su adorable familia Hermelinda es una fiel prueba de que con entusiasmo, constancia y voluntad es posible concretar muchos proyectos.

loans.use: Increasing her capital so she can increase her selection of products

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
Over 25 years ago Nicolaza and her hard-working husband, Juan, decided to leave their home town of Orurillo-Ayaviri in search of better work opportunities. While they were living in their small town they worked as farmers and raised cattle but those businesses couldn't cover their household expenses. As their family grew, need and hunger motivated them to leave their small town. Now they live in the city of Juliaca and Nicolaza sells food outdoors and also sells beautiful fabrics. Her hard-working husband works as a taxi driver. With much effort, they have been able to build a home and they are provided their beloved children with a good education. Everything was going well for the family and their businesses, but unfortunately a week ago Juan had a horrible traffic accident that left him in bad health. For this reason Nicolaza and her children are working hard and persevering in their businesses in order to have more income and to be able to cover the head of their family's medical costs. Your essential support will be a great help for Nicolaza and her family.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Hace más de 25 años Doña Nicolaza y su laborioso esposo Juan decidieron salir de su pueblo natal Orurillo- Ayaviri en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo, durante el tiempo que estuvieron viviendo en su pueblito se dedicaron a la agricultura y ganadería pero estas actividades no lograban cubrir los gastos de su hogar así que conforme llegaban más miembros la necesidad y el hambre los impulsó a abandonar su pueblito.Y actualmente radican en la ciudad de Juliaca, Doña Nicolaza con su noble labor de venta de comida en forma ambulatoria y sus bellos tejidos y su laborioso esposo con su trabajo de taxista, ambos con esfuerzo han logrado construir su casita y le están brindando educación a sus amados hijos.Todo marchaba bien en su familia y en sus negocios pero desafortunadamente hace sólo una semana Juan sufrió un terrible accidente de tránsito que lo dejó en un mal estado de salud, este hecho hace que Doña Nicolaza y sus hijos se esfuercen y perseveren en sus actividades con el fin de obtener mayores beneficios y cubrir con tranquilidad los gastos de medicamentos del jefe de familia.Tu indispensable aporte será una gran ayuda para doña Nicolaza y su familia.

loans.use: Increase her capital to expand Nicolaza's business to benefit her beloved husband.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Dianna

texts.en:
Dianna B. sells cosmetics. She is single and her income is not sufficient enough for Dianna and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Jam Bugum 2 Group

texts.fr:
This group of women farmers who united to increase their income used their first loan of 500,000 cfa to start a business raising cattle. The group has so far received four loans of 500,000 cfa, each of which has allowed them to increase their production capacity and thereby ensure their financial independence.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupe réunu des femmes agricultrices qui pour accroitre leurs revenus ont avec un premier pret de 500.000f cfa commencé une activité d'embouche bovine.Le groupe a déjà bénéficé de quatre prets de 500.000f cfa chacun ce qui leur a permis d'augmenter leur capacité de production et d'assurer ainssi leur indépandance financiére.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
.Martín owns a minibus which is his work tool and income source. He works as the chauffeur and his wife as his assistant (“voceadora”). They have an 8 year-old daughter and live in the Zone San José of Yunguyo of the town of El Alto. The loan requested will be spent on buying spare parts (brakes, brake and transmission oil) as well as maintenance costs so the vehicle has no mechanical defects and can work normally. This is his first loan with Impro and the evaluation allows the approval of the loan requested by Martín.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Martín tiene un minibús que es su herramienta de trabajo y su fuente de ingresos, con el cual trabajan él como chofer y su esposa como ayudante (voceadora). Tienen una hija de 8 años de edad y viven en la Zona San José de Yunguyo de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado para la compra de repuestos (frenos, liquido de frenos, liquido de transmisión) y costos de mantenimiento para que la movilidad no tenga fallas mecánicas y pueda trabajar normalmente. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Martín.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and cost of maintenance of minibus.

loans.name: Gie Cocorico Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of adult women who get up very early in the morning to sell food to people who are passing through our ecovillage l'île de Carabane. The enclavement of the area means that all the fishermen and tourists who visit our village face some difficulty when it comes to eating, since there are practically no restaurants which are permanently open. We thus acquired a parcel of land at the edge of the river to build a restaurant, since demand was so high. Initially, we tried to sell small quantities of food. We then noticed that people went the whole day without eating due to a lack of food suppliers, and it is this gap that we would like to fill.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes adultes qui se lèvent très tôt le matin pour vendre de la nouriture aux personnes qui sont de passage dans notre écovillage qui est l'île de Carabane. L'enclavement de la zone a fait que tous les pêcheurs et touristes qui visitent notre village éprouvent des difficultés pour se nourir, car il n'existe pratiquement pas de restaurants qui travaillent de façon permanante. Nous avons donc acquit une parcelle de terre au bord du fleuve pour construir un restaurant, car la demande est trop forte. Nous avons essayé d'abord de vendre à petite quantité. Nous avons donc remarqué que les gens restaient toutes la journée sans manger par manque de fournisseur et c'est ce vide que nous voulons combler.

loans.use: To build and buy materials to supply a restaurant

loans.name: Neyda

texts.es:
Neyda is a seamstress; she makes bermudas from material her clients bring her. This activity is her main source of income with which she covers the living expenses of her mother and younger brother. Her husband, as many Bolivians, migrated to the Republic of Argentina to work as a tailor. Neyda lives in the Zona Villa Ingenio Distrito II of the town of El Alto. The loan will be spent on buying a sewing machine for her younger brother who has learned from Neyda and that way they will improve their income as there will be an increase of the volume of the products. This is the first loan with Impro, and the evaluation allows approval of the loan requested by Neyda.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Neyda es costurera; confecciona bermudas, no emplea materia prima solo mano de obra, lo cual quiere decir que sus clientes traen sus propias telas. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de madre y hermanito. El esposo, como muchos bolivianos, migró hacia Republica de Argentina para trabajar como costurero. Neyda vive en la Zona Villa Ingenio Distrito II de la Ciudad de El Alto.
