El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una maquina de costura donde trabajara el hermanito menor que aprendió de Neyda y así podrán mejorar los ingresos pues el volumen de producción se incrementará. Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Neyda.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine to increase the volume of bermudas to satisfy growing demands.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Jam Bugum 3 Group

texts.fr:
Having come together as a group, these five illiterate women used their first loan of 500 000 CFA to start a business raising cattle in their village. Two (2) other loans of 500 000 CFA allowed them to increase their production capacity. Each of the women are given one ox which she raises alone. The income drawn from this business serves to improve the daily meals and pay for the medical costs of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Regroupées au sein d'un groupement ,ces cinq femmes analphabetes ont avec un premier pret de 500000f cfa demarré une activité d'embouche bovine dans leur village.Deux (2) autres successifs de 500.000f cfa leur ont permis d'augmenter leur capacité de production .Chacune d'elle bénéficie d'un boeuf qu'elle embouche seule.Les revenus tirés de l'activité servent à amelliorer les repas quotidiens payer les frais médicaux des enfants.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. sells smoked fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient enough for Ekua and her six children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón L. is a homeowner and lives in the Villa Fátima area in La Paz with his wife Angélica Nava and their three children. Simón is a landlord and his wife is a homemaker. Simón also makes signs for businesses, using a computer for his deisgns.

The loan Simón is applying for will be used to purchase a computer and printer. This is Simón’s second loan application. The socio-economic analysis we have conducted qualifies him for a loan.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

El señor Simón L. vive en casa propia, en la zona de Villa Fátima de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Angélica Nava y sus tres hijos. El señor Simón es rentista y su esposa es ama de casa. El señor también se dedica a la elaboración de letreros para los comercios para lo cual necesita una computadora que es su herramienta para diseñar los letreros.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la compra de una computadora y una impresora. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer and printer

loans.name: Jorgelina

texts.es:
Jorgelina C. leases her home in the San Pedro area of La Paz. She and her daughter are employed as cleaning staff in a hotel in the city. The place where Jorgelina lives has only one bedroom that serves multiples uses for both her and her daughter.

With a prior loan Jorgelina finished laying the foundation and bought construction materials for a kitchen. The loan she is applying for will be used to build the kitchen. This is the sixth time Jorgelina has requested a loan. The socio-economic analysis we have conducted qualifies her for a loan.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Jorgelina C. vive en anticretico en la zona de San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. Con su hija, la señora Jorgelina es empleada de limpieza de un hotel de nuestra ciudad. El lugar donde vive solo cuenta con una habitación que tiene funciones múltiples para ambas.

Con un anterior crédito la señora Jorgelina realizó la construcción de cimientos y la compra de materiales de construcción para una cocina. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una cocina. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Cost of building a kitchen in her home

loans.name: El Progreso (The Progress) Group 4

texts.en:
Marcia is the proud mother of four children, ages 5, 15, 18 and 20. She owns a business raising and selling cows. Esperanza has given Marcia five loans already and she has successfully paid back all of them. She is a very hard worker and her business continues to do well. With this next loan, Marcia hopes to continue progressing. She dreams that she can provide a good education for her children. She wants them to go to college and become professionals so that their lives will be even better than hers.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people. In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To grow her business and support her four children

loans.name: Patient Group

texts.en: Abdul T., 30 years old, operates a cosmetics-selling business. A previous loan enabled him to expand his business and increase his income, and he now owns a stall in the market of Magburaka town.  Abdul has been working with Mohemed, and both are in the same savings club; their plan is to expand their businesses and establish a shop.  They are therefore requesting a loan of $725 to achieve their goal.

loans.use: To increase inventory and generate more income.

loans.name: Gie Fad (Femmes Alphabétisation Et Développement Group

texts.fr:
The GIE FAD is a group of women who teach literacy in the department of Oussouye. It is a dynamic movement which is involved in the promotion of women. It is therefore to promote our income-generating activities that we have come to ask Kiva and the SEM to grant us a loan in order to be able to create sources of income for the women who comprise this organization. Our activities are what one calls small side businesses which are based on seasonally available products. What we hope to do is to continue running them throughout the year. This is why we have chosen to sell a range of products which are made use of most in the surrounding villages (palm oil, myrrh oil and soap made from this oil, dried and smoked fish, seasonal fruits, etc.)

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le GIE FAD regroupe l'ensemble des femmes qui enseignent l'alphabétisation dans le département d'Oussouye. C'est un mouvement dynamique qui s'implique dans la promotion des femmes. C'est donc pour promouvoir des activités génératrices de revenu que nous sommes venus solliciter Kiva et le SEM pour l'octoi d'un prêt afin de pouvoir créer des sources de revenu pour les femmes qui composent cette structure. Nos activités sont ce que l'on peut dire le petit commerce d'appoint qui se fait selon les produits disponibles durant la saison. ce que nous souhaitons, c'est de continuer à travailler pendant toute l'année. C'est pourquoi nous avons choisi de vendre toutes sortes de produits qui sont exploiter dans les villages environnants ( huille de palme, huile de myhrre et savon fabriqué à partir de cette huile; poissons secs et fumés, fruits selon la saison, etc.)

loans.use: To buy tree products, fruits, myrrh-based soap, and dried fish

loans.name: Baki

texts.fr:
Baki I. is 35 years old, married, and the father of four. He lives and works in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, he wishes to supply his shop by buying soap, beauty products, rice, oil, and canned food. The profits to be earned from his business will enable him to support his children and to improve their living conditions. Mr. I. is a good client, since he has already benefited from a loan, and the payments have been regular.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Baki I. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite et travaille à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec ce crédit, il souhaite approvisionner son marché en achetant du savon, des produits de beauté, du riz, de l’huile et les boites de conserves. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de la vie. Monsieur I. est un bon client puisqu’il a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit et les remboursements ont été réguliers.

loans.use: To supply his grocery shop

loans.name: Dzigbodi

texts.fr:
Dzigbodi K. is 24 years old, married, and the mother of one child. To provide for her family, she opened a salon in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, her first one from FECECAV, she wishes to buy beauty products and a hair dryer to improve her services. She appreciates this chance to help take responsibility for family needs, given the profits she will make by enlarging her salon.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Dzigbodi K. est âgée de 24 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle a ouvert un salon de à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec ce crédit, sa première de FECECAV, Dzigbodi désire acheter les produits de beauté et un séchoir pour améliorer ses services. Elle apprécie cette opportunité pour participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille grâce aux profits qu’elle dégagera par l’agrandissement de son salon.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and a hair dryer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi A. is 24 years old, single, and without children. He is a barber and has opened a shop in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With these funds, he wishes to increase the capacity of his enterprise by buying hair clippers, a new mirror, and beauty products. Also, with the profits he is going to make from his business, he hopes to help more with taking responsibility for family needs.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Kossi A. est âgé de 24 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est coiffeur et a ouvert un salon à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec les fonds, il souhaite augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant des tondeuses, un nouveau miroir et les produits de beauté. Aussi, avec les profits qu’il va dégager de son activité, il espère mieux participer à la prise en charges des besoins de sa famille maternelle.

loans.use: To increase the capacity of his enterprise

loans.name: Donko

texts.fr:
Donko A. is 42 years old, married, and the father of two. To earn money, he sells motor fuel – a resource that is becoming more and more rare while the demand continuously grows. He lives and works in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Right now, he is trying with difficulty to provide for his family, since the price of fuel continues to increase. With this loan, he wants to grow the capacity of his business by buying gasoline and thus improve life for his family. Donko is a good client, since he has already benefited from two loans, and the payments have been regular.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Donko A. est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent, il vend du carburant – une ressource qui devient de plus en plus rare pendant que la demande ne cesse de croître. Il habite et travaille à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. A ce moment, il essaie avec difficulté de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille comme le prix de carburant continue d’augmenter. Avec ce crédit, il veut accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant de l’essence et par là améliorer la vie pour sa famille. Donko est un bon client puisqu’il a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers.

loans.use: To grow the capacity of his business

loans.name: Epe

texts.fr:
Epe Y. is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four. She is a food retailer in the marketplace of Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is a specialist in making "pâte", a traditional dish that is consumed by the entire local population. With this loan, her third from FECECAV, Epe wants to buy the ingredients (corn, oil, spices) for cooking it. The profits that will be earned from her business will enable her to support her children and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Epe Y. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de nourriture dans le marché d’Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Elle est spécialisée en la préparation de « la pâte, » un plat traditionnel qui est consommé par toute la population locale. Avec ce crédit, son troisième de FECECAV, Epe veut acheter les ingrédients (du maïs, de l’huile et des épices) pour préparer. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama B. is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five. She is a food retailer in the marketplace in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, her third from FECECAV, Ama wishes to buy sacks of corn and to stock up on them in order to limit repeated trips, since stocking up is accomplished on farms. The profits she will earn from her business will enable her to provide for her children and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Ama B. est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de nourriture dans le marché d’Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec ce crédit, son troisième de FECECAV, Ama souhaite acheter des sacs de maïs, les stocker pour limiter les déplacements répétés puisque l’approvisionnement se fait dans les fermes. Les profits qu’elle dégagera de son activité lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi K. is 34 years old, married, and the mother of three. She is a food retailer in the marketplace in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is a specialist in making "pâte", a traditional dish that is consumed by the entire local population. With this loan, her second from FECECAV, Ms. K. hopes to buy corn and some indispensable ingredients for making it. The profits that will be earned from her sales will enable her to support her children and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Afi K. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de nourriture au marché d’Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Elle est spécialisée dans la préparation de « la pâte, » un plat traditionnel consommé par toute la population locale. Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, Madame K. espère acheter du maïs, et des ingrédients indispensables à la préparation. Les profits qui se dégageront de ses ventes lui permettront de supporter ses enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Joli

texts.fr:
Joli S. is 29 years old, married, and the father of one child. To earn money, he operates a general food market in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, his third from FECECAV, he wishes to increase his shop's inventory to meet the demands of his clients. Specifically, he wants to buy pre-paid phone cards, beverages, milk, canned food, soap, and oil. With the improvement in his business, he can better support his child and thus participate in the development of his community.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Joli S. est âgé de 29 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Pour gagner de l’argent il opère un marché d’alimentation générale à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec ce crédit, son troisième de FECECAV, il souhaite augmenter le stock de son atelier pour répondre aux demandes de ses clients. Spécifiquement, il veut acheter les cartes de recharge téléphoniques, les boissons, du lait, des boîtes de conserves, du savon et de l’huile. Avec l’amélioration de son activité, il peut mieux subvenir aux besoins de son enfant et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: To increase his shop's inventory

loans.name: Felicien

texts.fr:
Felicien D. is 30 years old, married, and the father of two. To earn money, he operates a food market in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With his second (loan) from FECECAV, he hopes to buy beverages, sandalettes (flip-flops), canned foods, and other various goods to increase the capacity of his shop. This will enable him to better meet the demands of his customers and to support his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Felicien D. est âgé de 30ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent il opère un marché alimentaire à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec son deuxième de FECECAV, il espère acheter les boissons, les sandalettes, les boites de conserves et les autres produits variés pour augmenter la capacité de sa boutique ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase his shop's capacity

loans.name: Eddys Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Eddys is 58 years old, he lives in Los Laureles norte, is married and has a 15 year old son, his wife is a house wife and helps him in the grocery store they have on their one room house.

Mr. Eddys works as an electrician, he has 30 years of experience, and they have difficulties when the business sales are slow. He started the business with his own savings.

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to invest in working capital to buy supplies and products for his business and therefore satisfy his clients and gain more profit from sales.

He plans to have enough money to educate his son and improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Eddys tiene 58 años de edad, habita en los Laureles Norte, casado y tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda con una pulpería que tienen en su casa de habitación. El Sr. Eddys se desempeña como electricista, tiene treinta años de experiencia, las dificultades se dan cuando el negocio va mal en las ventas. El comenzó con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que adquiera pretende invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos para invertirlos en su negocio y así fortalecerlo y poder sastifacer a los clientes con sus productos y obtener más ganancias y utilidad con las ventas. Sus planes son llegar a poner una miscelanea, poder educar a su hijo y mejorar la vivienda.

loans.use: To buy products for his grocery store  / Comprar productos varios para invertirlos en su pulpería

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
Anani K. is 43 years old, married, and the father of two. To provide for his family, he buys poultry that he resells – hens, roosters, Guinea hens, and ducks. With this loan, his third from FECECAV, Mr. K. hopes to bolster his commerce with a large purchase of hens for resale. With the profits he is going to earn, he can improve his family's living conditions in Adéta, Togo.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Anani K. est âgé de 43 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille il achète les volailles qu’il revend– des poules, des coqs, des pintades et des canards. Avec ce crédit, son troisième de FECECAV, Monsieur K. espère renforcer son commerce d’un grand achat des poules pour la revente. Avec les profits qu’il va dégager, il peut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille à Adéta, Togo.

loans.use: To bolster his commerce with a large purchase of hens

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Madame Yawavi A. is 29 years old, married with two children. She grows vegetables in a small village close to Adéta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. In particular she specializes in cultivating eggplant (the vegetables shown in the photo). She has difficulty providing for the needs of her family as land suitable for cultivation is becoming more and more scarce and less fertile. With this loan, her second from FECECAV, Yawavi wants to buy equipment and lease more land suitable for cultivation in order to increase her production. As a result of the profit she will make, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Yawavi A. est âgée de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est une cultivatrice dans un petit village qui est proche d’Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Elle est spécialisée dans la production des aubergines (les légumes qu’on voit dans la photo.) Elle subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille puisque les terres cultivables deviennent de plus en plus rares et moins fertiles. Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, Yawavi espère acheter des équipements et bailler d’auutres surfaces cultivables afin d’augmenter sa production. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager, elle peut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy equipment in order to increase production

loans.name: Boni

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boni K. is 28 years old, married with one child. To earn a living he runs a shop selling electrical appliances in Adéta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, his second from FECECAV, he hopes to increase his stock to meet his customers’ demands. In particular, he wants to buy televisions and VCRs to resell. As a result of improving his business, he will be better placed to meet the needs of his child and participate in the development of his community.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Boni K. est âgé de 28 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Pour gagner de l’argent il opère une boutique de commercialisation d’appareils électroniques à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, il souhaite augmenter le stock de son atelier pour répondre aux demandes de ses clients. Spécifiquement, il veut acheter les télévisions et les VCD pour revendre. Avec l’amélioration de son activité, il peut mieux subvenir aux besoins de son enfant et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: To buy televisions and VCRs to resell

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Kodzo S. is 45 years old, married with three children. He lives and works in Adéta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. To meet the needs of his family he sells construction materials. With this loan, Kodzo wants to expand his business by purchasing planks and cement to sell. As a result of the profit made from these sales, he will be able to improve his family’s standard of living and participate in the development of his community.

Translated from French by Alison Dent,Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Kodzo S. est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite et travaille à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il vend les matériaux de construction. Avec ce crédit, Kodzo espère élargir la capacité de son commerce en achetant les planches et du ciment pour revendre. Avec les profits qu’il va dégager dans ses ventes, il peut améliorer les conditions de sa famille et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Dzigbodi

texts.fr:
Madame Dzigbodi E. is 34 years old, married with three children. She earns a living selling yams. With this loan, Madame E. wants to buy lots of yams in the surrounding villages to sell in the market in Adéta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. The profit from these sales will allow her to meet the needs of her children at school. She is very happy to have a chance to improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Dzigbodi E. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent, elle vend les ignames. Madame E. espère avec ce crédit acheter beaucoup d’ignames dans les villages environnants pour revendre dans le marché d’Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager de ses ventes elle sera capable de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants à l’école. Elle est très contente de l’opportunité d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy yams to resell

loans.name: Mounitarou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mounitarou Y. is 25 years old, single, with no children. He lives and works in Adéta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is a mechanic and with the funds from his loan he wants to buy spare parts and a motorcycle to repair and sell. With the profit he will make from his business, he will be in a better position to meet the needs of his mother's family.

Translated from french by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Mounitarou Y. est âgé de 25 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il habite et travaille à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du TOGO. Il est mécanicien et avec les fonds de son crédit il souhaite acheter les pièces détachées et une moto pour réparer et revendre. Avec les profits qu’il va dégager de son activité, il va mieux participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille maternelle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and a motorcycle to repair and sell.

loans.name: Bafana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bafana B. is 42 years old, married with two children. To earn a living and meet the needs of his family, he drives a motorcycle taxi in Adéta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He picks passengers up at the roadside and drops them off at their destinations. With this loan, his first from FECECAV, Monsieur B. wants to buy a new, more comfortable motorcycle. He hopes that with this improvement he will attract more customers, earn more money and improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Bafana B. est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il conduit un taxi moto à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Il prend les passagers au bord de la route et les dépose à leurs destinations. Avec ce crédit, son premièr de FECECAV, Monsieur B. espère acheter une nouvelle moto qui est plus confortable. Avec cette amélioration, il espère avoir plus des clients, gagner plus d’argent et changer les conditions de la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Abas

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abas A. is 18 years old, married with one child. To provide for the needs of his new family, he sells gas and runs a roadside telephone kiosk. With his first loan from FECEAV, Abas wants to expand his business by building a new hut for his telephone kiosk and buy more gas to resell. Thanks to Kiva for this opportunity to improve his life.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Abas A. est âgé de 18 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille nouvelle, il vend de l’essence et opère une cabine téléphonique au bord de la route. Avec son premier crédit de FECECAV, Abas veut augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en construisant une nouvelle baraque pour sa cabine et acheter plus de l'essence pour revendre. Merci à Kiva pour l’opportunité d’améliorer sa vie.

loans.use: Expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fridolin

texts.fr:
Mr. Fridolin K. is 60 years old, married, and the father of four children. To earn money he farms yams and pineapples in a field in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He barely meets the needs of his family because arable land is becoming scarcer and less fertile. With this loan, Fridolin hopes to buy tools and fertilizer to better farm his field and increase his yield. With income from his work he can improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Fridolin K. est âgé de 60 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent, il cultive les ignames et les ananas dans un champ à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Il subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille puisque les terres cultivables deviennent de plus en plus rares et moins fertiles. Avec ce crédit, Fridolin espère acheter l’équipement et l’engrais pour mieux cultiver son champ et augmenter sa production. Par les revenus de son activité, il peut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase tools and fertilizer to better farm his field

loans.name: Peace

texts.fr:
Mrs. Peace O. is 59 years old, married, and the mother of five children who are studying at school and in apprenticeships. She barely manages to meet the needs of her children because her husband’s earnings don’t cover the family’s costs. To earn money she sells vegetables along the roadside and in the market at Adéta, a town located around 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is a good borrower because she has already benefitted from two loans and her repayments were on time. With her third loan from FECECAV, Peace would like to buy fish, tomatoes, onions, and eggplant for retail.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Peace O. est âgée de 59 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants qui sont à l’école et en apprentissage. Elle supporte difficilement les besoins de ses enfants parce que la rémunération de son mari n’arrive pas à couvrir les charges de la famille. Pour gagner de l’argent, elle vend des légumes au bord la route et au marché d’Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Elle est un bon client puisqu’elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers. Avec son troisième crédit de FECECAV, Peace souhaite acheter les poissons, les tomates, les oignons et les aubergines pour revendre.

loans.use: Purchase food for retail

loans.name: Eliab Ramón

texts.es:
Eliab is 24 years old, he lives in La Primavera, is married and has two sons of 3 and 5 yeards old, his wife helps him in the administration of the family business. Eliab has a little manufacture where he prepares ice pops (little frozen juices in plastic bags) of several flavors.

He has seven years of experience and started with loans from microfinance institutions, he will invest the current loan in acquiring supplies to elaborate his products and increase diversity for his clients. His plans are to be able to expand his business to the interior of the country, and get a house to provide his children with a better life and more security.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Eliab tiene 24 años de edad, habita en el barrio La Primavera, es casado y tienen dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad, su esposa le ayuda en la administración del negocio familiar. Eliab tiene una pequeña fábrica en la cual elaboran bolis (pequeños jugos en bolsas) de diversos sabores. Tiene siete años de experiencia y empezó con préstamos a instituciones microfinancieras, con el préstamo que obtengan lo invertirá en la adquisición de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos y así poner a disposición de sus clientes más variedad de bolis. Sus planes son poder expandirse al interior del país, poder adquirir una casa para así darles a sus hijos un nivel de vida mejor y con más seguridad.

loans.use: To buy supplies to elaborate ice pops / Comprar materia prima para elaboración de bolis

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Moutawakilou

texts.fr:
Mr. Moutawakilou M. is 40 years old, married , and father of two children. To earn money he runs a general store in Adéta, a town located around 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With his first loan from FECECAV, he would like to purchase drinks, rice, cookies, canned foods, and various other goods to increase the capacity of his business. With this expansion, he can better respond to customer demand and meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Moutawakilou M. est âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent il opère un marché général à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec son premier crédit de FECECAV, il souhaite acheter les boissons, du riz, les biscuits, les boites de conserves et les autres produits variés pour augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Avec cet agrandissement, il peut mieux répondre aux demandes de ses clients et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase the capacity of his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Esse

texts.fr:
Mrs. Esse A. is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She takes part in household costs for her children who attend school. To earn money and to pay school expenses for her children, she runs a grocery store in Adeta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She has a strong customer base because she has already benefitted from two loans and her repayments were on time. With this third loan from FECECAV, Esse would like to supply her shop by buying powdered milk, candy, rice, and various other products for retail. She appreciates this opportunity to improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Esse A. est âgée de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle participe aux charges du foyer pour ses enfants à l’école. Pour gagner de l’argent et pouvoir payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants, elle opère un marché d’alimentation général à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Elle est une bonne cliente puisqu’elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers. Avec son troisième crédit de FECECAV, Esse souhaite approvisionner sa boutique en achetant du lait en poudre, des bonbons, du riz et les autres produits variés pour la revente. Elle apprécie l’opportunité d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Stock her shop

loans.name: Marisol Del Rosario

texts.es:
Marisol is 28 years old, she is married and lives in the Laureles Norte, she has three kids of 2, 3 and 7 years old, her husband sells beans and other variety of products in the wholesale market and helps with the home expenses.

Marisol’s business is a grocery store with eight years of experience, she started it with her own savings, the loan she is requesting will be invested in buying basic grains and satisfy her clients with new variety of products.

As any other small business, her plans are to expand her business and build a store to provide better attention to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Marisol tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene tres hijos de 2 ,3 y 7 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante de frijol y otra variedad de productos en el Mercado mayoreo y aporta para los gastos del hogar. El negocio de Marisol es una pulpería, con ochos años de experiencia e inició on fondos propios, con el préstamo que le otorguen espera invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de granos básicos y así satisfacer a sus clientes con nueva variedad de productos. Como todo pequeño comerciante sus planes son llegar a expnadir su negocio y así poner una tienda para dar mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy basic grains/beans and products to stock her business / Comprar granos básicos y productos perecederos para surtir el negocio

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Komi A. is 29 years old, married and the mother of one child. In order to earn money she runs a small general store with her husband in Adeta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Together she and her husband sell a variety of goods. With this loan, their second from FECECAV, they are hoping to stock their shop with flashlights and batteries, cell phone credit recharge cards, matches, and other products. With income from their business they can improve their family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Komi A. est âgée de 29 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Pour gagner de l’argent elle opère un petit marché général avec son mari à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Ensemble, elle et son mari vendent une variété des produits. Avec ce crédit, leur deuxième de FECECAV, ils espèrent approvisionner leur boutique en achetant les torches et les batteries, les cartes de recharges, les allumettes et autres produits. Par les revenus de leur activité, ils peuvent améliorer les conditions de vie de leur famille.

loans.use: Stock her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Flor De Fátima

texts.es:
Mrs. Floor is 42 years old, she is married and lives in Laureles Sur, she has 3 kids of 13, 20 and 25 years old. Her husband works as chief of a warehouse in a private company in Managua and helps her with the house expenses.

Mrs. Flor is a primary school teacher with several years of experience, she loves to tech children and provide them education. With the loan she expects to change the ceiling of her house because it is in very bad condition, and during the rain season affects her even more.

She hopes little by little to keep on improving her house to provide her family with better living conditions, and she hopes to help her children turn into professionals.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Flor tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, y habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene tres hijos de 13, 20, y 25 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como jefe de bodega en una empresa privada de la ciudad de Managua y aporta a los gastos del hogar. La Sra. Flor es docente de la primaria con mucho años de experiencia, ya que ama enseñarles a los niños y poder brindarles educación. Con el préstamo que le otorguen espera poder cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente está en mal estado, y las lluvias le afectan más aún. Espera poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, y lo más importante es que espera hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales.

loans.use: To change the ceiling of her one room house / Cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación

loans.name: Mapartar Group

texts.en:
Salamatu is 40 years old and married with four children. The Maparta group leader started her food business three years ago and was able to expand it with a previous loan from SMT. She is happy that the business allows her to meet some of the family’s expenses and supplement her husband’s meager income.

The group members are very cooperative and also operate a savings club. The savings are currently being kept by the leader as collateral; in the event that a member fails to pay the Kiva loan installment on time, the group will pay from the savings. The members would like to expand their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of $1,475.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, palm oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mafomba Group

texts.en: Alie T., 35 years old and married with four children, is the Mafomba group leader.  A very active group member, he owns two motor bikes that he rents out for daily income.  Alie intends to purchase another motor bike to increase his income.  Sinnah owns a food market and Osman has a general store.  The group is requesting a loan of $1000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike and stock for a general store.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe is a 33 year old young man, who lives in Villa Reconciliación, he is married and has two little children, his wife works as a hair stylist and helps with the home expenses.

Felipe works as chief of construction, and has fifteen years of experience. He works as an independent contractor, sometimes as a sub-contractor too.

He has been improving his life little by little, and has built his own one room house. With the loan he is requesting, he will improve his house and make divisions to create rooms and be more comfortable at home with his family.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Felipe es un joven de 33 años de edad, habitan en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, su esposa trabaja como estilista y de esta manera lo apoya en los gastos del hogar. Felipe trabaja en construcción, es maestro de obra y tiene quince años de experiencia. trabaj de forma independiente y algunas veces es contratado los trabajos son independientes o a veces trabaja con sub-contrato. Ha ido saliendo adelante poco a poco, y él mismo ha construido su casa de habitación. Con el préstamo que le otorguen va a hacer una mejora en su casa de habitación, desea hacer las divisiones de los cuartos para estar mas cómodo con la familia.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to create room partitions on his house / Comprar materiales de construcción para hacer divisiones de cuartos en su vivienda

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana lives in the neighborhood Anexo of Villa Venezuela, is married, is 46 years old and has three children , two that are independent and one that she still takes care of. Her husband is a painter and takes care of the home expenses.

The business of Mrs. Juana is selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics; she has eleven years of experience. She started her business with her own money. She needs a loan to invest in working capital in the form of inventory of clothing and shoes that she can then offer to her customers.

She wishes to be able to provide an education for her son and help him become a well-off man. She also wants to increase her sales and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Juana habita en el barrio Anexo de Villa Venezuela es casada y tiene 46 años de edad, con tres hijos, dos independientes y uno que está a su cargo, su esposo es pintor y aporta a los gastos de la familia.

El negocio de la Sra. Juana es la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos; tiene once años de experiencia. Su negocio lo inició con fondos propios, el préstamo lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de ropa y zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Desea poder darle educación a su hijo hasta convertirlo en un hombre de bien. y también desea poder incrementar las ventas para hacer su negocio más grande.

loans.use: Acquire a variety of clothing and shoes for sale in her business.

loans.name: Gbombaya Group

texts.en: Marie F., 40 years old and married with five children, is the Gbombaya group leader; this group has accessed loans from SMT twice previously.  Marie sells rice, palm oil and peanut butter and would like to expand her business to earn more income.  The other group members also plan to diversify their businesses and therefore are requesting a loan of $1,425.

loans.use: To purchase food stuffs, materials for tie dye production, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Click this link to view Norma's first loan

Norma is a member of the Village Bank Despertar, in which she has learned to be punctual and above all to save.

Norma lives with her boyfriend, is 29 years old and has three children ages 12, six, and three. Norma and her boyfriend have two stores where they sell a variety of clothes for children. They started out with very little capital and just a stand, but have been able to build the business and are constantly implementing and adding to their stores. They buy the clothes from Lima.

Norma needs a loan of 3000 soles ($US1,075) to purchase outfits, polos, pants and blouses. They will use their savings to construct a third floor in their house and to buy machines to use in a dressmaking shop.

Norma's dreams are to have her own place, to get her children a good education and to be happy with her boyfriend.

loans.use: To purchase outfits, polos, pants and blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy printed T-shirts for students at her school.

loans.name: Teithekeh Group

texts.en: Jane K., 42 years old and married with six children, is the Teithekeh group leader.   Her business of selling food stuffs and clothes has been in operation for more than seven years and is the major source of income for the family.  Previous loans enabled her to increase her stock and diversify the business, and she now plans to further expand. The other group members also would like to expand their businesses and so are requesting a loan of $1,125.

loans.use: To Increase the stock of food stuffs and clothes.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Click this link to view Yolanda's first loan

Yolanda is a member of the Village Bank Kutimuy which means "return" in Quechua.

Yolanda is married, 22 years old and has one child. She and her husband make milk products such as natural yogurts, ice-cream and babies' milk, which they sell in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Yolanda's business has grown little by little, and now has a very large production and variety of products.

Yolanda needs a loan of 2000 soles ($US725), which she will invest in the purchase of sugar, firewood and bags.

Yolanda's dreams are to formalize her business into a small manufacturing business, have a center of production, and to have her own house and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy sugar, firewood and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy assorted beauty products and perfumes for a small business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Justina's first loan

Justina is a member of the Village Bank Tu Angel Lucy (Your Angel Lucy).

Justina is a widow, 45 years old and has three children. Justina sells special foods and groceries at a stand in the market April 12. The specialty foods are prepared by her. Justina also sells food in the different neighborhoods and towns of the region during times of celebration.

Justina needs a loan of 1000 soles ($US375), money she will invest in the purchase of rice, noodles, aji pepper, cinnamon, cloves, cumin and garlic cloves.

Justina's dreams are to have her own capital, continue saving to build her business, and to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, aji pepper, cinnamon, cloves, cumin and garlic cloves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, pants and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Marina's first loan

Marina is a member of the Village Bank Tu Angel Lucy.

Marina is married, 50 years old and has four children. Marina makes various kinds of breads in an oven that she rents. She sells her breads by walking from store to store as well as in the April 12 Market in the afternoons. Marina also makes gelatine that she sells in the April 12 Market with the help of some children.

Marina needs a loan of 1200 soles ($US425), money which will be invested in the purchase of shortening, firewood, and flour.

Marina's dreams are to have a car with which she can transport her breads, to make her business better and to offer the best life to her children that she can.

loans.use: To buy shortening, firewood, and flour.

loans.name: Edith Karina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Edith's first loan

Edith is a member of the Village Bank Tu Angel Lucy.

Edith lives with her boyfriend, is 21 years old and has one child. Edith and her spouse have a bar in a house two blocks from the main plaza. At their bar they also organize parties and social events and are open daily, all day. They have been doing this for five years.

Edith needs a loan of 1000 soles ($US375) to invest in the purchase of beer and soda.

Edith's dreams are to make her business better, offer a good education to her children and have a beautiful house.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of beer and soda.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Sabina's first loan

Sabina has been a member of the Village Bank Nobleza for many years, during which time she has saved for many different necessities.

Sabina is married, 50 years old, and has eight children. Sabina sells meat at a stand in the F. Vivanco Market - meat which she acquires at the different fairs and markets in the towns of the region. Furthermore, Sabina is dedicated to the fattening of the pigs which she sells at her stand.

Sabina needs a loan of 1000 soles ($US375), money which she will invest in the purchase of pork, caprino (goat) and lamb.

Sabina's dreams are that her children become professionals, to build her business and to better her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase pork, caprino, and lamb.

loans.name: Teresa María

texts.es:
Teresa B. is originally from the Nagarote district in the city of León where she sells crafts, which she makes in her home.

Fifty-seven years old, Teresa has managed to get ahead thanks to the income generated by selling these crafts. Initially she was not very successful because she started out selling in small quantities. Since then, however, a lot of time has passed and Teresa has improved her financial situation.

Teresa is seeking the support of a Ceprodel loan, which will enable her to purchase crafts for sale. If her loan is approved, Teresa will be better off by using the loan to improve the conditions of her house.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Teresa B. es originaria del municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León donde tiene su venta de artesanías las cuales comercializa en su propia casa de habitación.

A sus 57 años, ha logrado salir adelante gracias a los ingresos generados por las ventas de estas artesanías. Sus inicios fueron muy malos por haber comenzado a vender en pequeñas cantidades pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado mejorar su condición económica.

Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de las artesanías para la venta. Con el otorgamiento del crédito se beneficia porque así puede mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of crafts

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca U. is originally from the Nagarote district in the city of León. She works hard as owner of a small general store, which she operates out of her home in a neighboring area called La Paz Centro.

Blanca has been running her business for 8 years. With income from her business, Blanca has managed to get ahead and provide for the education of her two school-age children.

Blanca is turning to Ceprodel for a loan, which she will use to purchase merchandise. She has had 8 loans with the organization, all of which were paid on time and according to the terms of the agreement.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Blanca U. es originaria del municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León y se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su casa de habitación en una zona aledaña a Nagarote llamada La Paz Centro.

Actualmente ella posee 8 años de dedicarse a esta labor y por medio de este ingreso ha logrado salir adelante proporcionándole los estudios a sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar.

Hoy en día ella acude a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener un crédito con el cual pueda obtener su mercadería. Actualmente posee un total de ocho créditos con la institución pagados en tiempo y forma correcta según lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
For several years Concepción C. has operated a small business making food and bread, which she makes in her house and later sells in the neighborhood.

Concepción is 48 years old and is raising three children and providing for their development and education. She has turned to Ceprodel for a loan which she will use to purchase the ingredients necessary for making her delicious dishes and breads. She hopes with confidence that her loan application will be approved so she can continue supporting her humble family.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La dama Concepción C. se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de elaboración de manjares o pan los que son elaborados en su propia casa de habitación para luego comercializarlos en su sector de habitación.

Ella es una dama de 48 años y con tres hijos en el deber de mantener y proporcionarles las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo y educación. Hoy en día se ha acercado a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar la materia prima para elaborar los deliciosos manjares y panes. Espera confiadamente que su crédito le sea otorgado y así continuar manteniendo su humilde familia.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Hector Vidal

texts.es:
Hector Vidal is originally from the Nagarote district in the city of León, where he works hard as owner of a tailor business. He makes all kinds of clothing and accessories, such as trousers for men and women, shirts, and backpacks, etc.

As a 43-year-old father of two small, school-age girls, Hector is motivated by the desire to provide his daughters with the conditions necessary for their development.

Currently Hector doesn’t have the financial resources needed to purchase materials such as fabric, zippers, and buttons, etc. As such he has turned to Ceprodel for a loan to continue operating in the tailoring business.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

El caballero Hector Vidal es originario del municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León y se dedica muy esforzadamente a su propio negocio de sastrería elaborando todo tipo de ropa como lo es pantalones para caballeros y damas, camisas, mochilas, etc.

A sus 43 años de edad es padre de dos pequeñas hijas en edad escolar el cual son el motivo de sus esfuerzos en el negocio para brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

La necesidad que hoy en día el señor Hector atraviesa es que no posee el recurso económico para la compra de materiales de trabajo como lo son telas, ziperes, botones, hijos, etc. Por esta razón ha acudido en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y así continuar con su actividad económica en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Candida is 36 years old, lives in the neighborhood Villa Reconciliacion, is single and has a one year old son. The business of Mrs. Candida is the selling of cosmetics and tortillas. She has six years of experience and started her business with financial help from her family.

She needs the loan to invest in capital, in the purchase of cosmetics, corn flour mix and firewood. This will strengthen her business and make her able to always have the products for her customers. In the future, she plans to increase her sales, improve her living conditions and educate her son.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Candida tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es soltera y tiene un niño de un 1 año. El negocio de doña Candida es venta de cosmético y tortillas, tiene seis años de experiencia e inició con ayuda monetaria de parte de su familia.

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en capital, en la compra de cosmético, maseca y leña para poner sólido su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes siempre los productos. A futuro es incrementar sus ventas, y mejorar el nivel de vida y darle educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and raw materials for the making of tortillas.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma’s parents were models of perseverance and dedication. Despite their modest financial situation, they managed to provide stability and security for their beloved children. Tragically, both of her parents were killed in a terrible traffic accident while they were at work buying and selling cheese. Vilma inherited her parents’ enthusiasm and other good qualities. She has therefore taken up their occupation, which she finds very satisfying. Vilma is the young mother of a beautiful 10-month-old baby girl. She purchases cheese on market days in the small towns of Huata, Coata, and Taraco, and once she has gathered a sufficient amount she sells the cheese wholesale in the markets of Arequipa and Cuzco. This diligent mother wishes to have your support.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Los padres de Vilma fueron ejemplo de constancia y dedicación ambos pese a su condición económica lograron brindarle seguridad y tranquilidad a sus queridos hijos, desafortunadamente fallecieron en un terrible accidente de tránsito mientras ejercían su noble labor de compra y venta de quesos. Vilma heredó el mismo entusiasmo y cualidades de sus padres, es por ello que ahora viene dedicándose activamente a esta ocupación, que dicho sea de paso la va llenando de satisfacción. Ésta joven madre de una linda bebé de apenas 10 meses adquiere sus productos los días de feria en los pueblitos de Huata, Coata y Taraco, luego de reunir una buena cantidad los vende al por mayor en los mercados de Arequipa y Cuzco.El deseo de esta diligente madre es contar con vuestro apoyo.

loans.use: Increasing her capital so she can purchase more cheese to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosita, as she is affectionately known, has improved her quality of life thanks to her business of buying and selling second-hand items. This diligent mother comes from the province of Huancane and moved to the city of Juliaca more than 15 years ago with her 3 wonderful children. She has used the income she has earned over the years to build a small house, which provides both shelter from the heat and a home for her loving family. Rosita purchases her products second-hand in the city of Tacna, and then sells them for extremely reasonable prices on a busy street in the city of Juliaca. By working in her business she is hoping to offer her 3 children the opportunity to go to university. She wants to provide all of the necessary tools that will help them to be successful in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Gracias a su negocio de compra y venta de artefactos de segundo uso ha mejorado su condición de vida Doña Rosita como cariñosamente la tratan. Ésta diligente madre es natural de la provincia de Huancané y hace más de 15 años junto a sus 3 adorables hijos radica en la ciudad de Juliaca. Con los ingresos que obtuvo a lo largo de estos años ha construido su vivienda, casita que cobija bajo el calor de un hogar a su querida familia; Rosita adquiere sus artefactos de segunda mano en la ciudad de Tacna, luego los ofrece a precios sumamente cómodos en una concurrida avenida de la ciudad de Juliaca.Con este negocio pretende brindarle estudios superiores a sus 3 retoños, a quienes desea facilitarles las herramientas necesarias para que puedan alcanzar el éxito en sus vidas.

loans.use: Increasing her capital so she can increase her selection of products

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
The business of raising livestock has turned into an activity that provides the most important income for Violeta’s family. She is from the province of Huancané and three years ago moved to the city of Juliaca. Additionally, this diligent young women does agricultural work, inherited from her parents, who, like Violeta, succeed in facing some of their expenses with the fruits Mother Nature gives them. This diligent young woman buys her animals (sheep and cattle) in the districts of Taraco and Huancané. Later she cares for them and feeds them, to increase their weight and size, so that she can sell them in the same towns at higher prices. The economic benefits she has achieved have given her tranquility and her quality of life has improved notably. Violeta is sure that increasing her capital will help her obtain more satisfactory results.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El comercio de ganado se ha convertido en la actividad que le otorga el ingreso económico más importante a la familia de Violeta, quien es natural de la provincia de Huancané y hace más de 3 años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, adicionalmente a esta labor ésta diligente joven se dedica a la agricultura labores que heredó de sus queridos y humildes padres quienes al igual que Violeta logran afrontar parte de sus gastos con los frutos que les ofrece la madre naturaleza.Esta diligente joven compra sus animalitos (ovinos y vacunos) en los distritos de Taraco y Huancané, luego de cuidarlos y alimentarlos para que obtengan un peso y talla adecuada los procede a vender en los mismos pueblitos a precios más elevados; los beneficios económicos que logra conseguir ha obtenido tranquilidad y su calidad de vida se ha elevado notablemente, Violeta está segura que aumentando su capital logrará obtener resultados más satisfactorios.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater number of animals

loans.name: Matías

texts.es:
Matías is a humble 21 year old from the district of Arapa. The limited economic resources of his parents barely allowed them to finish their elementary school studies. Since then he has worked in agriculture and cattle-raising. But Matías felt a strong desire to find better opportunities to succeed. That is how, with the little he had, he left his little town. Now he is located in the city of Juliaca and started his business of providing mobile phones to people in his city to make calls. In the beginning, they were not his phones, but he began making income and he began acquiring them. Taking advantage of a strategic location where he could provide his phone services, he decided to also sell a great variety of sweets. Now, this young entrepreneur is very popular and loved in his town and he would like to touch your generous hearts with the hope of receiving help, help that he will invest to improve his candy shop.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Matías es un humilde joven de 21 años de edad procedente del distrito de Arapa, los bajos recursos económicos de sus padres apenas le permitieron concluir sus estudios primarios, desde entonces se dedicó a la agricultura y a la ganadería, pero Matías sentía un gran deseo de buscar mejores oportunidades de superación, es así que con lo poco que tenia decidió salir de su pueblito.Actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, e inició su labor brindando llamadas a través de artefactos móviles a la población, en un principio no eran suyos pero conforme fue obteniendo ingresos los fue adquiriendo, aprovechando el lugar estratégico en donde brinda sus servicios de llamadas decidió también vender una inmensa variedad de golosinas, actualmente este joven emprendedor es muy popular y querido en dicha localidad y desea tocar vuestros generosos corazones con la esperanza de recibir ayuda, ayuda que será invertida para ampliar su puestito de golosinas.

loans.use: Investment of capital to increase his grocery shop

loans.name: Kety

texts.es:
Kety and Alan became parents at a very young age. Since giving the gift of life to their young son, Gustavo, they have worked hard to offer their best efforts in order to bring their child a better quality of life. Alan works daily as a master builder in construction, while Kety works on the weekends in her business selling plastic products for the home. From Monday to Friday she works part-time as a typographer, and in the afternoon she works toward finishing her university degree. They hope that one day Alan might also be able to continue his studies. This young mother is counting on your support in order to improve her business and thereby succeed in her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Kety y Alan se convirtieron en padres a muy corta edad, desde que le concedieron el don de vida a su pequeño niño, Gustavo, se esfuerzan y ponen lo mejor de sí en sus actividades con el fin de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.Alan trabaja diariamente como maestro de construcción, en tanto Kety los fines de semana se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos plástico para el hogar, de lunes a viernes trabaja medio tiempo en una tipografía y por las tardes con esfuerzo viene siguiendo sus estudios superiores, con la esperanza de que algún día Alan pueda retomar sus estudios.El deseo de esta joven madre es contar con vuestro apoyo, para mejorar su negocio, y así concretar sus planes.

loans.use: To improve their product offerings

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
This happy and diligent woman is Gladys, loving mother of five dear children, who despite her limited economic resources provides with pleasure post-secondary education for her children. Gladys has a business that buys and sells animals (pigs) from the districts of Huancané and Taraco, which she sells on Sundays in the plaza dominical in the city of Juliaca, Peru. Her beloved husband Raymundo works every day providing transportation as a motorcycle taxi driver for the population of Juliaca. Thanks to the efforts of both they have been building a home and, of most importance, providing well-being and the tools necessary for their children to become successful and be good people in their future lives. Gladys’s hope is to receive a loan that will increase her capital. For this reason she is trying to touch your generous heart in the hopes of receiving a favorable response soon.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta dama alegre y diligente es Gladys, madre amorosa D. cinco queridos hijos, quien pese a sus bajos recursos económicos viene brindándoles con satisfacción estudios superiores a sus retoños, Gladys se dedica al negocio D. compra y venta D. animales (CERDITOS) D. los distritos D. Huancané y Taraco y los venD. los días domingos en la plaza dominical D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, en tanto su querido esposo Raymundo todos los días D. la semana trabaja brindando movilidad en un mototaxi a la población Juliqueña.Gracias al esfuerzo D. ambos vienen construyendo su vivienda y lo más importante brindándoles bienestar y las herramientas necesarias a todos sus hijos para que a futuro puedan alcanzar el éxito en sus vidas y puedan ser hombres D. bien.El deseo D. Gladys es contar con mayor capital D. inversión, para ello espera tocar tu generoso corazón con la esperanza D. recibir pronto una respuesta favorable.

loans.use: To increase her capital in order to purchase a larger quantity of pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Beautiful hand-knit products have become the most important work for Segundina, who with her agile and talented hands creates pretty and warm gloves. After knitting a large quantity, she sells them in bulk on the weekends in the market of San José in the city of Juliaca, Peru. Segundina did not have the opportunity to complete her high school education because of limited resources, and she does not want her dear children to have the same experience. For this reason she works hard and puts forth her best effort in this noble pursuit in order that her children will have better opportunities in the future. Segundina hopes for help from your good heart.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Los bellos trabajos de tejidos a mano se ha convertido en la labor más importante de Segundina, quien con sus ágiles y talentosas manos elabora hermosos y cálidos guantes que luego de tejer en una buena cantidad cada fin de semana los oferta al por mayor en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca.Segundina no tuvo la oportunidad de concluir sus estudios secundarios por falta de recursos económicos, y no desea que sus queridos hijos pasen por lo mismo, es por ello que se esfuerza y pone su mayor dedicación en su noble actividad con el fin de que sus hijos en un futuro puedan tener mayores oportunidades.Segundina espera la ayuda de tu buen corazón.

loans.use: To acquire a large quantity of raw material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofia is a diligent and responsible mother. Since she began her family, she has worked in different activities to get her household ahead. She is from the city of Rosada de Lampa but since she moved to the city of Juliaca she has made beautiful clothing pieces, offering American clothing and selling candies from a cart. Also, she sells beer in the different plazas in the city where she lives, Juliaca. While Sofia does this work, her husband Héctor works as a driver for a Juliaca city company and, between the two of them, they are building a warm home for their beloved children. Her need to increase the products they offer have driven them to request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Sofía, es una diligente y responsable madre, desde que formó su familia trabajó en diferentes actividades con el fin de sacar adelante su hogar. Ella es natura de la ciudad Rosada de Lampa pero desde que radica en la ciudad de Juliaca trabajó confeccionando hermosas prendas de vestir, ofertando ropa americana y vendiendo golosinas en forma ambulatoria, adicionalmente a esta labor Sofía se dedica a la venta de cerveza en las diferentes plazas de la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca.Mientras Sofía se dedica a esta labor su esposo Héctor trabaja como chofer en una empresa urbana de la ciudad de Juliaca y entre ambos vienen construyendo su vivienda para acoger bajo el calor de un hogar a sus amados hijos.Su necesidad de incrementar la oferta de sus productos la conducen a solicitar un préstamo .

loans.use: Increase capital to improve the products she offers

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa is an active and enterprising woman. Despite her limited economic resources, she provides her two beloved children with their schooling, who have converted into the principle motivation for her to persevere in her business. She does various activities like selling American clothing, vegetable, quinua juice, and currently hot chocolate as an ambulatory vendor. For his part, her hardworking husband Alberto provides cellular services to the town of Juliaqueña by his means of transportation, his tricycle. This diligent mother counts on your indispensable support that will permit her to invest in her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Tomasa, es una mujer activa y emprendedora, pese a sus bajos recursos económicos viene brindándoles sus respectivos estudios a sus dos queridos hijos, quienes se convirtieron en el principal motor que la impulsa a perseverar en sus negocios.Se dedica a innumerables actividades tales como: la venta de ropa americana, verduras, jugo de quinua y actualmente venta de chocolate caliente en forma ambulatoria, por su parte su laborioso esposo Alberto brinda servicios de movilidad a la población Juliaqueña en su herramienta de transporte, su triciclo.Esta diligente madre desea contar con tu apoyo, indispensable ayuda que le permitirá invertir en su pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Investment of capital to improve the products she offers

loans.name: Ynés

texts.es:
Doña Ynés and her beloved children are very helpful in the home and in her business. For three years, her family has lived in one of the most distant neighborhoods in the city of Juliaca, where they have built a small home and where they have set aside space to open her little grocery store that they have named “Bodeguita San Pedro.” This little shop is very useful to its new neighbors who are content because of the good service they get. At the same time, they have many requests that Doña Ynés’s shop cannot satisfy. While she does housework and fulfills her role as mother, her supportive husband Isidro is employed as a master mason and with the support of their four children they have been working toward the goals they have achieved. Doña Ynés and her children count on your support to increase and establish her little shop and in this way satisfy her clients’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Ynés y sus queridos hijos son muy colaboradores en su hogar y en su negocio, su familia hace 3 años vive en uno de los barrios más alejados de la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde construyeron su pequeña vivienda y en donde adecuaron un espacio para abrir su tiendita de abarrotes al cuál bautizaron con el nombre de “ Bodeguita San Pedro”, esta tiendita es muy servicial para sus nuevos vecinos quienes se sienten contentos por la buena atención que reciben, pero al mismo tiempo tienen innumerables solicitudes que la bodeguita de doña Ynés no puede satisfacer.Mientras ella se dedica a sus labores del hogar y a cumplir su rol de madre su esforzado esposo Isidro se desempeña como maestro albañil y juntos con apoyo de sus cuatro hijos vienen llevando a cabo cada una de las metas que se han trazado.Doña Ynés y sus hijos desean contar con tu apoyo para ampliar e implementar su bodeguita, y así complacer las solicitudes de sus clientes.

loans.use: Investment of capital to implement her small daily work space

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
The parents of Roland, always dreamed that their children would move to cities with better opportunities for work, that is why a year ago he and his younger brother decided to leave their native town of Ayaviri and relocate to the city of Juliaca. These young entrepreneurs now live in a room located in the city and they began with their business offering calling services, in the beginning they only worked with one рhone but now they have 6 and work with other unemployed men. The desire of Roland is to make shirts, for this he has acquired two sewing machines but still needs capital to acquire raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Los padres de Ronald, siempre soñaron con que sus hijos emigren a ciudades con mayores oportunidades de trabajo, es así que él y su menor hermano hace más de 1 año decidieron salir de su pueblo natal Ayaviri y radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca.Estos jóvenes emprendedores actualmente viven en una habitación alquilada de dicha ciudad e iniciaron con el negocio de brindar servicios de llamadas móviles, en un principio trabajaron sólo con un celular pero ahora ya cuentan con seis con los que brindan trabajo a otros muchachos desempleados.El deseo de Ronald es confeccionar poleras y camisetas, para ello ya adquirió sus dos máquinas de coser pero aún le falta capital para adquirir materia prima, con ese fin recurre a sus solidarios corazones, con la esperanza de recibir pronta respuesta favorable.

loans.use: capital to acquire raw material

loans.name: Tuli Pelesasa's Group

texts.en:
This group from Fatausi contains of three women. This is their first loan cycle and they are asking for $750 each. This money will be used to start up or improve their businesses. Their husbands, children and other family members are really supportive of their efforts. They are from one village and they work together and support each other in their group. These are their first loans and if they do well then they will be eligible for more.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, equipments and tools for the businesses

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmilla is very content to continue succeeding with her family business that she recently opened. It is a restaurant near her house and everyday in the afternoon she offers her distinguished guests chicken breast, her desire is to better this business and move it soon to a more central zone in the city so that she can continue strengthening her clientele and because of this she is requesting the loan. Help luzmila to succeedwith this new business that will surely bring her conmfort.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Luzmila, está muy contenta de seguir adelante con el negocio familiar que recientemente aperturó. Es un restaurante cerca de su casa y todos los días en las tardes ofrece a su distinguida clientela pollos a la braza, su deseo es mejorar este negocio y trasladarlo pronto a una zona más céntrica de la ciudad para lo cual seguirá esforzándose para ofrecerle lo mejor a su clientela y es por ello que solicita un préstamo. Apoya a Luzmila a seguir adelante con este nuevo negocio que está segura le traerá mucho bienestar.

loans.use: capital to better her restaurant

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is an insistent, hardworking woman who always fights to protect the unity of her family within her home and this desire has cultivated in her the strength of implementing a brick factory and now that 12 years have passed of this intense labor she has seen the fruits of her labor, bit by bit with strength she has been able to acquire a vehicle that serves her to transport her products to other locations for purchase and requests of large quantities and her desire is to better her workshop conditions to continue her work. .

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es una mujer muy empeñosa y trabajadora que siempre lucha por conservar la unidad familiar dentro de su hogar y ese deseo ha cultivado en ella las fuerzas para implementar junto a su familia una fábrica de ladrillos y ahora que han transcurrido 12 años de esa intensa labor ha visto muchos frutos, poco a poco con esfuerzo han podido adquirir un vehículo que les sirve para transportar su producto hasta los lugares de compra y pedidos en grandes cantidades y su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de fabricaciones para seguir colaborando con el cumplimiento de los sueños de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: to inject capital into her business to better the conditions of her workshop

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angele

texts.es:
