Raquel R. is un a 30 year old woman, who works a sales promoter in a private company in Managua, where she has worked for a year and seven months. She lives in Memorial Sandino with her husband and two little children. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Both have work tirelessly to improver their family life and have a house in good living conditions. They have built their house little by little, because their income is not enough, they need a loan, and they have requested a loan to AFODENIC, to buy construction materials to build a room in their house. They dream on being able to acquire a car to make it work as a taxi in order to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Raquel R. es una mujer de 30 años, que se desempeña como promotora de ventas en una empresa privada de managua, lugar en el cual ha estado trabajando durante un año y siete meses. Habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino junto a su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una unidad de taxi. Ambos han luchado arduamente para salir adelante junto a su familia y dentro de esta lucha está el poder tener una vivienda digna para habitar, la han ido cosntruyendo poco a poco, debido a que sus ingresos no son suficientes, necesitan de créditos para poder contruir, por lo cual solicitan el crédito en AFODENIC, para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto en su vivienda. Los sueños de esta familia es poder adquirir un vehículo taxi para así poder mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: To build a room in her house / Construir habitación en su vivienda

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rosalín

texts.es:
Rosalin, is very animated and has a lot of energy, due to the fact that her brick factory that is her principal economic fountain she has been granted the possibility to finish her teaching studies. Now her desire is to continue succeeding even more and to work without neglecting her workshop, for this reason she has decided to request a loan to better her daily work space and increase her earnings and begin her career path that she has always wanted to fulfill.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosalin, está muy animada y con mucha energía, debido a que su fábrica de ladrillos que es su fuente de financiamiento principal le ha otorgado la posibilidad de culminar satisfactoriamente sus estudios de docencia. Ahora su deseo es seguir superándose aún más y trabajar sin descuidar su fábrica, por esa razón ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para mejorar su espacio de labor diaria a fin de incrementar sus ganancias y consolidarlo para emprender su gran camino en la carrera que desde siempre ha deseado desempeñar.

loans.use: Improving the work space

loans.name: Vaipalolo Faataui's Group

texts.en:
Gataivai is one of the largest villages on the island of Savaii. This group is new and its members are asking for their first loan. Most of these women work in flea markets where they sell Samoan fruits, vegetables, tools and other items that they can purchase for resale. Some of them also sell from shops at the front of their houses. They are hard working women and they cooperate and work together in supporting each and every one of their center members.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of materials, food and stock for their businesses.

loans.name: Augusto César

texts.es:
Augusto Cesar is 27 years old, lives in the neighborhood Hialeah in Managua. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. His wife is a housewife and is the one that takes care of the home and their two small children.

Augusto Cesar makes a living buying and selling recyclable products. Two years ago his search for a business that would generate income started him in the buying and selling of recyclable materials. Thanks to his good management skills, this business has done well.

He needs the loan to purchase recycled products from people that sell them, in order to later resell them. He hopes to continue and grow his business, increasing the quantity of products that he buys and sells.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Augusto César tiene 27 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua, es casado y tiene 2 hijos un niño y una niña. Su esposa es ama de casa, y es quien se encarga del cuido del hogar y de sus dos pequeños hijos.

Augusto César se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de reciclaje. Hace 2 años en busca de un negocio que le generara ingresos, empezó con la compra y venta de productos de reciclaje, le ha ido bien en su negocio, gracias a su buena administración.

Requiere del préstamo para adquirir productos reciclados de las personas que se lo venden, para él despues venderlos. Espera poder seguir con su negocio y que éste crezca en cantidad de productos de sus compras y ventas.

loans.use: Acquire products that can be recycled to increase his sales.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz, is a young woman with many desires to succeed and because of that she has made the important decision to start her own business. Her aunt’s business will transfer to her and today with her aunt’s help and talent she has been able to establish her own economic income that would help her take over the business. Her dream is to establish her career that is about to begin and she has a goal to extend her sales market that is why she is requesting a loan to increase her capital. With your help, Liz will make her dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Liz, es una joven con muchos deseos de superación por lo cual han tomado una decisión importante en su vida la de emprender su propio negocio por medio del traspaso del negocio que antes su tía administraba y hoy con su ingenio y talento ella ha podido establecer un ingreso económico propio que le permite poder ayudar a los suyos su sueño es solventar la carrera que está a punto de iniciar y tiene como meta extender su mercado de ventas para lo cual solicita un préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo. Con tu apoyo Liz consolidará estos anhelos en una realidad.

loans.use: Increasing her capital to acquire a better quantity of products.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina, has been working in the business of making and selling sodas for wholesale and she has been in this occupation for 2 years, she learned the art of sales from her sister-in-law and until now her capacity to sell has been growing day by day. She wants to increase her merchandise even more and in this way she can help her last two children continue their studies and it is for this reason that she requests a loan. Help Florentina succeed with these projects.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Florentina, durante años ha estado trabajando en el negocio de venta y repartición de gaseosas al por mayor y ya lleva en este negocio 12 años de ocupación, aprendió el arte de las ventas de su cuñada y hasta ahora día a día mejora su capacidad de venta. Ella quiere incrementar aún más la mercadería con que cuenta y así poder ayudar a sus dos últimos hijos a seguir estudiando y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo. Apoya a Florentina a seguir adelante con estos proyectos.

loans.use: Increasing her capital to acquire a better quantity of soda products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Aotoa Faataui's Group

texts.en:
The two ladies of this group are from the village of Gataivai. They grow taro (known as "taamu"), bananas, yams, and various other crops. Their husbands help them and they run their businesses together as a family. They are good ladies and they attend weekly meeting and plan to make weekly repayments. They are very happy to be getting loans not only as it helps to start up their businesses but also because it helps their families as a whole.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural chemicals and tools.

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es:
Yudith, is the mother of 3 small sweet children who have become her best work incentive with earnestness she is devoted every day to her agricultural activities which absorb a great portion of her time. That is why we find her happily working at home on the selection of products, hoping that the next season will increase production every day and bring better benefits to her home. She needs seeds and fertilizers to begin a new agricultural cycle, but the cost of fertilizers are increasingly greater and her economic state limits her ability to buy them. And these are the reasons why she is contacting you, to apply for a loan and carry out her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Yudith, es madre de 3 dulces pequeños quienes se han convertido en su mejor aliciente laboral, con ahínco se dedica a diario a sus labores agrícolas, actividad que le absorbe gran cantidad de tiempo. Por esa razón la encontramos trabajando en la selección de sus productos en su hogar donde muy alegremente trabaja, esperando que la próxima temporada pueda incrementar su producción y llevar cada día más y mejores beneficios a su hogar. Ahora requiere de semillas y de abonos para empezar un nuevo ciclo de cultivo pero los costos de los abonos son cada vez mayores y sus posibilidades económicas la limitan a adquirirlos. Y son estas las razones por la cual se contacta con vosotros para solicitar un préstamo y llevar a cabo sus propósitos.

loans.use: Increase in capital to buy compost and fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.name: Donia

texts.es:
Donia, is a person who knows how to value the work of her farm animals, with their immense strength they are able to help prepare the land for the cultivation of her products, for that reason she cares for them very much. Recently she began to implement a small grocery shop in her home and has realized the great value of this store to her neighbors and it has become a suitable space to make daily purchases near home. Before her shop neighbors had to walk long hours to get what was necessary. Donia wishes to improve her space and provide a greater quantity of goods.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Donia, es una de las personas que sabe valorar el trabajo de sus animalitos, debido a que estos con la inmensa fuerza que poseen la ayudan a preparar la tierra para el cultivo de sus productos por esa razón los cuida y engríe siempre. De manera adicional hace poco a empezado a implementar una pequeña tiendita de comestibles en su hogar y se ha dado cuenta de la gran utilidad de esta para sus vecinos ya que se ha convertido en un espacio adecuado y cercano para realizar las compras diarias ya que antes tenían que caminar por largas horas para obtener lo necesario. El deseo de Donia es mejorar mucho más su espacio y ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.use: Injection of capital to meet production demands from her neighbors and friends.

loans.name: Feagaiga Komiti's Group

texts.en:
This is a new group from Vaimaga. They are very happy to have this first access to a loan because none of them has worked before. They chose to be in the programme because they thought that starting a business is like starting a new life for their families, especially in the mothers’ normal schedules. They are from one village and they are working together to support each other.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment and inventory.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Victor, is an older man and with his wife they are fully dedicated to farming and cattle raising. The cattle raising helps them during difficult agricultural production periods. They are known by their neighbors for their great work capacity, and are appreciated because of their great heart and commitment to the neediest. To continue working and helping the needy they need to increase their production and purchase one more cow to make and sell cheese in the city. This will improve their income and resolve without difficulty their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Victor, es un señor de avanzada edad y junto a su esposa están plenamente dedicados a la agricultura y a la crianza de vacas que le ayudan en los tiempos difíciles en su producción agrícola. Y por su gran capacidad de trabajo son muy reconocidos por sus vecinos que aprecian a esta pareja de agricultores, además por su gran corazón y compromiso con los más necesitados. Ahora para seguir trabajando y de la misma manera seguir ayudando necesitan incrementar su producción y comprarse una vaquita más para elaborar quesos y venderlos en la ciudad. De esta manera podrán mejorar sus ingresos económicos y así solventarán sin dificultad los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase compost and fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, is a woman who strives to offer her best to her children, thanks to the teachings of her parents she serves as an expert farmer. As a result she can care for, and produce fruits of excellent quality for the open market, and above all she can meet the needs of her home and provide adequate education to her young daughter who is the driving force behind her work. Despite being relatively young at this activity, she is one of the best. She requests a loan to continue to grow and improve her products and farming techniques.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth, es una dama que se empeña por ofrecer a sus hijos lo mejor de ella y gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres se desempeña como una experta agricultora. Gracias a ello puede cuidar y producir frutos de excelente calidad requeridos en el mercado y sobre todo puede atender las necesidades de su hogar y ofrecerle una adecuada educación a su pequeña hija que es el motor de su trabajo. A pesar de ser joven en esta actividad es una de las mejores y para seguir creciendo desea mejorar aún más sus productos y procesos de siembra y para ello solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase compost, fertilizers and improved seeds.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, is a very active and hard working. Her neighbors are witnesses to her daily efforts and labor that benefit her beloved family, they respect and appreciate Julia for her dedication. Her wish is to enhance her farming activities, however it is necessary to inject a sum of money to achieve her goal. Through Prism she extends her request for a loan and is committed to doubling her dedication to achieve her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia, es una dama muy empeñosa y trabajadora y testigo D. sus esfuerzos y labor diaria en beneficio D. su amada familia son sus vecinos quienes respetan y aprecian a Doña Julia por su dedicación. Desea mejorar aún más sus actividades y es muy necesario la inyección D. una suma D. dinero para lograr lo que se ha propuesto y a través D. Prisma les extienD. su petición con el compromiso D. doblar su dedicación para alcanzar su sueño.

loans.use: Increase in capital to improve her farming and ranching.

loans.name: Rober

texts.es:
Rober, is an excellent father and farmer who is dedicated to his work, his goal is to better his farming techniques that way he fulfills the needs within his home especially for his wife and daughter. He travels daily without delay to his agricultural lands and is aware of every change that occurs. Due to high demand for his products, because of their excellent quality, size and flavor, Rober has decided to plant more and apply for a loan to purchase natural compost and fertilizers that will contribute to an excellent harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

ROBER, es un excelente padre agricultor que se dedica por entero a su actividad con el propósito de mejorar cada vez más sus procesos y así incrementar las satisfacciones dentro de su hogar para su amada esposa e hija. A diario se desplaza sin demora hacia sus tierras de cultivo y esta pendiente de cada cambio. Debido a la gran demanda de sus productos por la excelente calidad, tamaño y sabor de los mismos ha decidido incrementar su siembra y solicita un préstamo para adquirir abonos y fertilizantes naturales que colaborarán para obtener un excelente resultado.

loans.use: To purchase natural compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix has been involved in agriculture since childhood. Now that he has his own family, agriculture is the main source of income for his beloved family. His crop has improved with every harvest and Felix wishes to improve it further by injecting new capital.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

FELIX, desde pequeño estuvo vinculado a la labor agrícola y ahora que ya ha conformado su hogar esta labor se ha convertido en la principal fuente de ingreso para su amada familia.Sus productos han ido mejorando cosecha a cosecha y desea incrementar la calidad de sus productos con una nueva inyección de capital.

loans.use: Investment of capital to improve the quality of agricultural produce

loans.name: Bilda

texts.es:
Bilda is a happy and hard-working woman and due to her performance as a farmer she has had the opportunity to travel abroad and publicize and gain recognition for Peruvian agricultural products on behalf of her community.

She produces citrus fruits, bananas, and coffee beans, which she sells in the Capital. Due to her willingness to transport her produce, she has succeeded in attracting customers in the surrounding towns in addition to her local area.

Now, by investing a large sum of money, she plans to increase her sales of coffee beans further, her most profitable product, by improving the quality of the beans.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

BILDA, es una dama muy jovial y muy trabajadora gracias a sus actividades y desempeño como agricultora tuvo la oportunidad de viajar al exterior en representación de su comunidad y dar a conocer los productos que producimos en el Perú.Ella posee terrenos de producción de cítricos, plátanos y café los cuales comercializa en la capital y gracias a su movilidad puede trasladarse a captar compradores en su localidad además de trasladar algunos de sus productos por las ciudades más cercanas. Y ahora no solo va captando clientela sino que desea también captar su interés para mejorar su producción de café que es el producto más rentable en el mercado y para su siembra y cosecha se invierte grandes sumas de dinero.

loans.use: Capital investment for the production of coffee beans

loans.name: Lautasi Galo Fuauli's Group

texts.en:
This new group from Vaimaga includes four women, most of whom run sewing businesses. Because most of them are older, they are no longer suited to hard labor and sewing is the best business for them allowing them to exercise their hands and fingers. These old ladies are very supportive not only of other members of their group but also of the loan officers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of material, thread, needles, and new sewing machines.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia is a farmer and, thanks to the farmland allocated to her by her community, she produces citrus fruits. She is recognised as a strong and entrepreneurial woman in her community for her hard work and her strength in overcoming obstacles in looking after the welfare of her loved ones.

Due to the high price of fertilizers, she has been unable to use sufficient amounts to improve the quality and quantity of her produce. That is why she appeals to your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

AMALIA, es agricultora y gracias a los terrenos que la comunidad ha repartido entre sus miembros, pueD. dedicarse a la producción D. cítricos. Ella es reconocida como una mujer emprendedora y luchadora dentro D. su comunidad por su labor y por su fortaleza para sobrellevar las dificultades y siempre velar por el bienestar D. sus seres queridos.Debido al elevado precio D. loa abonos y fertilizantes para elevar la calidad D. sus productos no ha podido exceder a estos y ese es el motivo por el cual apela a la generosidad D. vuestros corazones.

loans.use: Purchase of natural fertilisers

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is the mother of 3 children who are studying with the goal of entering the professional world. These children inspire Hermelinda to keep working. Only with your help will she be able to purchase natural fertilizers so that she can grow high quality crops to meet the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

HERMELINDA, es madre de 3 hijos que cursan estudios superiores en ciudades alejadas de su hogar con el fin de llegar a convertirse en profesionales y ayudar a sus padres.Son estos los motores que promueve el esfuerzo de Hermelinda, quien con unas ganas inmensas de seguir trabajando día a día requiere de vuestro apoyo para adquirir abonos y fertilizantes naturales para obtener productos de excelente calidad de acuerdo a la demanda de sus clientes en el mercado.

loans.use: Purchase of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel is a loving and hard-working wife and mother. Every day she goes out with her beloved husband to care for their crops with the end goal of selling excellent products at the market. Her desire to improve their lives has led her to expand the crop fields. In order to do this she needs a loan to buy natural fertilizers so that her crops are of high quality.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

RAQUEL, es una madre y esposa cariñosa y trabajadora, a diario se desplaza con su amado esposo hacia sus terrenos D. cultivo con el propósito D. cuidarlas a fin D. obtener excelentes productos D. acuerdo a la exigencia D. sus clientes en el mercado.Sus deseos D. mejora la han llevado a ampliar sus campos D. labor diaria y debido a esto es su petición D. un préstamo ya que le urge adquirir abonos y fertilizantes naturales que garantizarán la calidad D. sus frutos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Afegata Tupuola's Group

texts.en:
This group from Siufaga was started in May 2008 with 17 members, growing to 21 members in one month. The members are among the best savers in the programme. They work seven days a week and they shared that they are earning more than they usually earn. This group are all starters and they are very happy that they are given money to run their own businesses. They are hard working women and they are striving to be the best they can so that they can get profits and improve their families' living standards.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing boats, fishing nets, hooks, knives, chemicals and other equipment.

loans.name: Wendy Faifuaina's Group

texts.en:
Siufaga is one of the most beautiful villages on the east side of Savaii. This new group from Siufaga is composed of hard-working ladies who use their loans to either improve or start their sewing businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine, material, threads and needles for their businesses

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuela began her business out of sheer economic necessity. After her husband abandoned her and their children, she ended up living with her children in cardboard boxes, which clearly offered neither privacy nor quality of life.

Since she was solely responsible for feeding and housing her children, she took advantage of an opportunity to sell tacos. The income from this business, which started three years ago, has so far fed and paid for the education of her children.

She requires a loan of $500, repayable over six months, to purchase two additional tables so that her customers feel more comfortable when purchasing their food.

With your help, Manuela may yet succeed!

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Manuela inició el negocio por necesidad económica y por que su esposo la abandono con sus hijos. Ella no tenia ningún ingreso para mantenerlos y fue así que se vio en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio, ya que necesitaba alimentación para sus hijos y construir su casa, ya que antes vivía en un cuarto de cartón y como eran muchos de familia no tenían ni su propia privacidad, ni tampoco una buena calidad de vida, vio entonces una área de oportunidad en la elaboración y venta de comida, ya que era algo que sabia hacer, así empezó hace 3 años con su negocio de venta de tacos. Gracias a este ingreso ha podido brindarles educación y alimentación a sus hijos.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar dos mesas para que sus clientes se sientan más cómodos cuando compren sus productos. Con tu ayuda Manuela podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of two tables

loans.name: Aimiti Gafa's Group

texts.en:
This group is from Satupaitea Pitonuu, one of the mostly populated villages in the island of Savaii. The members of the group will be producing traditional Samoan tapa (designed bark cloth). This is the group's first loan and because the members have not had access to this kind of financial support before. Each of them will be taking WST 750 ($305) to their families to start up their small businesses. This is a new start for them and they are willing to run on their own in order to get profit to help out their families.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and tools for making tapa

loans.name: Siala Maoama's Group

texts.en:
This new group in Vaitoomuli began in May 2008 and it is fast becoming one of the active groups in the programme. These women live close to the sea and so they prefer to do the fishing business. Their husbands, sons and other family members support them in running their businesses, and they are really honest and hard working. This is their first loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing boats, fishing nets, hooks, knives, chemicals and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es:
Maria Ernetina began started her business nine years ago selling dried meat and a variety of meat-filled products due to the scarcity of jobs at the time. Her husband, a bricklayer, had to leave for the US to work as his income was not sufficient to support his wife and three daughters.

Maria’s sales has increased and to meet the additional demand she requires a loan of $975, repayable over six months, to purchase more ingredients and a larger table to be able to serve her customers.

With your help, Maria will succeed in getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Ernestina emprendio el negocio hace 9 años debido a la escazes de trabajo que habia en ese momento, su esposo tuvo que dejar la ciudad para buscar trabajo en Estados Unidos ya que el sueldo de albañil que tenia no alcanzaba para mantener a sus 3 niñas y a su esposa, fue asi que Maria inicio la venta de carne seca entre sus vecinas para mas adelante meter la carne machaca entre la variedad de los productos.

Ahora solicita un credito por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para incrementar las ventas ya que en estos meses es cuando se tiene mas pedidos de carne y tiene que comprar mas mercancia asi como una mesa rectangular mas grande para poder atender bien a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Maria saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients and a table

loans.name: Apoua Tavita's Group

texts.en:
This is one of the largest groups from SaP.. This group was started in May 2008 when they heard about the microloan programme on the radio. The group members live together in one village and they have known each other well for a long time, which is one of the requirements for them to form a group. They work in different businesses but mostly on sewing and the Samoan specialty of elei printing of tapa cloth. They are not far away from a large market and they also have access to their own village market, where the villagers bring whatever they have for sale. The group members are honest women and they are happy to support themselves and their families.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of material, sewing machines, and related equipment.

loans.name: Toai Samuelu's Group

texts.en: This group from Salimu was just started in May of this year. The members heard about the programme from their neighboring villagers. The group started off with only 10 members but now they have recruited a few more and it still growing. These women have the same needs and same problems and so they are easily gathered together to find ways to support themselves. These are their first loans and they are happy to be part of the programme.

loans.use: Purchase of knives, filings, chemicals and equipments for their businesses..

loans.name: Jesus Alonso

texts.es:
Two years ago, Jesus Alonso began his own home business of selling car tyres to support his family and educate his son, when he was unable to find a job and his wife became too ill to work and required medical treatment.

He asks for a loan of $625, repayable over six months, to expand his business and to separate the storage area of the business so that they no longer have to live next to all the car tyres.

With your help he will achieve his aim.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Alonso Inicio el negocio por falta de trabajo ya que necesitaba de un ingreso propio para poder costear los estudios de su hijo y poder mantenerlos ya que no tenia trabajo y su esposa se encontraba enferma y no podia apoyarlo economicamente. Comenzó hace 2 cuando perdió su trabajo y tenia que pagar los gastos de su hijo para la escuela y de la casa no podía encontrar un trabajo además que su esposa necesitaba un tratamiento. fue asi que decidio poner su negocio de venta de llantas que hasta ahora es lo que lo ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

El solicita un prestamo por US $ 625 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio ya que no cabe con todos sus productos donde esta actualmente. Con tu ayuda podra logralo.

loans.use: Remodelling of business premises

loans.name: Epenesa Auega's Group

texts.en:
Gautavai Center was started in April 2008. These ladies heard from the group at their
neighbor and then they came to the office for requirements. They are one of the largest 
groups in the programme the number of 19 and they already received their first loans. 
They are starting well and some of them have businesses started and getting more. They 
have different businesses like (sewing, shop, vegetable garden, pancake, etc…. and they 
are making good of the opportunity.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, weed killer, weed spray, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maria's Group

texts.en:
This is the first SPBD group of women from Vaega Satupaitea village from Savaii Island. These are there first loan must use to start or improve there business. 
The second loan is for there home improve ment for the family condition , education 
…..before they receive there loan they have to be trained and understand of SPBD 
policies how to run a business and budge the cash especially income and expenses.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, weed killer, weed spray, bush knives, filings, fishing net, fishing gear, seeds (Chinese cabbages, round cabbage,  cucumber, snacks, ice cake……etc

loans.name: Sulesa Tapusoa's Group

texts.en:
This is the second group from the Vaitoomuli 1 Center on the big island of Savaii. This is the first loan for these women, who will be starting a taro plantation and sewing businesses. They will use the loan to purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, weed killer, weed spray, and bush knives for the plantation and material, a sewing machine, and other items for the sewing businesses.

This loan offers a good opportunity to provide the members' families with extra income and to move away from dependence on other villagers for survival. The group members know that, if they work hard on their businesses, they can look forward to another loan to extend the businesses, renovate their houses, and pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, weed killer, weed spray, and bush knives for the plantation and material, a sewing machine, and other items for the sewing businesses

loans.name: Talatalaga Fiu's Group

texts.en: The second round for Gautavai center for there first loan to 			start there business, after 3 weeks training provide by the 			SPBD. These four women receive the maximum loan of 			$750 tala each. These women are hard working and they 			thankful to have this opportunity in their lives. The second 			cycle of loans will not only for there business but they also 			will have the chance to improve their homes and pay their 			children’s school fees.

loans.use: Handicraft (fine mats, samoan bag, fan, ietoga), purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, week killer, weed spray, bush knives, freezer, sugar, chicken etc…

loans.name: Agus Sumardi

texts.id:
Agus Sumardi opens his kiosk business every morning. All sales items one by one are moved from his house for display. His wife helps him to display the items for sale. Items for sale are assortments of light food, rice, fried oil, assortments of soap, etc. Sales items were fought from market in his city, and there are also neighbor's items who consign their items like assortments of traditional snacks. Through Dinari foundation, Agus Sumardi obtain a loan to buy items to add capital to buy items for sales . Daily nett profit could reach Rp50,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00); This profit is used by Agus Sumardi to fulfill his family needs with wifea and one daughter

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Agus Sumardi membuka usaha warungnya setiap pagi.Semua barang dagangan satu per satu mulai keluarkan dari dalam rumahnya untuk dipajangnya. Istrinya membantu memajang barang dagangan. Barang yang dijual seperti aneka macam makanan ringan, beras, minyak goreng, aneka macam sabun mandi, sabun cuci dan lainnya. Barang dagangan didapat dari pasar di kotanya dan ada beberapa barang dangangan yang diperoleh dari tetangga-tetangga yang ikut menitip dagangannya seperti aneka jajan tradisional. Melalui Yayasan DINARI, Agus Sumardi mendapatkan dana pinjaman yang dapat dipergunakan untuk menambah modal usaha untuk membeli dagangan. Keuntungan bersih dalam sehari mencapai Rp.50.000.- Keuntungan inilah yang digunakan Agus Sumardi untuk menghidupi istri dan seorang putrinya.

loans.use: To add business capital to buy items for sales (Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli barang dagangan)

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun N. is a 40 years old and a widow. She has four children, three of whom work as construction workers while the fourth attends primary school. They live in the Province of Pursat.

Mrs. Noun earns $2.50 per day growing and selling vegetables. She requests a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds for her small farming business. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy and raise piglets to sell for additional income. This loan will enable her to expand her business and better provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds for her small farming business, and purchase piglets for rearing with the remainder of the loan.

loans.name: Putu Widiya

texts.id:
Putu Widiya has to wake up around 03:00 AM every morning, and goes to the morning market in his city to buy items for his business. He has been in this vegetable business for a long time. After all items are bought, Putu Widiya travels with his motor cycle to offer his items. Items on offer are assortments of green vegetables to be cooked, meat, fish, assortments of cakes, assortments of cooked vegetable prepared meals wrapped in plastic. Usually he starts to sales travel around 5:00 - 9.00 AM to see his customers. His customers are ladies in remote village areas far away from the market. Every morning Putu Widiya from the market completing his sales items, then right away travels to offer his items by motor cycle. From his brother's information, finally Putu Widiya applies to obtain a loan from Dinari Foundation. With this loan, Putu Widiya to buy items for his travelling vegetables sales. In one day Putu Widiya bought Rp100,000-Rp200,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00); with a nett profit of Rp30,000-40,000/day. With this profit Putu Widiya could fulfill his family needs with one child.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Putu Widiya setiap pagi harus bangun pagi sekitar pukul 03.00 wita dan harus bergegas ke pasar pagi di kotanya untuk berbelanja keperluan dagangannya.Usaha dagang sayur memang sudah ditekuni sejak lama. Setelah keperluan lengkap, Putu Widiya berkeliling dengan sepeda motornya untuk menjajakan barang dagangannya. Barang barang yang di jual yaitu aneka macam sayuran hijau untuk keperluan masak, daging, ikan, aneka macam kue, aneka macam sayur siap saji yang sudah terbungkus dengan plastik. Biasanya mulai berkeliling mulai pukul 05.00 s/d 09.00 wita menemui pelanggannya. Pelanggannya adalah ibu-ibu yang ada di daerah pedesaan yang jauh dari pasar. Setiap pagi Putu Widiya setelah dari pasar melengkapi dagangan kemudian langsung berkeliling menjajakan barang dagangan dengan sepeda motornya. Melalui informasi oleh saudaranya akhirnya Putu Widiya mengajukan permohonan untuk mendapatkan pinjaman dana dari Yayasan DINARI. Dengan dana itulah Putu Widiya mempergunakan untuk memenuhi keperluan usaha dagang sayur keliling. Dalam sehari Putu Widiya membelanjakan dana Rp.100.000 s/d Rp.200.000.-. Dengan keuntungan bersih mencapai Rp. 30.000 s/d 40.000.- per hari. Dengan keuntungan inilah Putu Widiya dapat mencukupi keperluan keluargnya bersama seorang anaknya.

loans.use: To add business capital to buy sales items (Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli barang dagangan)

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang L. is 43 years old and a mother of five. She lives with her husband Hem Chheang Heng, 48, and children in the province of Pursat. One of her children attends college, the second works in a private printing shop, the third is in high school, and the other two attend primary school.

Mrs. Eang earns $1.66 per day as a wedding decorator and her husband, Mr. Hem, earns $2 per day as a soldier. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase decorative materials for her wedding decorating business. The loan will allow her to improve her business by creating more beautiful and elaborate decorations for her clients.

loans.use: To purchase decorative materials for her wedding decorating business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao S. is 36 years old and earns $5 per day selling groceries from her house. Her husband, Mr. Hem Pov, is also 36 and works for a non-governmental organization (NGO), earning $3 per day. The couple has four young children, all of whom attend school. The family lives in Sthaney Village, Pursat Province.

They seek a loan of $1,100 to purchase fertilizer in bulk to resell for profit. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy additional inventory of groceries to sell. The loan will allow them to enhance their businesses and therefore add to their household income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer in bulk to resell for profit.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. Run S. O. sells groceries from her house, earning approximately $3.20 per day. Her husband, Mr. Eam Chhom, is a 55-year-old soldier who farms in his free time. They have a large family of eight children, all of whom are young and attend school.

They seek a loan of $600 to buy more inventory of groceries to sell. They will use the remainder of the loan to buy vegetable seeds for her husband's farming business. The loan will allow the family to expand their businesses and thereby increase their family income. With increased income, the couple will be able to improve living conditions for their children.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of groceries to sell, as well as to buy vegetable seeds for her husband's farming business.

loans.name: Lutfi

texts.ru:
Lutfi M. is a woman of 47 years of age, married and has two children. Her husband works as a metal craftsman in an auto shop. Lutfi used to work as a technician in a hospital, but traded her job to selling fruits about five years ago. All week long she works from very early morning until evening. Since 4 am she is up and already buying fruits from wholesellers and resells them on the market at a higher price. She wants a loan in the amount of 600 somoni (US$175) to increase the variety of fruits which she sells.

Translated from Russain by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзоева Лутфи, женщина в возросте 47 лет замужем имеет 2 детей, муж работает слесарем в автоцехе.Лутфи работала раньше в больнице техничкой, но уже 5 лет как она перешла на торговлю фруктами .Она всю неделю выходит на базар с ранего утра до вечера.С 4 часов утра она закупает у оптовиков фрукты и с наценкой реализует на рынке.Для увеличения ассортимента фруктов она хочет получить кредит в размере 600 сомони.

loans.use: Increase variety of fruits

loans.name: Bokiniso

texts.en:
Bokiniso H. is 45 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband is tractor operator at alocal farm. For more than 11 years, Bokiniso has been selling vegetables, such as cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers, and garlic. Her eldest son helps Bokiniso with the business. Her business begins in the early morning at 5:00 a.m. She buys vegetables and fruits wholesale from the local farmers and sells them in the market. Moreover, she is trading in the market that is known among people because of its attractive prices. This allows Bokiniso’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family.

Today, she is planning to purchase the new, fresh vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of goods that she sells. For this purpose, she requests 2900 Somoni ($850 USD) for 10 months. Having a positive credit history with IMON, Bokiniso promises to repay the current loan promptly, just as she did for her previous loan. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of her business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Kimie

texts.en:
Kimie I. is 40 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her husband works in the Tajik Aluminum Factory. Kimie is a market vendor. She sells clothing, such as sport shirts and shorts. Her eldest son helps her with the business. Kimie has been in this business for 8 years. During this time, Kimie managed to make her business stable and profitable, generating a stable income for her family. She tries to satisfy the needs of clients with varying tastes and income levels. She works very hard to give her dearest children good educations and to make them happy. 

To cover the higher education expenses of her eldest son, who is going to enter the university, Kimie is planning to increase her working capital in order to purchase new summer clothing to sell. For this purpose, Kimie requests 1600 Somoni ($475 USD) for 4 months. She promises to repay the loan accurately. Kimie is counting on your help. Be an important contributor to the growth of Kimie’s business.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell to teenagers

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru:
Adolat is a woman of 52 years of age, married and has six children. Her family makes national Tajik patties at home. All her children are independent and family oriented. Adolat lives with her husband separate from all her sons. Together with her husband they sell food products. Adolat wants to get a loan to increase the variety of the type of bread she makes and has turned to MicroInvest for help.

Translated from Russain by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Адолат женщина в возросте 52 года замужем имеет 6 детей,на дому их семья печёт национальные лепёшки.Все дети у нее самостоятельные, семейные, Адолат живёт с мужем отдельно от своих сыновей.Муж и она занимаются тоговлей продуктами питания,сама Адолат хочет получив займ увеличить свой ассортимент хлебных изделий.Для чего она обратилась в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Sales of national bread

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.en:
Kholniso S. is 47 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Kholniso is a market vendor. For more than 6 years, she has been selling fabrics for sewing national dresses and towels in the central local market. Kholniso delivers her goods with the help of her eldest son. They travel to the neighboring city of Istaravshan to buy goods.

Kholniso tries to purchase goods of good quality so that she can sell them at prices that are acceptable to clients with average levels of incomes. Being a very nice and friendly woman by nature, Kholniso is trying to serve he clients so that they have a positive experience and want to come back. The business is stable, allowing her to contribute considerably to the family budget. Because it is now summer, the fabrics that Kholniso sells are in great demand because, in summer, most of the girls and women in Tajikistan prefer national dresses. So, Kholniso is planning to buy new, modern fabrics and towels in order to increase the range of goods that she sells.

For this purpose, she requests 3400 Somoni ($1000 USD) for 8 months. Having a positive credit history, Kholniso promises to repay the current loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fabric and towels

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.en:
Ismatullo R. is 51 years old. He’s married, and he and his wife have raised 5 children together. Ismatullo is a farmer. Mainly, he grows crops, such as wheat and rice. Having worked the land for ten years, Ismatullo has gained rich experience. Each year, he yield enough for his family and for sales. His business is his main source of income and generating a stable income requires considerable funding.

Thus, now Ismatullo needs to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds for the harvest and for improving production, thereby increasing the quality of his yield and his earnings at the time of sale. For this purpose he’s asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD). The loan will be repaid in 9 months. After gathering his yield, as usual, he wants to sell them to the local inhabitants for lower prices than in the market. Ismatullo thanks all who are supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.en:
Orzugul R. is 47 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her husband works at the Tajik Aluminium Factory. Orzugul is running her own business. She is a farmer. She grows crops, such as wheat, rice, onion, and tomato.

Having worked the land for seven years, Orzugul has gained rich experience. Each day, she works diligently to make sure that she takes good care of her crop. Each year, she grows a yield sufficient for her family's consumption and for selling. She is doing her best in order to give her children a good education and a happy life. With her job, she has been able to pay for the schooling of her 4 young children. This motivates her even more to keep working the land.

Now Orzugul needs to purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds for seasonal planting. She’s asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni ($875 USD) for 9 months. This amount would help her accomplish her goals in a short time. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Toji

texts.ru:
Tochi Y. is a man of 48 years of age, married and has four children. His wife is a housewife and two of his children have already married and two other daughters are ready to be wed. Tochi has own vending space where he does business for several years. He can be considered a businessman with experience. He wants to get a loan to expand his business to buy candy and caramel because at this hot time of year chocolate is not a good commodity, as Tochi has explained to us. This is why he turned to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russain by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Точи Юнусов мужчина в возросте 48 лет женат имеет 4 детей,жена домохозяйка, двоих детей он уже женил , а еще две дочки готовы на выданье замуж. сам Точи уже много лет как имеет свою точку бизнеса, т.е. лорёк.Его можно считать бизнесменом со стажем.Он кредит хочет получить для расширения своего бизнеса.Для приобретения конфет карамели, т.к. сейчас жара шоколад не ходовой товар, так объяснил нам Точи.Для этого он обратился в микроинвест.

loans.use: Sales of food products

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
Robiya H. is 51 years old and is married. She and her husband have raised seven children. For more than 12 years, Robiya has been selling vegetables, such as cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers, and garlic. Her son helps Robiya with the business. Robiya begins her work day early in the morning, at 5:00 a.m., buying vegetables wholesale from the local farmers, and then selling them in the market. In the market, she is known among people because of her attractive prices and friendly personality. This allows Robiya’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family.

Now it is the season and her goods are in great demand. For this reason, she is planning to purchase new fresh fruits and vegetables to sell. For this purpose, she requests 2600 Somoni ($775 USD) for 10 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Robiya’s business.

loans.use: Increasing the range of vegetables that she sells

loans.name: Nisarull Haq

texts.en:
Nisarull H., the son of A. H., lives in Jalalabad, a city in the Ningarhar province. He graduated from class twelve, but because of financial problems he was not able to continue his education. Instead, Nisarull became a tailor. Currently, he has a small tailoring and clothing sales shop in Jalalabad city.

Nisarull H. hopes to develop his business and increase his income. However, he needs more funds to purchase clothes and find costumers. Therefore, he decided to request a loan of 500,000 Afghanis from AFSG. He has promised to repay the loan in 18 months.

loans.use: To buy clothes for his shop

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Mr. Ou C., 39, is a soldier, but supplements his income as a wood sculptor. His combined income from these activities is approximately $6.66 per day. His wife, Prom Nareth, 41, sells vegetables in the market and makes $3.33 per day. The couple has five children. One of their children is married, another is a sculptor like Mr. C., and the three youngest children attend school. They live in Camkarchek Choeung Village, Pursat Province.

Mr C. seeks a loan of $1,200 to purchase raw materials for his wood sculpting business. The couple plans to use the remainder of the loan to buy vegetables in bulk for Mrs. C. to sell at the market. The loan will allow the family to expand their businesses and thereby increase their household income.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his wood sculpting business. They plan to use the remainder of the loan to buy vegetables in bulk for his wife to sell at the market.

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.en:
Shamigul G. is 54 years old. She and her husband have raised seven children, only three of whom are still under their care. For 15 years, Shamigul has been working in the local market in the city selling green gram, buckwheat, and peas. These legumes are very popular in Tajikistan where they can be cooked into soups and cereals, both of which are very nourishing, healthy and tasty. Her business is very stable and generates the main source of income for the family, because Shamigul's husband is currently unemployed.

Today, she is requesting 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) for 6 months. The loan shall be spent to increase her stock of green gram, buckwheat and peas for selling. Shamigul thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy green gram, buckwheat, and peas to increase her stock of the goods

loans.name: Sadraddin

texts.en: Sadraddin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has 3 children. This man has 7 years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan of  $1000  to buy more home appliances for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy the home appliances

loans.name: Savri

texts.ru:
Savri is an old client of ours who pays off her loans on time. She knows now that she was able to use the loan successfully to expand her business and wants to continue her credit history. She wants to use this loan to buy summer t-shirts, shorts and bermudas (long shorts). She needs a loan of 2,500 somoni (US$750).

Translated from Russain by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Саври наша давнишняя клиентка , которая вовремя погашает свой предыдущий кредит.Она поняв что смогла использовать займ в цели расширения своего бизнеса , хочет продолжить свою кредиторскую историю.следующий займ хочет взять для завоза летних футволок и шорт, бермуд.Она дала заявку на 2500 сомони.

loans.use: Sales of men's clothing

loans.name: Bibirukiya

texts.en:
Bibirukiya H. is 30 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband is entrepreneur. To help her husband support the family, Bibirukiya has been running her own business for five years. Bibirukiya’s children are small now, but already, she is working hard to ensure the best future for them.

She works in a tailoring shop. For the past five years, she has gained a rich experience in tailoring. Bibirukiya specializes in sewing national dresses. She has always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else. Bibirukiya believes that someday her dream will come true and she will open her own tailoring shop.

Today she is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD), which she will repay over 12 months, to buy new, modern fabrics for sewing national dresses. With your help, this will be possible. Bibirukiya is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Bibirukiya’s business.

loans.use: To buy fabric for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat A. is a client who finished paying of her first loan without any problems. After this her inventory of thermoses increased noticeably. She will use her next loan to purchase clay dishes and china. She is grateful to KIVA for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абидова Мухаббат ,это клиентка которая без проблем закончила свой первый займ.После которого у нее заметно увеличился товарооборот, ассортимент термосов.Следующий займ она хочет получить для приобретения глиняной и фарфоровой посуды.Она благодарна KIVA за оказанную финансовую поддержку.

loans.use: Purchase dishes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for two businesses: a small cafeteria and a clothing store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for a small tailoring business

loans.name: Abla Tina

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Abla Tina A. was born on December 31, 1969 in Zanguéra in the Golfe prefecture. She is single with five people in her care. She learned to sew in 1987 and set up an atelier called “Atelier Dieu Donné” in the residential district of Agoè. She has six dressmaking apprentices who are learning to sew in her atelier. Mademoiselle A. used her first loan to buy a sewing machine.

Taking into account the number of apprentices she has, Mademoiselle A. is requesting this loan to buy another new sewing machine and 22 lengths of cotton fabric (pagne) of medium quality.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Mademoiselle A. Abla Tina est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Zanguéra dans la préfecture de Golfe. Elle est célibataire avec 5 personnes à charge. Depuis 1987, elle a appris la couture et a crée son atelier dénommé « Atelier Dieu Donné » dans son quartier de résidence Agoè. Elle a 6 apprenties couturières qui apprennent la couture chez elle. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis d’acquérir une machine à coudre.

Compte tenu de l’effectif de ses apprenties, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acquérir encore une nouvelle machine à coudre et 22 pièces de pagnes de qualité intermédiaires.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and 22 lengths of cotton fabric (pagne)

loans.name: Elmikhan

texts.en: This young man is married and has a child. Elmikhan is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. Four years ago he started a sheep-breeding business. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 15 lambs for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy 15 lambs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Kodjo A. A. was born on December 31, 1981 in Lomé. He is a married father with two children. He has been selling timber since 2004. In fact his business entails buying timber from the interior of the country and delivering it to sawmills in Lomé. According to Monsieur A. A. it’s a fairly lucrative business providing one has potential customers.

This is Monsieur A. A.’s first loan and he is asking for 300,000 FCFA ($725) to purchase 12 teak planks and 11 white wood planks to better serve his customers and make a profit in return.

Translated from French by Alisn Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. A. Kodjo est né le 31 décembre 1981 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Depuis 2004, il exerce le commerce de planches. En fait son activité consiste à acheter des planches de l’intérieur du pays et de faire leur livraison dans les usines de scierie de Lomé. Selon Monsieur A. A. Kodjo c’est une activité qui rapporte assez de revenu pourvu qu’on dispose des clients potentiels.

Monsieur A. A. Kodjo est à son premier cycle de crédit et sollicite 300000 FCFA pour acheter 12 planches de tecks et 11 planches de bois blancs pour pouvoir bien servir ses clients et tirer en retour un bénéfice.

loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar D. is a woman who sells women’s clothing. She was successful in using her first loan and would now like to increase her loan in order to increase her product assortment. She will use the loan when she travels to purchase summer women’s blouses and skirts.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Дильбар Джураева, женщина которая торгует на рынке ,а также имеет отдел по продаже женской одежды.Первый займ она использовала удачно, теперь хочет увеличить займ для увеличения ассортимента, хочет поехав за товарм закупить летний ассортимент женских блузок и юбок.

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Madame Abra L. was born in 1969 in Sotouboua. She is married to Monsieur Yao Kpelenga who is a soldier. They have two children who attend school. Madame L.’s main business is dressmaking and selling the clothes she makes at the local markets in and around Lomé. She started this business in 1999 and she has mastered the tricks of her trade.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to get a sewing machine and 15 lengths of cotton fabric (pagne) of the Hitarget brand. The income from her business will allow her to help her husband out with the family expenses and to save up for other projects that she has in mind.

Translated from French by Alisn Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame L. Abra est née en 1969 à Sotouboua. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur KPELENGA Yao qui est un militaire. Ils ont deux enfants qui vont à l’école. Elle a pour activité principale la couture et la vente des habits cousus dans les marchés locales de Lomé et ses environs. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1999 et maîtrise les débouchés de son métier.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une machine à coudre et 15 pièces de pagne de marque Hitarget. Le revenu qu’elle tire de son activité lui permet d’aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et de pouvoir faire de l’économie afin de pouvoir réaliser d’autres projets qu’elle a en vu.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and 15 lengths of cotton fabric (pagne)

loans.name: Matlab

texts.en: Matlab has been running a beekeeping operation for 5 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.This man is married, has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy the necessary things for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells clothing. She is married but her husband's income from his job as a pastor is not sufficient for Grace and her five children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling clothing.

loans.name: Essi Délali

texts.fr:
Born on May 31, 1967 in Nouadja, Madame Essi Délali A. is a widow looking after four children. Since she lost her husband, she has held sole responsibility for raising her children. In 1994 she opened a shop selling essential products and dry goods in the Agoé district. Her first loan allowed her to build up her stock and sell more. The effect of this first loan was that Madame A. made a large profit that allowed her to pay the school fees for her four children.

The loan that she is currently requesting will allow her to purchase five cartons of soap, six cartons of milk, twelve cans of oil and nine cartons of pasta. With this new expanded inventory she will thus be able to increase sales and earn more income.

The photo of Madame A. on the Kiva website has been digitally altered because she does not want to have her face displayed.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 31 mai 1967 à Nouadja, Madame A. Essi Délali est une veuve avec quatre enfants à charge. Depuis qu’elle a perdu son mari, la charge de ses enfants repose sur elle seule. Mais en 1994, elle ouvert un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités et des produits de mercerie dans le quartier d’Agoè. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis de faire l’approvisionnement et de mieux vendre. L’impact que ce premier crédit a sur elle est qu’elle a dégagé un bénéfice énorme qui lui a permis de payer les frais de scolarités de ses quatre enfants.

Actuellement le crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 cartons de savons, 6 cartons de lait, 12 bidons d’huile et 9 cartons de pâtes alimentaires. Ainsi avec le nouveau stock qu’elle aura à constituer elle améliorera son chiffre d’affaires et gagnera beaucoup de revenus.

La photo de Madame A. Essi Délali est floue sur le site de KIVA car elle ne désire pas être affichée.

loans.use: To buy basic essential products

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en: Hagar P. sells cooked rice. She is married but her husband's income from his job as a publisher is not sufficient for Hagar and her three children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cooked rice.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice D. sells clothing that she sews. She is married but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Eunice and her five children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business sewing and selling clothes.

loans.name: Ablavi Cécile

texts.fr:
From a modest family, Madame Ablavi Cécile A. is a native of Datcha, a village in the prefecture of Ogou, 147 km from Lomé (the capital of Togo). She is married to Monsieur Adolphe Etse who is a teacher. At a very young age, Madame A. became involved in selling cereals in her village. Later, she moved to Agoè, a working-class neighborhood in Lomé. Although she is in Lomé, she still buys her corn, millet and beans in her native village.

This is her first loan and she is requesting it in order to buy eight sacks of corn to sell in the new market in which she has acquired a place.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Issue d’une modeste famille, madame A. Ablavi Cécile est originaire de Datcha, un village situé dans la préfecture de l’Ogou à 147 KM de Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur ETSE Adolphe qui est un enseignant. Très tôt elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de céréales dans son village. Ensuite, elle s’est installée à Agoè une des quartiers populaires de Lomé. Bien qu’elle soit à Lomé, elle achète toujours le maïs, le mil, le haricot dans son village natal.

Elle est à son premier crédit et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 8 sacs de maïs pour pouvoir vendre dans le nouveau marché dans lequel elle a trouvé un emplacement.

loans.use: To buy eight sacks of corn

loans.name: Kloeung

texts.en:
Kloeung H. is a widow and sells roasted sausages, earning approximately $3.25 per day. Her son, Mr. Choun Voeurn, 33, is a construction worker, earning $5 per day. Mrs. H. lives in Preykei Khar Village, Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.

Mrs. H. is requesting a loan of $700 to use as working capital for her sausage-selling business. She plans to use the remainder of the loan to purchase a motorcycle for the family to use as transportation. The loan will allow her to expand her business and improve her family’s income.

loans.use: To use the loan as working capital for her sausage-selling business. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle for the family to use as transportation.

loans.name: Nabat

texts.en: Nabat was born in1971. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region. She is a mother of 3 children. She has been running this business for 5 years. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy goods for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Nutepe Group

texts.fr:
The NUTEPE group was created in 2006 in Lomé’s Agoè neighborhood. It specializes in small businesses. It has three dynamic members who are working to improve their living conditions through money-making initiatives and the creation of income-generating businesses. This group has had one previous loan through WAGES and diligently repaid it. This second loan the group is requesting will enable it to buy 12 pieces of mid-quality pagne (colorful African cloth) and 9 bags of charcoal. The group’s treasurer does not wish to be part of this loan cycle but will remain in the group to undertake any tasks required of her as treasurer.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Le groupement NUTEPE est crée en 2006 dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Il est spécialisé dans le petit commerce. Il est composé de trois membres dynamiques qui œuvrent pour l’amélioration de leurs conditions de vie à travers des initiatives porteuses de revenus et de création d’activités génératrices de revenus. Ce groupement a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et s’est bien comporté dans le remboursement du crédit. Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite leur permettra d’acheter 12 pièces de pagne de qualité intermédiaire et 9 sacs de charbons de bois. Pour ce cycle de crédit la trésorière ne souhaite plus en prendre mais demeure toujours dans le groupement pour exercer les tâches qui lui incombent en tant de que trésorière.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (African cloth) and charcoal

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en: Mrs. Nhim S. is a subsistence farmer in Popeal Khaer Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Moeurn, is a fisherman in the local village. They have four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while one other assists Mr. Sokha Moeurn on the lake. The remaining one is a construction worker. Mr. Sokha Moeurn’s business now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to purchase more fish nets to catch the fish. Thus, Mrs. Nhim S. needed to apply for a loan to buy fish nets and the rest of the money she would use to buy a new boat for her husband's business. Ten years ago, Mrs. Nhim S. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy pigs for breeding. Three years ago, Mrs. Nhim S. got a liver disease and she spent $500 to get cured. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and the rest of the money she would use to buy a new boat for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama N. is 52 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She specializes in producing and retailing “tchoukoutou,” a local (millet-based) drink that is widely enjoyed. She lives in Adeta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this third loan from FECECAV, Ama would like to expand the capacity of her business by buying bags of millet, wood, and by building a new oven. Profits from her business will allow her to take more responsibility for household costs.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Ama N. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est spécialisée dans la préparation et la revente de « tchoukoutou » une boisson locale tant appréciée par la population. Elle réside à Adeta un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Ama désire avec ce crédit, le troisième de FECECAV, augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des sacs de mil, du bois et se faire construire un nouveau fourneau. Les profits issus de son de son commerce lui permettront de participer aux charges du foyer.

loans.use: Purchasing bags of millet

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Mrs. Phalla T. lives in Popeal Khaer Village in Kandal Province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Mrs. Phalla T. is a widow with four children, two of whom are working in factory while the others are enrolling in school. Although the members in the family have different business activities, they are also in a poor condition. Additionally, they live in an old house. In order to make Mrs. Phalla T.’s family member's lives more improved, Mrs. Phalla T. decided to ask for a loan to fix her old house. Previously, Mrs. Phalla T. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to cure a family member of a disease.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to fix her old house.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en: Nargiz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region. She is a mother of 3 children. This woman has been in the dairy business for 6 years. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow for improving her dairy business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeurn K. is a vegetable seller in Rotaing Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Von Lon, is a vegetable farmer who cultivates for his wife to sell. Unfortunately, the vegetable revenue is not on time for Mrs. Khoeurn K. to sell; thus, Mrs. Khoeurn K. decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetables to re-sell. Mrs. Khoeurn K. is 36 and the mother of five children, two of whom assist their father in the field while the three others are attending school. Presently, Mrs. Khoeurn K.’s youngest child got a lung disease and Mrs. Khoeurn K. spends an unforeseen expense on this. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to re-sell.

loans.name: Kutfi

texts.ru:
Kutfi G. finished her first loan and with happiness would like to continue being a MicroInvest client. She is grateful to KIVA investors for their support and financing. Kutfi travels by herself to Bishkek to purchase products. In the future she would like to expand her business and to open another sales location where her son will work as a salesman.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Кутфи Гадойбоева закончила свой первый займ и с радостью хочет продолжить кредитоваться в Микроинвесте.Она благодарна инвесторам за поддержку и финансирование.Кутфи сама ездит в Бишкек за товаром, в дальнейшем она хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть ещё одну точку продажи , а продавцом взять к себе своего сына.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Gam B 2023-1 Group

texts.en:
This small group is led by Khemisa L., who is in the business of selling groundnuts at the market. Khemisa, 30 years old and divorced, has two children, aged 4 and 15. Each week she makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the loan, she hopes to be able to buy more groundnuts to sell.

Khemisa is joined in her small group by Esther M., Luica A., Sadia S., and Rose A.. Esther M. sells beer at the bar and wants to build a lodge at the river shore. Luica A. currently sells charcoal and wants a loan to open up a bar at her market premises. Sadia S. sells cold goods such as soda and ice cream at the market and wants to expand her shop. Rose A. sells radios and televisions at the market and is requesting a loan to build a place for watching football competitions such as the World Cup and many more.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Tejireddin

texts.en: Tejireddin S. is 58-year-old married father of seven children living in Bilasuvar, a region in southern Azerbaijan. For the past 25 years, he has supported his family by selling milk to a local factory. But it's still difficult to make ends meet for such a large family, which is why he's applied for a loan of $800 U.S. dollars. He hopes to buy an additional dairy cow, so he can expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a cow for a small dairy business

loans.name: Yawotse

texts.fr:
Yawotse D. is 29 years old, married and father of two children. He buys and resells gas in Adeta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this second loan from FECECAV, Yawotse would like to buy more gas to resell given that demand is constantly growing. The profits from his business will allow him to manage the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Yawotse D. est âgé de 29 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il achète et revend de l’essence à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, Yawotse souhaite acheter plus d’essence pour la revente étant donné que la demande ne cesse de croître. Les bénéfices de son commerce lui permettront de supporter les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase fuel for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Fuzuli

texts.en: Fuzuli was born in 1960.  He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. This man is married, has 2 children. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy goods for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Appolina

texts.fr:
Appolina O. is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four. She is a retail seller of millet, corn, and beans in Adéta, a small village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Appolina would like to increase the capacity of her commerce by buying 20 sacks of corn, 10 sacks of millet, and 15 sacks of beans. The gains from her business will enable her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Appolina O. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse du mil, maïs et haricot à Adeta, un petit village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Appolina désire augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant 20 sacs de maïs, 10 sacs de mils et 15 sacs de haricots. Les gains de son activité lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of corn, 10 sacks of millet, and 15 sacks of beans

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn C., 53, and her husband, who is 58, live along National road number six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1973 and have nine children: five sons and four daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home. Two of the other five children are garment factory workers and three attend the local school.

Mrs. Thorn C. and her husband have been farming since 1979. They grow rice and vegetables on the farm to sell around their village. Beside the farming business, they also buy fruit for resale. Currently, they purchase mangos from farmers on contract. They need to pay money to the villagers before the harvest season and when harvest season arrives they take the produce to sell at the market. Mrs. Thorn is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase mangos on contract and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase mangos from farmers on contract and fertilizer.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi B. is 38 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who are all in school.
