She is a retail seller of vegetables at the marketplace in Adéta, a small village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this third loan, Essi wishes to buy tomatoes, chili peppers, and other ingredients for retail sale. This will enable her to earn more and thus improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Essi B. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous à l’école. Elle revend des légumes au marché de Adeta nu petit village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce troisième crédit, Essi souhaite acheter de la tomate, du piment, et autres ingrédients pour la revente. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus et par là améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, chilis, and other ingredients for retail sale

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mr. Kosal V., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Sarim Chok, 35, live along National road number six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Their first son just finished learning how to be a blacksmith and wants to operate his own business. Two of the other three children attend the local school and the youngest one is still at home.

Mrs. Kosal has been a mason since 1986, a skill he learned from his uncle. For two years, Mrs. Sarim has been in the business of renting snooker tables to the villagers so that they can play snooker at her home. She earns about US$4 to $5 per day from her business. The couple lack the required funds to operate a blacksmith business for their son who has just become a blacksmith. Mr. Kosal is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a welding machine for the blacksmith business.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine to operate a blacksmith business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy special milk making equipment

loans.name: Mussabe

texts.ru:
Mussabe T. is a 40 year old woman with 3 children. Her husband works in Russia. Mussabe has been selling for 15 years. At first she sold at the market and her inventory was small. She slowly increased her inventory and rented a part of a store. Now she decided to take out a loan and to further increase her inventory. She plans to travel in order to purchase an assortment of children’s clothing for sale.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тохирова Мусабе женщина в возросте 40 лет замужем имеет3 детей, муж работает в России, сама уже 15 лет как торгует.Сначало она сидела на базаре , оборот её был не большой , постепенно она увеличила и взяла в аренду отдел магазина.Теперь она решила взяв кредит увеличить свой оборот.Поехав за товаром привезти летний ассортимент детской одежды.

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Sowra D 2012-3 Group

texts.en:
Rose A. is the leader of this small group. Forty years old and a widow, Rose is in the business of selling soya beans, earning a weekly profit of approximately 300 Sudanese pounds. She is requesting a loan to help pay the school fees of her three children, who range in age from 2 to 16.

Rose is joined in her small group by Janefa T., Siyama S., Lilian K., and Margret K.. Janefa T. has a business selling charcaol and wants to expand. Siyama S. operates a business selling green vegetable and wants a loan to initiate the distillation of alcohol. Lilian K. sells bread and wants to expand her shop. Margret K. is currently selling fruits including tomatoes and mangoes, and is requesting a loan to buy a generator for hire.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Beni

texts.fr:
Beni T. is 24 years old and single without children. He makes bracelets and rings in Adéta, a small village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Beni would like to use this loan to buy the raw materials necessary for his business to meet customer needs. Mr. Beni is a good client because he is on his second loan, and the first one was fully repaid.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Beni T. est âgé de 24 ans célibataire sans enfants. Il fabrique des anneaux et bagues à Adeta, un petit village à 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Beni désire, avec ce crédit, acheter les matières premières nécessaires à son activité afin de répondre aux besoins de la clientèle. Monsieur Beni est un bon client car il est à son deuxième crédit et le premier a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: To buy raw materials necessary for his business

loans.name: Abdufattoh

texts.en:
Abdufattoh O. was born in 1977 in the D.Kholmatov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has a child. Though Mr. O. has only been a MicroInvest client since 2008, he has been in the livestock business for 20 years, and he has solid practical skills. Mr. O. dreams of having a big livestock farm so he is ready to work hard. He is also a good carpenter with mastery of home repair.

Mr. O. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $1050 US for 6 months to purchase a pedigreed bull and some rams.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigreed bull and some rams

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman P. is a 31-year-old trader living in Bilasuvar, a region in southern Azerbaijan. He livesin the Internally Displaced People Settlement, a makeshift city of sorts. More than 600,000 Azerbaijanis live in these types of settlements; most have fled from called Nagorny Karabakh, a region caught in the Azerbaijan-Armenian territorial conflict.

For the past decade, he has run a small food store. Although Elman receives $70 a month in aid from the government, the store is his main source of income. He hopes to expand his business, which is why he has applied for a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars to purchase more food and supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food for a small store

loans.name: Allakhverdi

texts.en:
Allakhverdi Q. is a 55-year-old married father of five living in Bilasuvar, a region in southern Azerbaijan. He and his family live in the Internally Displaced People Settlement, a makeshift city of sorts. More than 600,000 Azerbaijanis live in these types of settlements; most have fled from called Nagorny Karabakh, a region caught in the Azerbaijan-Armenian territorial conflict.

For the past two decades, Allakhverdi has run a small grocery stand. To expand his business, he has applied for a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to purchase a refrigerator. Since the temperatures in this region of the country soar in the summer, Allakhverdi believes a fridge would be an excellent investment for his store.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for a small grocery stand

loans.name: Anoroy

texts.en:
Anoroy M. was born in 1969 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. She has been engaged in the family livestock business for 10 years. She also works on a collective farm, but that is seasonal work. Mrs. M. takes care of the animals, does the milking and makes yarn. She sells sour-milk products at the local bazaar. In addition, she knits warm socks to sell.

Mrs. M. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 US for 6 months so she can buy a computerized yarn-making machine. Mrs. M. thanks KIVA for its useful work and wishes everyone the best.

loans.use: To buy a computerized yarn-making machine

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Mrs. Hor M. is a 25 year old mother of one. She earns approximately $4 per day as a rice farmer. Her husband, Mr. Son Samrok, 24, is also a farmer.

She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a small tractor plow. The loan will enable the family to increase their household income by avoiding the expense of renting a tractor.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor plow

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal Q. is a 50-year-old married father living in Bilasuvar, a southern region in Azerbaijan. They live in the Internally Displaced People Settlement, a makeshift city of sorts. More than 600,000 Azerbaijanis live in these types of settlements; most have fled from called Nagorny Karabakh, a region caught in the Azerbaijan-Armenian territorial conflict.

To support his family, he sells milk to a local factory. Since it's his family's only source of income, Kamal hopes to buy two additional dairy cows to gain more profit. That's why he's applied for a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars. Kamal has successfully run his business for 15 years, so he's sure that he will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cows for a small dairy business

loans.name: Naiba

texts.en:
Naiba H. is a 42-year-old married mother of three in Bilasuvar, a southern region in Azerbaijan. She and her family reside in the Internally Displaced People Settlement, a makeshift city of sorts. More than 600,000 Azerbaijanis live in these types of settlements; most have fled from called Nagorny Karabakh, a region caught in the Azerbaijan-Armenian territorial conflict.

To support her family, she runs a food store. Since her husband is unemployed, this income is her family's sole source of income, besides the $70 aid check she receives from the government every month. Naiba is determined to grow her food store. That's why she has applied for a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars to purchase more staples that will stock her shelves.

loans.use: To buy more food for a small store

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai M. is 52 years old and the father of 5 children. He lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Mr. M. has been in the livestock business for 28 years. He has a good flock and rams that provide the general family income. His wife and children help him by selling meat, milk and yarn products.

Mr. M. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $775 US for 6 months so he can build a new barn. Mr. M. thanks KIVA for its work and wishes KIVA lenders all the best.

loans.use: To build a new barn

loans.name: Obidjon

texts.en:
Obidjon O. was born in 1970 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Mr. O. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008. He has been in the livestock business for 20 years and has excellent practical skills in that field. Mr. O. dreams of having a big livestock farm so he is ready to work hard. He also works on a collective farm.

Mr. O. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $925 US for 6 months to purchase some rams.

loans.use: To purchase some rams

loans.name: Gafur

texts.ru:
Gafur R. is 22 years old, he is married and has one young daughter. He has a specialized high school education and for 3 years he has been helping his mother to bring products for sale from Bishkek. He and his mother sell men’s shoes. He currently has a lot of out of season inventory – fall and winter shoes – which is why he has turned to MicroInvest for a loan. He will use the loan to purchase summer products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Рустамов Гафур парень в возросте 22 года женат имеет одну маленькую дочку. Образование средне специальное, уже 3 года как помогает маме по доставке товара с Бишкека.Он с матерью торгуют мужской обувью. На данный момент у него осталось много не сезонного товара, осене- зимней обуви , поэтому для завоза летнего ассортимента он обратился за кредитом в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Purchase summer inventory

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy Pronh, 36, and her husband, Mr. Khum Khoun, 36, live across from the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1996 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children attend the local school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Navy has been a silk weaver for twenty-one years, having acquired the knowledge from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Khum has been a carpenter for twelve years. The couple is in the process of building their new house and lack the money needed to buy bamboo lattices to make the walls of the house. Mrs. Navy is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase bamboo lattices to make the walls of their house.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo lattice to make wall for her house.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha N., 41, and her husband, Mr. Nai Nou, 45, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home, while the other four children live under her custody.

Mrs. Chantha has been selling flowers for two years. She grows jasmine flowers on the farm near her house to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Mr. Nai is a fisherman, and he fishes from the lake and the river in the village, and then resells the fish. Currently, the couple is in the process of building their house and lack the money needed to finish it. Mrs. Chantha is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to help build her house.

loans.use: To finish building a new house.

loans.name: Dot

texts.en:
Mr. Dot T., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Chantha Youm, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2003 and have three sons. Mrs. Chantha stays at home to take care of the children

Dot has been a motor trailer taxi (Tok Tok) driver in Phnom Penh for over a year, and he also sells cows with his father. His trailer is broken and he needs some money to buy a new one. Dot is requesting a loan to purchase a trailer to replace the old one, so that he can continue driving a motor trailer taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for a motor trailer taxi (Tok Tok).

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao S., 29, and her husband, Mr. Lanh Sam, 28, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two children, one son and one daughter. The couple live with their parents.

Mrs. Sreymao has been a tailor since she was eighteen years old. She does her job at home. Mr. Lanh Sam has been a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh for eight years. Now his motor is very old and needs to be changed for new one.

So, Mrs. Sreymao is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase one sewing machine and buy one new motorcycle to replace the old one for her husband to keep being a motor taxi driver.

loans.use: To purchase one sewing machine and buy one motorcycle for her husband who is a motor taxi driver.

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary T., 40, and her husband, Mr. Kunthea Un, 43, who live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have two sons. Their first son has full time employment in Phnom Penh and the youngest son is in the local school. 

Mrs. Sotheary has been growing and selling flowers for five years. She collected flowers from her farm and bought some from villagers for resale at the market in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Kunthea has been a motor taxi driver for eight years.

Now Mrs. Sothery is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase flower trees for planting and to buy flowers under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase flower trees for planting and to buy flowers under contract for resale.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid H. is a 55-year-old married father of three living in Bilasuvar, a southern region of Azerbaijan. To support his family, he sells clothes in the Internally Displaced People Settlement. More than 600,000 Azerbaijanis live in these types of settlements; most have fled from an area called Nagorny Karabakh, a region caught in the Azerbaijan-Armenian territorial conflict. To expand his business, he has applied for a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars. Since he has successfully sold clothes for more than two decades, Rashid is confident that he will be able to repay his loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to expand a small business

loans.name: Selling Vegetables And Fruits Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy N. (her husband is in picture on the left) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are four families including hers. The entire group members are living along National road number six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Chanthy N. (age 41) and her husband were married in 1992. They have one son, who is in school. She has been selling vegetables in her village for over one year.  Her husband, Mr. Koeun Phreap has been a construction worker for two years. Now Chanty is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase vegetables for resale.

2- Mrs. Nara N., aged 51 (the second shown in the picture from the left) and her husband were married in 1979 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. She has been selling food products for over three years. Her husband is a driver for an organization in Phnom Penh. Now Nara is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase vegetables and meat to cook for selling.

3- Mrs. Nat M., 65, (the second shown in the picture from the right) and her husband were married in 1971 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. She and her husband have been selling water melons for four years. Now Nat is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase water melons for resale.

4- Mrs. Thea M., 29, (shown in the picture at the right) and her husband were married in 1995 and have two daughters. She has been selling fruit for two years. Her husband, Mr. At Sum has been a mason for over ten years. Now Thea is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruit for resale

loans.name: Kiluvya Group

texts.en:
Andrew M. is a 40-year-old father. He is married and has two children, ages 17 and 20. He is the leader of the Kiluvya group (the name means "community" in Swahili). He currently runs a photography business in his community near Dar es Salaam, earning a monthly profit of $85. He began doing photography eight years ago. He works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm daily.

Andrew has taken out five loans with Tujijenge before, and he has succesfully repaid all of them. With this loan, he hopes to upgrade his camera and equipment, which will allow him to take more pictures of better quality. Furthermore, he is also using the loan to put together a collection of his work that he will sell when it is finished.

Along with Andrew, there are five other members in his group who will share the loan. These members own businesses ranging from tailoring to food vending. The group takes the loan out together and guarantees each member in the group to ensure full payback.

loans.use: To purchase a better camera and film

loans.name: Maarifa Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu M., 26 years old, is married with two children. She has one boy and one girl, ages 7 and 4, respectively. She owns a charcoal distribution business, where she works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily. She earns $45 a month and has operated the business since 2005.

Mwajabu is the leader of the Maarifa group, consisting of five other members. She has taken out six loans from Tujijenge before and successfuly paid back all of them. With this loan she hopes to purchase a small piece of land to build a storage room, increase her inventory, and help pay her children's school fees. The other group members operate a brick distribution business and fishing and food vending businesses. These members guarantee each other in paying back their debts.

loans.use: To buy land to build a storage room, and to increase her inventory

loans.name: Leah J.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Leah L.. She is married and has two children aged 5 and 2. She has six dependents who live with her because they are relatives. In 2005, Leah established her tailoring business. Leah requires a loan in order to buy additional cloth. In the future, Leah plans to invest in a small business for cloth-making. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy additional cloth.

loans.name: Jazira

texts.en:
Jazira S., 50, is widowed with five children. She owns and operates a fabric business in Dar-Es-Salaam. The business has been running for 10 years and brings in a monthly profit of $80.00. Jazira works daily from 10am to 6pm.

Jazira has had a previous loan from Tujijenge, which she has paid back in full. She is happy with the type of business, but now she wishes to expand. With this loan from Kiva, she hopes to increase her capital by purchasing more inventory.

loans.use: To increase capital and expand her fabric business.

loans.name: Songambele Kibamba Group

texts.en:
Iddy T., 42, is married with five children. He lives outside Dar es Salaam and operates a charcoal sales business that he started in 2000. He earns about $100 a month at this business.

With a loan from Kiva, Iddy hopes to increase his inventory and distribute more charcoal through his community. With the extra income from these sales, he will pay his children's school fees.

Iddy is part of a large group of borrowers. Their group name, Songambele, means "to go forward" in Swahili. They are all from the same area and operate a variety of businesses. With this loan they all hope to increase their savings and income to support themselves and their families. The group acts as a guarantee of payment, as each member is responsible for another.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for distribution

loans.name: Wotsa

texts.fr:
Born into a modest family originally from the village of Keve in Ave Prefecture, Miss Wotsa F. was born on April 12, 1978. She is single. In 2004 she opened a sewing workroom called “Couture aux Elegantes” (Sewing for Elegant Women) in Lomé’s Adidogomé neighborhood. She currently has three apprentice seamstresses. The first loan she obtained enabled her to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth) to re-sell. The loan she is requesting now will enable her to buy an overlock machine and 12 pieces of mid-quality pagne.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Issue d’une famille modeste et originaire du village de KEVE dans la préfecture de l’AVE, Mademoiselle F. Wotsa est née le 12 avril 1978. Elle est célibataire. En 2004 elle a crée son atelier de couture dénommé « COUTURE AUX ELEGANTES » dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Actuellement elle a trois apprenties couturières. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis d’acheter des pagnes et de les revendre. Le crédit actuel qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une machine à surfilage et 12 pièces de pagne de qualité intermédiaire.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine and pagnes (African cloth)

loans.name: Kossi Benjamin

texts.fr:
Originally from the village of Tokpo in Togo’s Zio Prefecture, Mr Kossi Benjamin G. was born in 1987 and is single. Very early on he began an apprenticeship in motorcycle mechanics. Having become his own boss in 2005, he runs his business in Lomé’s Agbalépédo neighborhood. He specializes in repairing Yamaha, Honda and Suzuki motorcycles. He has added the sale of motor oil to his main activity. He started this second business because he noticed that a lot of motorcycle owners buy this oil and he sees that he can make a lot of profit from selling it. The first loan he obtained enabled him to set himself up and become operational. The second loan he is requesting will enable him to buy work tools such as sets of keys, a bicycle pump, a generator and 10 cans of motor oil.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Originaire du village de Tokpo dans la préfecture de Zio au Togo, Monsieur G. Kossi Benjamin est né en 1987 et est célibataire. Très tôt il s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage de la mécanique à deux roues. Devenu son propre patron en 2005, il exerce ce métier dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo à Lomé. Il est spécialisé dans la réparation des motos de marque YAMAHA, HONDA et SUZUKI. Il a ajouté à son activité principale la vente d’huile à moteur. Il fait cette seconde activité car il a constaté que beaucoup d’usagers de moto achètent cette huile et il voit qu’il peut en tirer beaucoup de bénéfice en faisant ce commerce. Le premier crédit qu’il avait obtenu lui a permis de s’installer et d’être opérationnel. Le second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir les outils de travail tels que les trousseaux de clé, une pompe à air, un groupe électrogène et 10 bidons d’huile à moteur.

loans.use: To buy sets of keys and some motor oil

loans.name: Kasuku Group

texts.en:
Juma M., 41, is married with four boys. He works outside Dar es Salaam selling secondhand clothing at his stand. The business has been running for one year, and he usuA. takes in about $140 a month. He works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily.

Juma has already paid off one loan succesfully from Tujijenge, and with this loan from Kiva he hopes to purchase a wider variety of clothes for his stand. Juma is in a group with 22 other members. Each member owns and operates their own businesses, and they will share the loan among themselves according to their needs. The group also acts as a guarantee, because each member is responsible for another. This way, the repayment of the loan is always ensured.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for his stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, pants and new items with which to expand a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy costume jewelry to resell in her community.

loans.name: Dina Mercedes

texts.en:
Click this link to view Mercedes' first loan

Mercedes is a member of the Village Bank Llamkasum which means "we work" in Quechua.

Mercedes lives with her boyfriend, is 30 years old and has two children. She sells construction materials such as adhesives and bricks. She gets the bricks made in a community that is about 30 minutes outside the city of Ayacucho. She sells the bricks out of her house and also delivers them to people's homes or businesses. In the past few months she put a roof on her house.

Mercedes needs a loan of 1500 soles ($US525), money which she will invest in the purchase of sand and brick.

Mercedes's dreams are to give her children a good education, to buy more trucks to help her business grow, and to get married this year.

loans.use: To purchase sand and brick.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Silvio works as a cashier in a financial institution, and he studies Auditing at the Universidad Salesiana de Bolivia. He lives in the Llojeta El Rosal neighborhood in La Paz, Bolivia. He is 30 years old, single and supports himself; at 30, he no longer counts on his parents' help. This is the fourth time that he asks for a loan at Impro. The loan he requests this time will be used to purchase a computer, which he needs to complete the practical homework assigned in the last two years of his studies.

Sivio is very responsible; he had a good record on the previous loans, and he did not have any problems making the payments on time. His desire to obtain a university degree is one more reason to help him.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Silvio trabaja como cajero en una entidad financiera y es estudiante de auditoria en la Universidad Salesiana de Bolivia. Vive en la zona de Llojeta el rosal de la Ciudad de La Paz Es soltero y se mantiene por si mismo ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres porque tiene 30 años. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado para la compra de una computadora ya que esta en los últimos dos años de la Universidad y es un bien necesario para que pueda realizar sus trabajos prácticos. Es una persona muy responsable ya que en todo el tiempo que trabaja, su comportamiento en los créditos otorgados fue bueno y no tuvo problemas para efectuar sus pagos respectivos. Sus ansias de terminar su carrera universitaria es una razón más para que podamos ayudarlo.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer, needed to finish university studies

loans.name: Jamil

texts.es:
Jamil works as an independent auditor and accountant. He lives in the Pampahasi neighborhood in La Paz, Bolivia. This is the fourth loan he requests at Impro. His credit history earns him a grade of client 1, that is, a person who has met his payments well. The loan will be used to pay for registration and tuition of Auditing refresher courses, which will enhance his resume and work conditions. His work and sense of responsibility have given him the opportunity to obtain this loan, because he has responsibly met his financial obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva tranlator

Jamil trabaja como auditor independiente y también realiza trabajos de contabilidad. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz.. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El crédito será destinado para el pago de estudios de actualización en la rama de auditoria y así mejorar sus currículo y condiciones laborales. Su trabajo, y responsabilidad le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito ya que es una persona responsable en el pago de sus obligaciones.

loans.use: Registration and tuition for Auditing refresher courses

loans.name: Marleni

texts.en:
Click this link to view Marleni's first loan

Marleni belongs to the Village Bank Bonanza. She is single and 29 years old. She sells cosmetics from a catologue to her friends and family. Additionally, she sells various types of clothing in the different fairs of the region, as well as working in a bakery at night. Her business is growing little by little because she now has more capital to help her business.

Marleni needs a loan of 2000 soles ($US700), money she will invest in the purchase of children's clothes such as polos, pants and coats.

Marleni's dreams are to get a professional title, have an established store and a beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for children such as polos, pants and coats.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. sells meat, fish, and cow feet. She is married but her husband's income from his job as a fire fighter is not sufficient for Mercy and her four children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling meat, fish, and cow feet.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.en:
Click this link to view Ana Maria's first loan

Ana Maria belongs to the Village Bank Comunal Señor De Huanca. She is married, 23 years old, and has three children. Ana Maria, along with her husband, makes different sorts of bread, biscotti, and cake in her husband's parents' oven. She distributes their breads mainly among the stores around their area and for a month they go to the different fairs of the region to sell their breads – traveling in her husband's parents' car. They also buy cheese at the fairs that they sell to the stores in their neighborhoods as well.

Ana Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles ($US700), which she will invest in the purchase of flour and to pay for part of the land she has acquired.

Ana Maria's dream is to build her house, have a big store where she can sell her products, and that her children will be professionals one day.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of flour and to pay for part of the land she has acquired.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Serafina's first loan

Serafina is a member of the Village Bank Prosperity. She is married, 63 years old and has seven children. Serafina sells various foods typical of the region at a stand in the Santa Clara market every day. Furthermore, Serafina rents a mototaxi which her children use to proviD. public transportation around the city of Ayacucho.

Serafina needs a loan of 1200 soles ($US425), money which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, potatoes, oil and noodles.

Serafina's dreams are to better her business and her house, and that her children have stable jobs.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, potatoes, oil and noodles.

loans.name: Zoraida Victoria

texts.es:
Zoraida is a member of the bank Comunal Glorioso.

Zoraida is married, is 38 years old and has two children. Zoraida owns a store located in her neighborhood where she sells groceries, cosmetics, clothing and wallets. Her time is shared between her business and her housework. In addition, Zoraida and her husband provide Internet and photocopying services. Zoraida’s husband has a lock shop where he also invests the loans that he is granted.

Zoraida needs a loan of $700 which she will invest in the purchase of sugar, pastas, sodas and beer.

Zoraida’s dreams are to build her home, expand her business and give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Zoraida pertenece al Banco Comunal Glorioso.

Zoraida es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Zoraida tiene una bodega surtida ubicada en su domicilio donde vende abarrotes, cosméticos, ropas, carteras, bebidas, Zoraida comparte sus tareas del hogar con la atención de sus negocios. Además Zoraida junto a su esposo tienen cabinas de Internet y servicios de fotocopiado. El esposo de Zoraida tiene una cerrajería en donde también invierte los prestamos que obtiene.

Zoraida necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideos, gaseosas y cerveza.

Los sueños de Zoraida son construir su casa, ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, pastas and soft drinks.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas C. sells food items. She is married but her husband's income from his business is not sufficient for Dorcas and her two children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling food items.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn A. sells sandals, hair gels, boots, and underwear. She is married but her husband's income from repairing cars is not sufficient for Evelyn and her four children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling sandals, hair gels, boots, and underwear.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. sells drinks. She is married but her husband's income as a carpenter is not sufficient for Gladys and her two children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling drinks.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Click this link to view Herminia's first loan

Herminia is a member of the Village Bank Prosperity. She is married, 53 years old and has two children. She sells toys and cleaning supplies at a stand she rents in the Santa Clara market. She also works during celebration times and special occasions selling various products such as gifts for mother's day, games, and other things depending on the demand.

Herminia needs a loan of 1200 soles ($US425), which she will invest in the purchase of toys, flowerpots and various other gifts. Herminia's dreams are to finish the construction of her house and to own her own stand at the market.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of toys, flowerpots and various other gifts for her market stand.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Since her childhood Victoria has dedicated herself to farmwork and this has allowed her to convert her noble occupation into a source of income which is indispensable to her family. Victoria grows, potatoes, olluco (tubers), beans, barley and oats. Her four children are what give her the strength to continue in spite of difficult moments they have been through due to the fact that sometimes harvests do not pay off the effort put in months before. She wishes to improve the quality of her products and foray into raising animals which is why she is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas y esto le ha servido para convertir a su noble oficio en una fuente de ingreso indispensable en su hogar, siembra papa, olluco, habas, cebada, avena y mashua; y sus 4 hijos son los que le dan fuerzas para continuar a pesar de los momentos difíciles que les ha tocado vivir debido a que a veces la cosecha no compensa el esfuerzo realizado meses atrás. Desea mejorar la calidad de sus productos e incursionar en la crianza de animales y a esa razón atiende su solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and animals for breeding.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard N. sells electronics. He is single and his income is not sufficient for Richard and his three dependents. Demand for his goods is high and he is looking to expand his business. He is asking for additional capital to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: To expand his business selling electronics.

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en: Kweku E. is a car tires repair man. He is married but his wife's income from being an apprentice is not sufficient for them and their three children. Demand for his goods is high and he is looking to expand his business. He is asking for additional capital to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: To expand his business repairing car tires.

loans.name: Áída

texts.es:
Twelve years ago Aida vowed to burgeon in her birthplace in the town of Casacancha. She has also dedicated herself to the diverse farming and livestock chores which she realizes with great efficiency. Because of her efforts she can satisfactorily support her two children. Her wish to improve her livestock business has driven her to request this loan since she desires to diversify and optimize the breeding of her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Aída apostó por desarrollarse plenamente en su tierra natal de Casacancha y dedicarse a las diversas tareas agrícolas y ganaderas también desde hace 12 años en las que viene desarrollándose con gran efectividad, gracias a su esfuerzo puede sostener a sus 2 hijos con satisfacción. Su deseo de mejorar su desempeño ganadero la conducen a solicitar un préstamo ya que tiene anhelo de diversificar y optimizar la crianza de sus pequeños animalitos.

loans.use: Capital to increase and improve the conditions for raising her animals.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica M. sells baby clothes, towels, and women's underwear. She is married but her husband's income from teaching is not sufficient for Veronica and her five children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling baby clothes, towels, and underwear.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian K. sells provisions. She is married but her husband's income from his job at the University Press is not sufficient for Vivian and her six children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling provisions.

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es:
Mr. Carlos E. is a gentleman that has dedicated himself to the agriculture and livestock industry his whole life in the district of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. He has been characterized as a very spirited and strong person whose successes are directly applied to his family, composed of his wife and three young children.

The work he does in his sector is through the production of basic grains and raising livestock for their respective commercialization. It is necessary to point out that this is the only income that supports his family that really needs it.

Today he looks for support from Ceprodel to obtain the necessary loan to purchase cows to raise them. With this loan his beloved family will benefit as much as he will.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Carlos E. es un caballero que toda su vida la ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, él se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy esforzada cuyos logros son directamente aplicados a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y tres pequeños hijos.

La labor la realiza en su sector por medio de la producción de granos básicos y la crianza de ganado para su respectiva comercialización. Es de necesidad destacar que este es el único ingreso con que alimenta a su familia que tanto necesita de él.

Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de vacas para desarrollarlas. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su amada familia.

loans.use: Purchase of cows as livestock

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. prepares food for sale. She is married but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Esi and her seven children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business preparing food for sale.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
In the district of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Mr. José Francisco Hernández S. is the father of one son, for whom he has to take care of and provide daily sustenance. He has dedicated himself to the agriculture and livestock industry since he was very young and has acquired experience and in this way is able to maintain his family.

Today this gentleman needs to promptly acquire the economic resources to buy cows with the objective of raising them in his farm where he has arduously cultivated vegetables. This has been the motive for which Mr. José Francisco has come to Ceprodel to obtain the loan necessary for the purchase so that he can continue caring for his humble family that really needs his support.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega el señor José Francisco Hernández S. es padre de un niño el cual debe de mantener y proporcionarle el sustento diario. Se dedica al negocio agropecuario desde que era muy jovencito, así ha venido adquiriendo experiencia y de esta manera es como mantiene su núcleo familiar.

Hoy en día la necesidad que este caballero atraviesa es la pronta adquisición del recurso económico para la compra de vacas con el objetivo de criarlas en su finca donde muy arduamente realiza sus cultivos de hortalizas. Este ha sido un motivo por el cual el señor José Francisco ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase cows

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
In the district of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Mr. José Santos C. is dedicated to the agriculture and livestock industry, which he serves in his district Flor de Azalea (Azalea Flower) where he lives together with his family, made up of his wife and seven children, some adults and other younger children.

His strength in work is cultivating livestock. He has always been dedicated to giving technical assistance to his crops through fumigation and care to obtain a good harvest. Now he needs to acquire the economic resources to invest in his livestock business such as the purchase of cows for their respective development and to obtain milk for sustenance and for commercialization. For this reason he seeks support from Ceprodel to be a beneficiary of a loan that will allow him to succeed in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor José Santos C. se dedica al negocio agropecuario el cual atiende en su comarca Flor de Azalea donde vive en conjunto con su familia compuesta por su esposa y siete hijos unos adultos y otros pequeños.

Su fuerte en el trabajo es el cultivo así como la ganadería o pecuario, siempre se ha dedicado a dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos por medio de la fumigación y cuido para obtener una buena cosecha. Actualmente la necesidad que el atraviesa es que necesita adquirir el recurso económico para invertirlo en su negocio agropecuario tanteen los cultivos como en la compra de vacas para su respectivo desarrollo y así obtener de ellas la leche para alimentarse y comercializarla. Por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of cows for livestock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells baby clothing, bowls, and material. She is married but her husband's income from carpentry is not sufficient to support Mary and her five children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling baby clothes, bowls, and material.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. sells cosmetics and women's underwear. She is married but her husband's income from his job at the hospital is not sufficient to support Paulina and her child. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to resell in her community.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. sells plastic bags and other products to fishermen. She is single and her income is not sufficient to support her and her two children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling plastic bags and other products.

loans.name: Mauricio José

texts.es:
The business of agriculture and livestock is a job that requires great sacrifice, demanding great efforts which should be carried out in the field, exposed to the sun for many hours and moving animals over long distances. Aware of this situation, Mr. Mauritius is devoted to the agricultural business in the district of Somotillo, where he originates from.

He has a humble family composed of his wife and four small children, for whom he provides food and support for their studies. The reason for him requesting a loan is to invest in his agriculture and livestock business through crops and purchase of livestock such as oxen for their respective development. Currently he is a loyal client, having paid off all of the loans on time and in accordance with the provisions of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio agropecuario es una labor que requiere mucho sacrificio por demandar grandes esfuerzos ya que se debe de llevar a cabo en el campo y además en la exposición al sol por muchas horas y en el traslado de los animales de largas distancias. Consciente de esta situación el señor Mauricio se dedica al negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Somotillo de donde es originario.

Posee una humilde familia compuesta por su esposa y cuatro pequeños hijos el cual les brinda su respectiva alimentación y sustento en sus estudios. El motivo por el cual solicita el crédito es para invertir en su negocio agropecuario por medio de los cultivos y para la adquisición de ganado como lo son bueyes para su respectivo desarrollo. Actualmente él es un fiel cliente habiendo cancelado todos los créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido en la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing to resell in her community.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. sells provisions like rice and gari, which is a popular local dish. She is single and her income is not sufficient to support Beatrice and her child. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling provisions.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Mr. Pedro Pablo G. is dedicated to agricultural work, which is his only income to support his family, composed of his wife and three school-aged children. He has been dedicated to this business for several years and over time he has gained experience in cultivating crops.

Today he has come to Ceprodel with the proposition of obtaining a loan to purchase seed for planting corn and sesame. It is necessary to point out that in order to carry out the first planting you need to purchase the supplies and it is for this reason that he is confident that his loan request will be successfully granted and he will achieve his objective of having a good harvest to improve his economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Pedro Pablo G. se dedica a la labor de la agricultura siendo este su único ingreso con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y tres hijos en edades escolares. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace varios años y a través del tiempo ha venido ganando experiencia en los cultivos.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito oportuno para la compra de insumos para siembra de maíz y ajonjolí. Es necesario destacar que para llevar a cabo la siembra primeramente se deben de comprar los insumos y es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente y logrará su objetivo de tener una muy buena cosecha para mejora de su situación económica.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for planting corn and sesame

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy women's clothing in bulk to resell in the community.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia E. sells provisions. She is married but her husband's income from his job as a trader is not sufficient for Emelia and her five children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling provisions.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Adilia is dedicated to selling food and drinks in her home in Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She started her business 15 years ago with few economic resources. Her concern for improving her economic situation led to her increasing the meals and drinks she offers to her customers. Now in her home she has installed tables so that her customers can eat there and feel they are taken care of. She has also acquired a music machine which plays ambient music, providing good customer service.

Today it is important to point out that Mrs. Adilia is committed to providing sustenance to her humble family and has asked for a loan from Ceprodel to be used to purchase basic goods to make the food and to purchase drinks. Through the support that Ceprodel provides, her family will benefit as much as she does because they depend on her income.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adilia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida y refrescos en su localidad en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Inició su negocio desde hace 15 años con pocos recursos económicos los cuales al preocuparse por mejorar su situaron económica ha venido mejorando ampliando sus platillos y bebidas para ofrecer a sus clientes. Actualmente en su local de habitación ha instalado mesas para que sus clientes coman en el local y sentirse satisfechos con la atencion.Tambien ha adquirido una maquina musical el cual emite musica de acuerdo al ambiente brindando asi mejor atencion al cliente

Hoy en día es de importancia destacar que la señora Adilia comprometida con llevar el sustento a su humilde familia ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para ser utilizado en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y en la compra de las bebidas. Por medio de este apoyo que le brindará Ceprodel podrá ser beneficiada tanto ella como su familia que dependen de sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of raw goods to make food

loans.name: Hermenejilda

texts.es:
Hermenejilda P. is a woman that with much effort along with her husband works providing a mill service to her customers. This allows her to improve the structural condition of her house, which being in bad shape due to tremors and hurricanes is a danger to her family and children that live in it. P. says that her dream is that her two small children have a place to live which provide the necessary living conditions for their development.

Because of the aforementioned, she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a necessary loan for the purchase of construction materials to continue with the reconstruction of her house since when she started previously she had to stop the work for lack of economic resources. Today she is waiting very confidently for her loan to be granted so that she can fulfill her dream of having a house that provides the necessary living conditions, all of which will be achieved through the improvement of her mill business that she has in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Hermenejilda P. es una dama que con mucho esfuerzo en conjunto con su cónyuge labora brindando el servicio de molino a sus clientes para mejorar las condiciones estructurales de su vivienda por lo que al estar en mal estado a causa de los temblores y huracanes es un peligro para su familia e hijos que habitan en ella. Según comenta la señora P. su sueño es que sus dos pequeños hijos tengan un lugar donde vivir el cual preste las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo

Por lo antes descrito, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa ya que al haber iniciado anteriormente se vio en la obligación de detener la obra por falta del recurso económico. Hoy en día espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será concedido y de esta manera logrará su sueño de tener una casa que preste las condiciones necesarias para vivir y todo esto lograrlo por medio del mejoramiento de su negocio de molino el que atiende en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es:
Julia A. is a woman that puts forth effort in her work with the aim of improving the conditions of her humble home due to the fact that she has started to reconstruct it because it has been severely damaged by natural weather events. She is the mother of two school aged children whom she supports and it is her goal to provide them with a worthy roof under which to live.

Since she started the home reconstruction she has redoubled her efforts but nowadays the work has stopped due to lack of economic resources. Nevertheless, she very wisely has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will permit her to purchase the construction material to continue the work. Currently she is a loyal customer of Ceprodel and has repaid her previous loans in the time established.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia A. es una dama que se esfuerza en su trabajo con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su humilde vivienda debido a que ha iniciado a reconstruirla por el hecho de que ha sido muy azotada por los fenómenos naturales. Es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar el cual mantiene y son sus metas llegar a brindarles un techo digno donde habitar.

Desde que inició con la reconstrucción de su vivienda ha duplicado sus esfuerzos pero hoy en día ha detenido la obra por falta del recurso económico. Sin embargo muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar en la obra. Actualmente ella es una fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo cancelado sus créditos en el tiempo conveniente establecido.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Laura Lila

texts.es:
Aura Lila O. is a woman that for 10 long years has been a teacher in a small school in the municipality of Somotillo, where she lives. She has always worried about providing the best conditions for her small son, who is the reason for her great efforts in her work. Nowadays she has the need to invest money in the reconstruction of her house. The house has suffered a lot of damage from natural weather events and as a result she has started the reconstruction.

Currently she is requesting a loan at Ceprodel in order to continue with the aforementioned work because shortly winter will begin and she needs to have everything finished so that she or her son not become ill from the weather conditions. With the loan she will buy the construction materials for her house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Aura Lila O. es una dama que desde hace 10 largos años se ha dedicado al negocio de la docencia en un pequeño colegio del municipio de Somotillo donde reside. Siempre se ha preocupado por brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeño hijo el cual es la razón de sus grandes esfuerzos en su trabajo. Hoy en día es de necesidad destacar que tiene la necesidad de invertir para la reconstrucción de su vivienda por lo que ha sufrido muchos daños por motivos de los fenómenos naturales y a raíz de esto ella ha iniciado en la reconstrucción de su casa.

Actualmente ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para continuar con dicha obra por el hecho de que en pocos momentos inicia el invierno y para este tiempo ella debe de estar preparada para evitar que tanto ella o sus hijos adopten una enfermedad. Con el crédito ella comprará los materiales de construcción para su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reina A. is originally from the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega and with a lot of effort works in the business of making and selling tortillas in her house. This is very respectable work and thanks to it she has managed to support her family satisfying the necessities of the household and provide an education for her small son.

The problem that Reina is confronting nowadays is the lack of economic resources to buy the corn and firewood needed for the production of her tortillas. This is the reason that she is seeking the support of Ceprodel in obtaining a loan that will allow her to purchase the ingredients to continue the business of making and selling the delicious tortillas that she herself sells in her house in Somotillo.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Reina A. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega y muy esforzadamente se dedica al negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su sector de habitación. Este es un trabajo muy digno que gracias a el ha logrado mantener su núcleo familiar satisfaciendo las necesidades del hogar y brindándole la educación a su pequeño hijo.

La problemática que hoy en día la señora Reina está atravesando es la ausencia del recurso económico para la compra del maíz y la leña para la elaboración de las tortillas. Es por este motivo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los ingredientes para llevar a cabo su negocio de elaboración y venta de las deliciosas tortillas que ella misma comercializa en su casa de habitación en Somotillo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for production tortillas

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Norma M. is originally from the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She works selling clothing in her house and is the only income that she has to take care of her of school aged son. The reason for current concern is that her house has suffered damage due natural phenomena.

This is the reason that today she has come to Ceprodel to obtain the benefit of a timely loan to continue with the reconstruction since after starting she had to stop the work for lack of economic resources. It's important to note that she has managed in the past to continue moving ahead thanks to the loans provided by Ceprodel and the loan that she is currently requesting will be invested in the purchase of contstuction materials for the house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma M. E. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa en su local de habitación siendo este el único ingreso con el que mantiene a su hijo en edad escolar. El motivo de su preocupación en este momento es que su vivienda ha atravesado grandes dificultades por el hecho de que ha sido lastimada por los fenómenos naturales.

Por esta única razón es que hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito oportuno para continuar con su reconstrucción puesto que al haber iniciado debió detener la obra por falta del recurso económico. Es de importancia destacar que ella ha salido adelante gracias a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel, el crédito que ahora ella solicita será invertido en la compra de los materiales de construcción para su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of tablecloths, bedspreads and housewares to move a small business forward.

loans.name: Lesbia Juana

texts.es:
Lesbia R.' business is selling ice cream (Eskimos) and cosmetics, which she sells in her house in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. It's important to mention that since she started her business her life and that of her family has improved.

She is the mother of two children and her goals are to improve the condition of her business to improve the life of her family. It shouldn't be forgotten that since she started her business, it has improved thanks to the support that Ceprodel has given to her through loan which she has invested directly in the purchase of Eskimos and cosmetics for their respective sale in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la señora Lesbia R. es la venta de Eskimos o helados y venta de cosméticos los cuales los comercializa en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur. Es de importancia mencionar que desde que inició su negocio ella ha venido mejorando su condición y la de su familia.

Es madre de dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y son sus metas mejorar las coediciones de su negocio para así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. No podemos obviar que desde que comenzó con su negocio, he venido mejorando satisfactoriamente gracias al apoyo que Ceprodel le ha brindado por medio de la entrega de créditos los cuales los ha invertido directamente en la compra de los Eskimos y los cosméticos para su respectiva venta en su sector de habitación,

loans.use: Purchase of products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk to resell in her community.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin is single and he works providing sound and music to social events such as weddings, birthdays, baptisms, parties. He works independently, and this is his only source of income to support himself and help his mother. He lives in the Miraflores neighborhood in La Paz, Bolivia. This is the sixth time that he enjoys the benefits of a loan. Benjamin is requesting this loan to purchase a double mixer (to mix music tracks) and to have a competitive advantage in the entertainment market. His hard word and desire for self-improvement make him worthy of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Benjamín es soltero y ofrece servicios de amplificación para acontecimientos sociales como cumpleaños, matrimonios, bautizos, fiestas, etc. Dicha actividad es desarrollada de manera independiente y es la única fuente de ingresos, los cuales ayudan económicamente a su madre. Su domicilio se encuentra en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz Esta es la sexta ocasión en que se beneficia con un crédito. El monto esta vez será invertido en la compra de un compactador doble (equipo que se utiliza para enganchar y mezclar pistas musicales), con lo cuál pretende ofrecer una ventaja competitiva en el mercado del entretenimiento. Su trabajo y sus ganas de superación le permiten acceder al préstamo.

loans.use: music equiment

loans.name: Luis Reynaldo

texts.es:
The city of Managua is known for having many beaches and beautiful places to visit; such beautiful places provide many opportunities for various economic activities. Such is the case for the Pochomil spa where Luis G. purchases seafood to sell in the area around the spa, in his home, and occasionally in the streets of his city.

He sells all types of seafood, from fish to conch to lobster, etc. This is the only income Luis has which he uses to support himself and his family—consisting of his wife, his small son, and his elderly mother.

He is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to purchase more seafood to sell. Through the loan, both he and his family will benefit greatly.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La ciudad de Managua se caracteriza por tener muchas playas y hermosos lugares donde visitar y también donde se puede llevar a cabo una actividad económica como lo es en el caso del balneario Pochomil que es el lugar donde el señor Luis G. compra sus mariscos para luego comercializarlos en dicho lugar, en su casa y a veces en las calles de su municipio.

Vende todo tipo de mariscos desde pescados, punches, conchas, langostas, etc. Es de importancia destacar que este es su único ingreso por el que se sustenta él y su amada familia compuesta por su cónyuge, su pequeño hijo y su querida madre ya en edad avanzada.

Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de los mariscos para su comercializacion. Por medio de este crédito se benefician tanto el como su familia la cual tiene la necesidad de mantener.

loans.use: Purchase of seafood

loans.name: Marcelino Pascual

texts.es:
Mr. Marcelino has run a livestock business for many years which he has used to support his wife and three small children. Since he began his business, he has worked hard to use his earnings to sustain his home and his livestock business has helped him to achieve his goals.

Currently, he needs to purchase more livestock in order to grow his business. Intelligently, he is seeking a loan from Ceprodel in order to acquire additional animals to offer in his neighborhood of San Rafael del Sur in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Marcelino se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de ganadería con el cual alimenta a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y tres pequeños hijos. Desde sus inicios en el negocio se ha esforzado para llevar siempre el sustento a su hogar y lo ha logrado gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos en el trabajo ganadero.

Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa el señor Marcelino es que le urge la compra del ganado para su respectiva comercialización. Es por esta razón que muy inteligentemente busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual adquirir los animales para luego ofrecerlos en su sector de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora N. is a native of San Rafael del Sur in the city of Managua. She runs a business making and selling prepared meals. She is known as an excellent cook since she has worked in the culinary business for years.

She is the mother of one and is responsible for covering the daily costs of her humble home. She currently needs to purchase raw materials to make the delicious meals that she sells from her shop. She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase those ingredients in order to continue offering meals to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Auxiliadora N. es originaria del municipio de San Rafael del Sur en la ciudad de Managua. Allí se dedica al negocio de elaboración y venta de comida preparados por ella misma para ofrecerlos en el negocio. Se caracteriza por ser una excelente cocinera ya que posee varios años de dedicarse a este oficio.

Actualmente es madre de un hijo el cual mantiene y además es responsable de cubrir las necesidades de su humilde hogar. Hoy en día para elaborar los deliciosos platillos ella requiere de la compra de la materia prima para su respectiva elaboración. Es por este motivo que ella busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de estos ingredientes para continuar elaborando los mejores platillos para sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of food ingredients

loans.name: Rosa Bertilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertilda M. runs a store selling cosmetics and clothes out of her humble home in San Rafael in Managua. She started the business with little merchandise but over time, she has been able to fill her display cabinets and offer all types of cosmetics and clothing for men and women.

She is now looking for a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase additional merchandise to sell in her store. She is a faithful customer, having repaid all her previous loans on time and according to the rules of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bertilda M. se dedica al negocio de venta de cosméticos y ropa en su humilde casa de habitación en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en el municipio de San Rafael. Inició en el negocio con poca mercadería pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado llenar sus vitrinas y ofrecer todo tipo de cosméticos y también ropa para caballeros y damas.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito con el cual comprar de sus proveedores la mercadería para luego ofrecerla a sus clientes en su sector de habitación. Actualmente es una fiel cliente habiendo cancelado todos sus créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido en la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Maria runs her own general store in a municipal school in San Rafael in Managua. She has operated the store in this locale for many years and has slowly improved the variety of products she offers.

She sells most of her goods when students have recess or leave school after classes. She works hard in her store every day with the vision of offering a better life for her small son.

She is asking for a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase more merchandise for her store. The loan will help her to provide a greater variety of products to sell to the students.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Maria posee su propio negocio de venta de comestibles o pulpería en un colegio del municipio de San Rafael en Managua. Realiza sus ventas en este lugar desde hace varios años y así ha venido mejorando en el negocio poco a poco en el ofrecimiento de mas productos para su venta.

Sus ventas las lleva a cabo en el momento en el cual los alumnos salen al recreo y también en el momento de la salida de clases. Todos los días ella se dedica con mucho esfuerzo al negocio y con la visión de mejorar algún día para así brindarle mejores condiciones a su pequeño hijo.

La razón por la cual busca el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar los productos para su venta. Con este crédito se beneficia ella ya que le permite aumentar sus utilidades en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Winder Alberto

texts.es:
Winder P. is an expert in vehicle mechanics and repair. He has his own workshop in his home where he attends to his faithful clients on his patio.

He is the father of two children whom it is his responsibility to support. He works very hard to offer his children everything they need for their development and education. He has asked for a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase metal sheets to weld and some work tools. He hopes that his loan will be approved so that he can continue maintaining his humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Winder P. es un caballero experto en el ramo de la mecánica y reparación de los vehículos. Tiene su propio taller en su casa de habitación donde atiende en un patio bastante amplio a sus fieles clientes que le visitan.

Es padre de dos hijos el cual tiene el deber de mantener. Por este motivo es que se esfuerza grandemente para brindarles siempre lo que ello s necesiten para su desarrollo y educación. Actualmente ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de láminas para soldar y algunas herramientas de trabajo. Espera confiadamente que el crédito le sea aprobado y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of work tools

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
In the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Ms. Adela F. has dedicated herself for several years to the sale of cosmetics which she sells to her clients from her home. She also sells clothing in smaller quantities as cosmetics are a stronger sale. This income allows her to support her nuclear family which is made up her herself and her two children who are of school age.

Today, the need which this lady is faced with is the urgency of acquiring the economic resource to purchase cosmetics for their resale. For this sole reason she has come to Ceprodel to become the beneficiary of a necessary loan to acquire her merchandise to then be able to resell it.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua, la señora Adela F. se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de venta de cosméticos los cuales comercializa en su propia casa de habitación ofreciéndolos a sus clientes muy amablemente. También vende ropa pero en menores cantidades siendo su fuerte la venta de los cosméticos. Por medio de estos ingresos logra mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por ella y sus dos hijos en edades escolares.

Hoy en día la necesidad que esta dama atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de los cosméticos para su respectiva comercialización. Por esta única razón es que ella acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito necesario para adquirir su mercadería y así comercializarla en su negocio que atiende en su casa de habitación en San Rafael.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Ms. Blanca U. has dedicated herself for several years to raising cattle in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur where she is originally from. She is the mother of three small children who need the mutual support of their mother. This is the reason why she puts so much effort into her business of raising cattle as this is the only income that supports her home.

As all growing businesses require an investment, the need that she is faced with today is the need to invest in the purchase of livestock to subsequently sell. For this sole reason she has come to Ceprodel to obtain the necessary loan to purchase the livestock and then be able to sell it in her town.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca U. se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de la ganadería en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de donde es originaria. Es madre de tres pequeños hijos que necesitan del apoyo mutuo de su madre y por esta razón es que ella muy esforzadamente se dedica al negocio de la ganadería siendo este su único ingreso para mantener su hogar.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de inversión, la necesidad que ella hoy en día atraviesa es que necesita invertir en la compra de ganado para luego comercializarlo. Por esta única razón es que ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra del ganado y así comercializarlo en su sector de habitación donde ella se desempeña.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix began working on his own to support his family, as he needed quick income to cover the household expenses. He has always lived in a farm and has worked as a farmer since his youth. Twenty five years ago, Felix went to the US seeking better opportunities, and he was able to save enough money to go back home and buy a tractor to work the fields. He still uses this same tractor in his daily work, which affords him income to support his wife and himself.

Felix needs a loan of $300 to be repaid in 6 months to repair and service his tractor. With your help, he will make it!

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer.

Felix inició el negocio para mantener a su familia, ya que necesitaba ingresos inmediatos para el gasto familiar. Su ambiente siempre ha sido el campo y trabajando desde joven en el mismo, se fue a probar suerte a Estados Unidos, hace 25 años logrando juntar un capital que le permitio comprar un tractor pata labrar la tierra, mismo que continua ocupando en sus labores cotidianas que le permiten tener un ingreso para la manutencion de el y su esposa.

El necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para dar mantenimiento a su tractor. Con tu ayuda podra lograrlo.

loans.use: Repair his tractor

loans.name: Maria Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba has always been a very hard-working woman, and has been selling clothes for the last ten years. She became a single mother 19 years ago, and she started her own business to give her son a better quality of life and a better education. She sells clothing and shoes.

Rosalba requests a loan of $250 to be paid back in 6 months to purchase summer clothes, and to offer a wider variety of items to her customers. With your support, Rosalba will be able to make her business grow.
