Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer.

Rosalba siempre ha sido muy trabajadora y desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa ella es madre soltera desde hace 19 años, razon por la que incio su negocio para darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida asi como educacion. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de ropa de temporada de verano la cual esta proxima y desea tener variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Rosalba podra hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Iliana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Iliana started her jewelry sales business 5 years ago. With her husband's help, she was able to save a small capital to work with, and the number of her customers has increased because of her hard work. She contributes to the education expenses of their two children, a 17- and an 11- year- old.

She requests a loan of $250 to be paid back in 3 months to purchase wholesale jewelry and offer better prices to her customers. With your help, Ileana and her business will shine.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva translator

Iliana incio su negocio hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de joyeria con ayuda de su marido logro juntar un pequeño capital para trabajar y ha visto incrementar su numero de clientes en base a su esfuerzo, ella contribuye con los gastos de educacion de sus 2 hijos de 17 y 11 años.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $ 250 que pagara en 3 meses para la compra de piezas de oro por lote y asi mejorar los precios a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Iliana podra salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
Mr. Jose Alfredo Villareyna dedicates himself to farming in the municipality of Condega in the Estela department. He learned to farm when he was young which is the reason he acquired a lot of experience. Today, his multiple efforts are driven directly by his desire to provide for his family which is made up of his young son and his spouse.

The necessity which Jose Alfredo and his family are faced with is the need to invest in the cultivation of crops and specifically in the supplies for cultivation. This is the reason he has come to Ceprodel to obtain the necessary credit that will allow him to obtain these supplies to use them in his farming business. This will allow him to obtain an excellent harvest and to improve his and his family’s economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El señor José Alfredo Villareyna se dedica al negocio de agricultura el cual atiende en el municipio de Condega en el departamento de Estelí. Desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar en el negocio de agricultura y es por este motivo que adquirió basta experiencia, hoy en día sus múltiples esfuerzos se deben directamente para llevar el bienestar a su casa de habitación compuesta por su pequeño hijo y su cónyuge.

La necesidad que atraviesa el caballero José Alfredo y su familia es que necesita invertir en los cultivos específicamente en los insumos para los cultivos. Por este motivo es que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita obtener estos insumos para utilizarlos en su actividad agrícola y así obtener una excelente cosecha que le beneficie para mejorar su condición económica y la de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of farming supplies.

loans.name: Laura Dilia

texts.es:
In the municipality of Condega of the city of Esteli is where a farming business exists that provides the living for Mrs. Laura T.. She grows basic grains and handles livestock as a small producer. She is the mother of two school age children. She continually is looking for ways to be able to provide for their studies and the conditions necessary for their development.

Currently she is seeking the support of Ceprodel in obtaining a loan that will allow her to buy livestock, get the most benefit from it and then sell it in her community. She is confidently hoping that her loan is granted and she can continue to support her home in the municipality of Condega.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

El municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí es un lugar donde existe el negocio agropecuario que es la labor a la que se dedica la señora Laura T.. Ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y manejo de ganado desempeñándose como pequeño productor. Es madre de dos hijos en edades escolares los cuales busca la manera posible de mantener sus estudios brindándoles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra del ganado para desarrollarlo y sacarle el máximo provecho para luego venderlo en su comunidad. Muy confiadamente espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar con el sustento de su hogar de habitación en el municipio de Condega.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Sara Galán is 50 years old, lives in the neighbourhood ‘Laureles Sur’ in Managua, and is married. Her husband is a bricklayer, is self-employed and helps his family with the home expenses.

Sara is a cleaner, a job she has worked at for some years and that has helped her, together with her husband, to keep constructing their house. Both want to finish building their house because they do not have children and they can allocate a large part of their income to doing so. They require the loan to construct a wall in their house and in this way improve security of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Sara Galán tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua, es casada. Su esposo es albañil, trabaja por cuenta propia, y apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar.

Doña Sara es afanadora, oficio al que se dedica deshe hace algunos años y el que le ha ayudado a ir construyendo junto a su marido su casa. Ambos quieren terminar de acondiconar su casa ya que no tienen hijos, y así le pueden dedicar la mayor parte posible de sus recursos. Requieren del préstamo para levantar un muro de su casa de habitación, par así darle mayor seguridad.

loans.use: To construct a wall in her home

loans.name: Francisco Hildebrand

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco is 51 years old, lives in the neighbourhood ‘Laureles Sur’ in Managua, and is married. His wife is a housewife and together they have 2 children, 10 and 15 years old, who are studying in secondary school.

Francisco is a contractor and together with his hired help, they carry out construction projects. He has been working at this business for 25 years and this has given him the necessary experience carry on in this field. He requires the loan to purchase tools and the necessary accessories to use in construction. He would like to build up his business, establish a small company, and provide stability and education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa y junto a ella tienen 2 hijos de 10 y 15 años quienes se encuentran estudiando la educación secundaria.

Don Francisco es contratista, junto a su personal realizan proyectos de construcción. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 25 años tiempo que le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para estar en este negocio. Necesita del préstamo para comprar herramientas y accesorios necesarios para usar en la construcción. Desea poder onsolidar su negocio y poner una pequeña empresa y proporcionarle estabilidad y educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To acquire construction tools and accessories

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Mr. Gregorio D. is a small businessman who has a store in his home located in the neighborhood called ’31st of December’ in the city of Managua. Together with his wife he runs his business; all his children are independent of him.

Gregorio wants to provide his wife an improved and respectable house where both will live in their old age. He started the store with his own funds and through five years it has been improving; he would like for his business to continue to grow little by little in spite of the difficult economic climate.

He will use the loan to acquire inventory such as basic grains and housewares, and in this way stock up his store and improve the availability of goods to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Gregorio D. es un pequeño comerciante que tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación ubicada en el barrio 31 de Diciembre de la ciudad de Managua. Junto a su esposa administra su negocio, sus hijos ya todos son independientes a él.

Don Gregorio quiere brindarle a su esposauna casa mejorada y digna para que ambos vivan su vejez. Empezó la pulpería con esfuerzo propios y a través de cinco años la ha ido sacando adelante, desea que su negocio se siga desarrollando poco a poco a pesar de la difícil situación económica.

El préstamo lo utilizará para adquirir inventario como granos básicos y productos para el hogar, y así surtir su pulpería y mejorar su oferta hacia sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of housewares and basic grains

loans.name: Juana Ruth

texts.es:
Juana lives in the neighborhood of Laurles Sur. She is 47 years old and married. Both have four children, all of whom she cares for with much love and dedication.

Ten years ago, Juana, on her own initiative, started a small business making and selling iron beds. She needs the loan to buy materials like iron and paint to make the beds. She has maintained her business through loans obtained from AFODENIC and they have helped her to get ahead. Her plans are to find a better location to sell her beds where she can have a greater fluidity of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Juana habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y ambos procrearon 4 hijos, a los cuales mantienen con mucho amor y dedicación. Desde hace 10 años Doña Juana, con esfuerzo propio, puso un pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de camas, las cuales están hechas de hierro. Necesita el préstamo para comprar metria prima cono hierro y pintura para elaborar las camas. Ella ha mantenido su negocio a través de préstamos que ha hecho a AFODENIC y los cuales le han ayudado a salir adelante. Sus planes son encontrar un mejor ubicación para la venta de sus camas donde pueda tener mayor fluidez de clientes.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make iron beds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy body cream

loans.name: Bertha Julia

texts.es:
Bertha is 29 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Concepción de María. She is single and has three minor children who are in school.

Bertha’s business is renting rooms and the sale of iron products. She has six years of experience and started with her own money and little merchandise. The loan she is requesting is for the construction of a room to improve the conditions of the clients to whom she rents. In the future she will build her business, give her children an education and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Bertha tiene 29 años de edad, habita en el barrio Concepción de Maria y es soltera, tiene tres niños menores de edad que están estudiando. El negocio de doña Bertha es el alquiler de cuartos y venta de productos ferreteros tiene seis años de experiencia e inició con fondos propios y pocas mercancías. Con el dinero que esta solicitando es para la construcción de un cuarto para mejorar más las condiciones de los clientes que tiene alquilando. A futuro es incrementar su negocio, darles educación a sus hijos y tener un nivel de vida mejor.

loans.use: Construction of a room to be rented as living space

loans.name: Fresia Mercedes

texts.es:
Fresia is 33 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación. She is single and has three minor children who are in school. Fresia works in a business as a cashier and has been working for a total of six years.

The loan that they are giving her is for the construction of a wall behind her house in order to have better security. Her plans are to continue to make home improvements, provide an education for her children and to better her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Fresia tiene 33 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación es soltera y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, que están estudiando. Doña Fresia trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como cajera y tiene seis años de estar laborando y con el préstamo que le otorguen es para la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera de la casa para tener mayor seguridad. Sus planes son seguir mejorando la vivienda brindarle educación a sus hijos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Construction of a wall behind a private home for better security

loans.name: Angelita

texts.es:
Ms. Angelita lives in Villa Reconciliacion, she’s 43 years old and she has three younger children. She is a single mother and all her children go to school. Ms. Angelita works in a beauty salon and she also makes desserts and pastries, in this way she has been able to set up a small business with her own funds. The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy supplies for her business such as plastic chair and tables in order to provide a better service to customers. In the future she hopes to her own large business location.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Angelita habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene tres hijos menores de edad, es madre soltera y sus hijos están estudiando. La Sra. Angelita trabaja en un salón d belleza y también hace repostería tiene once años de experiencia, ella inició estudiando en la elaboración de postre y así ella instaló un pequeño negocio con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para compra de inventario de su negocio como sillas y mesas plástica para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. A futuro es tener un local amplio y propio de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs and tables for her pastry and bakery shop

loans.name: Mirsa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ms. Mirsa is 30 years old and she lives in Sabana Grande, she is married and has two young children. Her husband works as a driver and provides income for home expenses. Ms. Mirsa sells clothes and cosmetics and has six years of experience in the business. She started her business with the help of her husband. She will use the loan as capital to buy clothes and vouge and zermat beauty products in order to offer a variety of products to her clients. In the future she hopes to increase sales and increase earnings, improving her quality of live, and to be able to give her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Mirsa tiene 30 años de edad, habita en el barrio Sabana Grande, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, su esposo trabaja como chofer y aporta para los gastos del hogar, La Sra. Mirsa vende ropa y cosméticos, lleva seis años de experiencia, apoyada por su esposo comenzó este negocio. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo en la compra de productos zermat y vogue, ropa. Para ofrecer a sus clientes diversos productos. A futuro es incrementar ventas y tener mejores ganancias, mejorar su nivel de vida, brindarles educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy  and sell women's clothing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for HELP Africa - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Fabio Javier

texts.es:
Mr. Favio is 38 years old and he lives in Ticuantepe. He’s married and has three children, ages 4, 8, and 16. His children are students and his wife is a homemaker. Mr. Favio is in the business of growing pineapples and he has fifteen years of experience, and he began on his own initiative. With this loan he would like to buy agricultural supplies to improve production. In the future he hopes to increase his production and sales, as well as provide a good education to his children and to have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Favio tiene 38 años de edad, habita en el barrio de Ticuantepe, es casado y tienen tres hijos de 4, 8 y 16 años de edad que actualmente están estudiando, su esposa es ama de casa. El negocio del Sr. Favio es el cultivo de piña y lleva quince años de experiencia, e inició con esfuerzos propios. Con este préstamo lo quiere para compra de insumos agrícolas para mejorar la producción. A futuro es incrementar su producción y ventas, darles una buena educación a sus hijos y tener estabilidad económica.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Nat Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-five people in Khsom Village in Kandal Province will be comprised in one Village Bank loan. Mrs. Nat C. is a Village Bank President and she is a Chinese noodle seller in the local village. Though her business activity now is more improved, Mrs. Nat C. wants to start another Khmer noodle business which she can sell together with Chinese noodles in one place. Thus, Mrs. Nat C. needed to ask for a loan to deal with this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Srun Huoy, always assists in his wife's business. Mrs. Nat C. has five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the two others are studying at state school. Previously, Mrs. Nat C. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to build a new house.

loans.use: To start another Khmer noodle business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Domingo Asilo

texts.es:
Mr. Domingo lives in the municipality of La Concepcion in the community of Los Encuentros. He is a farmer dedicated to the production of pineapple. He is married, has 5 children, four of which are independent. His wife works at selling lottery tickets and helps him with the home expenses. His pineapple harvest is about to come out and that is why he is requesting a loan to acquire agricultural products and apply them to his harvest so that it is more fruitful. He wishes to improve his living conditions and hopes to do so from the income that his production will bring.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Don Domingo habita en el municipo de La Concepción en la comunidad Los Encuentros. Es agricultor se dedica a la producción de piña. Es casado, tiene 5 hijos de los 4 ya son independientes a él. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de lotería y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Su cosecha de piña está por salir y por eso solicita el préstamo para adquirir insumos agrícolas y aplícárselo a su cosecha para que esta sea fructífera. Desea mejorar las condiciones de vida y espera poder hacerlos con ls ganancias que le dejen las ventas de su producción.

loans.use: Maintain his pinneaple harvest.

loans.name: Sophat Suos Village Bank Group

texts.en: A Village Bank loan which consists of twenty-five people is in this case in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Sophat S. is the Village Bank President and she is a housewife who cooks food for her children. Mrs. Sophat S. is a widow with five children, two of whom are laborers who have been hired to cut firewood for a profit. Two others are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is studying in state school. Even Mrs. Sophat S. family members have different business activities; they are still in poor condition. They now live in an old house so Mrs. Sophat S. now would like to ask for a loan to build a new house in order to replace the old one.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to build a new house in order to replace the old one.

loans.name: Aniva Auano's Group

texts.en:
This group from Salelavalu on Savaii Island includes nine women working in their different businesses. Some of them are engaged in agriculture or fishing, while others have a handicrafts (Samoan fine mats (ietoga), bags, fans, etc) business. They comprise one of SPBD's competitive groups and they are looking forward to paying off their loan as soon as possible. This will then allow them access to larger loans to improve their standard of living and help their organization grow.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts and equipment for farming and fishing.

loans.name: Felorita Lifa's Group

texts.en: These three members from SPBD's Gautavai Center are asking for their first loan of 2250 Tala, which is the maximum of 750 Tala each. They are hard-working ladies whose work includes a taro plantation, a business that earns 200 Tala a week, with a profit of 90 Tala after expenses including the loan repayment. They also have a sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for their farming and sewing businesses

loans.name: Aimalefoa Setema's Group

texts.en:
This group is from the village of Vaiafai. It includes 12 ladies from the same area who run fishing businesses and plantations for their husbands, who are very good fishermen and farmers. They attend weekly meetings, which is a change for them, and look forward to successfully paying back their loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural and fishing equipment

loans.name: Folo Lomago's Group

texts.en:
Siufaga is one of the most populated villages of Savaii Island. This group from Siufaga was formed at the beginning of April 2008 and is now one of the largest groups in the programme. These ladies work to support their families and their organization. They all work independently, most at fishing and plantation farming; some members are helped by their husbands (fishermen and farmers).

The group earns $140 tala (US $58) profit every week after all expenses, enabling them to quickly pay on their first loan and they are looking forward to their next loan for renovating their houses and paying their children's school fees.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural and fishing equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Ema Iaulualo's Group

texts.en: The SPBD has disbursed $4800 ST to the first group in Sili 3 Center in regards with their loan applications submitted.  Their loan applied were mainly for agriculture use .  They never had this experience until they were being trained by the SPBD officers in order to operate their starting businesses.  It is a very helpful way for them to earn money to support their families in any way.

loans.use: purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, week killer, weed spray, bush knives, Vegetable seeds(tomato,cucumber,cabbages), fertilize, rake, gloves,boots,

loans.name: Faasala Leo's Group

texts.en:
This SPBD group is composed of women who plan to work at their families' plantation businesses. This loan is their first because their status as unemployed personnel kept them from traditional loans. However the SPBD has opened the gate to different challenges and a better future.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment and supplies

loans.name: Ana Simone Fiso's Group

texts.en:
This group includes nine women from Vaitoomuli. They are honest women who work hard to start up their businesses. Some of them farm, some of them fish, and others sell vegetables in the village and at a larger market. They earn more than $100 tala (US $41) in profit every week. They are looking for their next loan to expand the businesses and for home improvement. They are aware of SPBD rules and regulations and they are strict in enforcing them in their group.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To  purchase farming and fishing equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Ema Laufiso's Group

texts.en:
The seven members of this group from Savaii work in their different farming businesses. They are one of SPBD's new groups and they attend their weekly meetings and save both in their individual passbooks and in their group savings account. They are looking forward to their next loan for their children's school fees and for home improvements.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Fei Autalavou's Group

texts.en:
The eight women from Fogapoa in this group work in five different businesses, growing and selling agricultural produce. They have had one loan from SPBD to get started, selling their produce in their village and in the market of the nearby town. These ladies are hard working and they are thankful to have this opportunity and the big change it has made in their familes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: fence, fry, oil, banana, purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, week killer, weed spray, bush knives, fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for a small cafeteria

loans.name: Partik

texts.id:
Partik lives with her husband, Purwianto. Purwianto works as a driver. They live in a rented room at Cargo street in Denpasar. Partik opens a food stall thats sells simple rice dishes. Her stall is doing quite good because it is located in a strategic location. Her stall is located at the main route for cargos/ trucks fleet from Java to Bali. However because she only sells limited menu, some of her customers gave her feedback that they want to see more variety in the dishes. Therefore she is hoping to get the loan money to help her to afford more variety in the menu so her business can be expanded.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dilakukan sehari-hari Partik adalah sebagai penjual nasi. Warung makanan miliknya sudah berdiri sejak beberapa tahun yang lalu, tetapi hingga sekarang belum juga mengalami perkembangan yang menjanjikan. Usaha yang dijalaninya sebenarnya cukup menjanjikan, karena banyak orang yang mampir kewarungnya. Apalagi karena tempatnya sangat strategis, yang merupakan jalur kendaraan kargo dari Jawa. Tetapi karena menu makanannya selalu sama, banyak yang merasa bosan. Oleh karena itu dia sangat mengharapkan mendapat pinjaman untuk nantinya dijadikan modal usahanya, untuk memperbanyak jenis makanan sehingga nantinya semakin banyak pelanggan yang makan diwarungnya. Setiap harinya dia harus berangkat ke Pasar terdekat dengan berjalan kaki. Saat ini, bersama suaminya Purwianto yang bekerja sebagai sopir, Partik tinggal di Jln Cargo Denpasar dengan menyewa kamar bulanan.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Amin

texts.id:
Amin S. sells mixed rice for living. He starts the day very early in the morning to go to the local market to buy ingredients for his mixed rice. By 6 am he usually has arrives back to his house and together with his wife, Wasita, they will start to cook the rice. Around 10 am he already goes to Denpasar to sell his mixed rice. His regular customers are construction workers at construction sites located around Denpasar. College students in Denpasar also usually buys his mixed rice. He hopes to expand his business with the loan money from Dinari.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Amin S. sehari-harinya menekuni usaha jual nasi bungkus. Pagi-pagi sekali dia sudah harus pergi ke Pasar untuk membeli sayur mayur dan lauk pauk. Setibanya dirumah pukul 06.00 pagi ia dan istrinya Wasita memasak dan mempersiapkan masakan dan pukul 10 pagi dia sudah keliling Denpasar untuk menjual nasi bungkus dan biasanya pembelinya adalah buruh-buruh bangunan dan proyek serta anak-anak (mahasiswa) yang kost di Denpasar. Penghasilan yang didapat dari usahanya ini selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari rumah tangganya, juga disisihkan sedikit untuk modal berjualan lagi. Dia berharap melalui DINARI dia bisa memperoleh tambahan modal untuk usahanya.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Saeful

texts.id:
Saeful, his wife and their child live in a rented room. He pays IDR 150 thousand per month (around USD 19/ month) for the rented room. Saeful sells fried chicken for living. He sells the fried chicken in his push cart at Abianbase street in Denpasar Bali. He goes to Abianbase market everyday to buy ingredients for his fried chicken. He got the loan from Dinari in the past and he had alrady paid the loan in full. He is now applying for another loan so he can expand his business.

The revenue that he gets is used to pay the rented room and also to meet his family's daily needs. He also saves some portion of his money for his child's education fund.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari Saeful adalah sebagai penjual ayam goreng didekat tempat tinggalnya di Jl.Abianbase Denpasar. Bersama istri dan anaknya Wahyu Ramadhan, mereka tinggal disebuah kamar yang disewa per bulannya Rp.150.000. Setiap harinya Saeful belanja bahan baku di Pasar Abianbase menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya. Penghasilan yang didapat, selain untuk membayar sewa kamar dan untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari, juga disisihkan sebagai tabungan untuk pendidikan anaknya kelak. Sebelumnya Saeful sudah pernah mendapatkan pinjaman. Setelah melunasinya, kali ini dia mengajukan lagi penjaman sebagai tambahan modal usaha. Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman yang kedua bagi Saeful B..

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Idimoh

texts.en:
Idimoh A. is 22 years old. She is not married yet. In order to support her parents, for about two years, Idimoh has been running her own business. She works in a tailoring shop. Currently, there are four sewers working in the shop. Idimoh specializes in sewing clothing for women in the national style. She wants to make herself more popular in the city and expand her business.

Today, Idimoh is planning to expand her business and to buy modern summer fabrics to meet the requirements of her customers. She requests 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for 12 months. The loan will be used to purchase new modern summer fabrics produced in Dubai. Idimoh is counting on your help and would like to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy new modern summer fabrics

loans.name: Umurzok

texts.en:
Umurzok K. has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2008, but he has already proven himself to be a successful borrower. Thanks to his previous loan he was able to buy a pedigreed bull. Now he has 2 cows and one bull.

Mr. K. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $925 US for 8 months to build a new barn.

loans.use: To build a new barn

loans.name: Yuldus

texts.en:
Yuldus K. is 37 years old. She is married and has three school-aged children. Her husband is an entrepreneur.

Yuldus is a market vendor. She sells fabrics in the local market. She has been in this business for six years. Yuldus started her business because she needed extra income to be able to help her husband to support the family. She also needed her own income in order to afford her home and health expenses.

She is trying to diversify the range of goods that she sells in order to satisfy the needs of clients with varying levels of income. Her business is stable, allowing Yuldus to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. She is doing her the best in order to make her children well-educated. She is dreaming that, in the future, her children will become successful entrepreneurs.

Now Yuldus is planning to purchase new fabrics in order to increase her stock of the fabrics. For this purpose, she requests 3400 Somoni ($1000 USD) for 8 months. Yuldus thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy new fabric

loans.name: Marjona

texts.en:
Marjona H. is 22 years old. She is an energetic girl. Thanks to her energy and high spirit, she has been able to support her parents for 5 years. Marjona specializes in sewing modern national dresses. She wants to make herself more popular in the city and expand her business.

Today. Marjona is planning to expand her business and to purchase modern summer fabrics in order to meet the requirements of her customers. She is requesting 1200 Somoni ($350 USD) for 6 months. The loan will be spent on purchasing new modern fabrics for sewing modern-style national dresses. Marjona is counting on your help and would like to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy new, modern summer fabrics

loans.name: Sotilboldy

texts.en:
Sotilboldy K. was born in 1951 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. For the last 5 years, Mr. K. has been in the livestock business though he actually has 30 years’ experience raising livestock. He is not well educated, but he loves his work and has good practical skills. He also works on a collective farm.

Now Mr. K. is applying to KIVA for aloan of $775 US for 6 months so he can purchase one more pedigreed bull. He thanks KIVA for its important contribution to small entrepreneur business development and wishes everyone the best.

loans.use: To purchase one more pedigreed bull

loans.name: Fatimakhon

texts.en:
Fatimakhon K. is 32 years old. She is married and the loving mother of six children. Her husband is a taxi driver.

For more than 12 years, Fatimakhon has been selling vegetables, such as cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers, and garlic. Her eldest son helps Fatimakhon with the business. Every day, in the early morning, she buys fresh vegetables wholesale from the local farmers and sells them in the market. She is known in the market for her attractive prices, and she has her own regular customer. This allows Fatimakhon’s business to generate a stable abd considerable income for her family

Fatimakhon and her husband love all of their children and are doing their best to ensure them of the best future and to make them well-educated. Her business is now making progress, because it is the season of fresh vegetables.

For this purpose, she requests 2600 Somoni ($775 USD) for 10 months to increase the range of goods she sells. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of vegetables that she sells

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo B. was born in 1974 in Khujand, Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. MicroInvest has worked with Mrs. B. since 2003 and she has not any problems repaying her previous loans. Mrs. B. has been working since she was 14, when she helped her mother to sell household goods. Thanks to her previous loan, she started her own business, and now she sells children’s wear. She has a good assortment and many repeat customers.

Now Mrs. B. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $1200 US for 6 months to expand her trade outlet.

loans.use: To expand her trade outlet

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora T. is a 35-year-old lady. She is married and has two children. Both of her children are already going to school. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Gulnora’s husband's income is not enough to meet their living expenses, so Gulnora decided to run her own business.

Gulnora is a market vendor. She sells bath towels and shawls in the local market of Dushanbe city. She has been in business for seven years. Gulnora is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify the range of goods she sells to satisfy the needs of clients with varying levels of income. Her business is stable, allowing Gulnora to support her husband and family and to provide the best future for her children.

Gulnora is planning to purchase new bath towels and shawls in order to increase the range of goods that she sells. For this purpose, she requests 3400 Somoni ($1000 USD) for 8 months. Gulnora thanks all of those who are supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner, as she has done with her previous loans. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her to make her children well-educated and happy.

loans.use: To buy new bath towels and shawls

loans.name: Bubiniso

texts.en:
Bubiniso K. is 43 years old. She is married with two children. Her elder daughter is studying at the university and the younger is in school. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family, so Bubiniso is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses.

Bubiniso works in a tailoring shop. During the past five years, she gained rich experience in tailoring. Bubiniso specializes in sewing national dresses. She has always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else. Bubiniso believes that someday her dream will come true and she will open her own tailoring shop.

Today she is applying for a loan for the first time. She is requesting 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for 12 months to buy new fabrics for sewing national dresses. Bubiniso thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with her loan payments. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dream become reality.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabric for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.en:
Tutiniso B. has been an active client of the MicroInvest since 2003. The stability of her business and income helped her to repay her previous loan promptly. She started her business practically from scratch, and she now sells eggs in the central bazaar. She has many repeat customers because by working directly with suppliers she is able to offer highly competitive prices.

Now Mrs. B. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $350 US for 4 months to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Marhamathon

texts.en:
Marhamathon I. was born in 1975 in Khujand, Tajikistan. She is a loving wife and the mother of 3 children. Mrs. I. sells underwear at the local bazaar. She has been selling underwear for 6 years, so she has many repeat customers.

Now Mrs. I. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $475 US for 6 months to improve her assortment of wares. She thanks KIVA for its important work.

loans.use: To improve her assortment of wares

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar S. lives in Khujand, Tajikastan. She is married and has 4 children. MicroInvest has been working closely with Mrs. S. since 2004. She has not any problems with previous loans repayments. Mrs. S. sells shoes, children’s wear and sportswear. She works directly with suppliers so she can offer prices that are lower than the usual bazaar prices. She is very polite and has a lot of customers. She also has a background as a schoolteacher.

Now Mrs. S. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $350 US for 6 months to import some new seasonal wares.

loans.use: To import some new seasonal wares

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza N. is 29 years old. She lives in the Kairokkum region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. Mrs. N. has been a responsible client of MicroInvest since 2004; the stability of her business allowed her to pay off her previous loans without any difficulty. Mrs. N. started her business practically from scratch, and she now has her own trade outlet in a large trading centers. She sells a good assortment of food products including sour-milk and meat products, flour, vegetable oil, natural juices, and sweets.

Now Mrs. N. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $1200 US to start selling cosmetics.

loans.use: To start selling cosmetics

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mr. Sim O., 61, and his wife, Mrs. Ven Sarat, 29, make cement roofing tiles. Their combined daily income is approximately $8. The couple has five children, two whom are married. They live in Chykreng District, Siem Reap Province.

He is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase more sand and cement as ingredients for the mixture they use to make roofing tiles. The loan will enable them to produce more tiles to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase more sand and cement as ingredients for the mixture they use to make roofing tiles

loans.name: Kimie

texts.en:
Kimie, 46, wakes up every morning before dawn in order to bake the traditional Tajik bread known as lepyoshka. Kimie was trained as an economist, but, following the collapse of the Soviet Union, she began to bake bread in order to make ends meet. She is divorced and has one daughter who is 25 years old.

Kimie makes 300 pieces of bread per day that she sells at her stall in the nearby bazaar in the city of Isfara. For her small leypyoshka, Kimie charges one somoni (around 30 cents). For the larger lepyoshka that she makes for weddings and other special occasions, she charges 2 somoni. On a normal day, Kimie goes through one 50kg sack of flour that she purchases from a wholesaler at the bazaar for which she pays 140 somoni (slightly over $40).

Kimie says that she would like one day to open a store selling fabric for traditional dresses. She hopes that her Kiva loan will enable her to expand her current bread businesses so that one day she will have the money to be able to realize this dream.

loans.use: To increase volume of goods

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Born January 1, 1976 in Lomé, Mr Kossi A. is married to Mrs. Hodalo Kabissa, who is a hairdresser. He is the father of 7 children, all of whom are at school. In 2005 he opened a pork butcher’s shop called “Cachez Regardez” in Lomé’s Akodessewa neighborhood. This type of business is usually run by women. However, Mr A. runs it with passion and also greets customers enthusiastically. His business consists of buying pigs, firewood and the necessary condiments for the cooking process. At the moment he is welcoming a lot of customers and it is only his resources that prevent him from satisfying them. This first loan he is requesting will therefore enable him to buy 10 pigs and some firewood.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 1er janvier 1976 à Lomé, Monsieur A. Kossi a pour épouse dame KABISSA Hodalo qui est une coiffeuse. Il est père de 7 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. En 2005, il a crée une charcuterie « CACHEZ REGARDEZ » dans le quartier d’Akodessewa à Lomé. Généralement ce genre d’activité est exercé par les femmes. Pourtant Monsieur A. Kossi l’exerce avec passion et accueille aussi les clients avec enthousiasme. Son activité consiste à acheter les porcs, le bois de chauffe, et les condiments nécessaires afin de passer à la cuisson. Dans ces temps-ci, il accueille beaucoup de clients et seul ces ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 porcs et des bois de chauffe.

loans.use: To buy 10 pigs and firewood

loans.name: Nisso

texts.ru:
Nisso P. is 55 years old, she is married and has 3 children. Nisso sells women's clothing in the markets of Isfara. Although her business is small, it is an influential addition to her family's budget. She expanded her business half a year ago with a loan from MicroInvest. Currently, she applied for a new loan for further expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Ниссо 55 лет, она замужем и у нее 3 детей. Ниссо продает женскую одежду на рынках Исфары. Хотя ее бизнес небольшой все же он дает весомый прибавок к ее семейному бюджету. Для расширения бизнеса получила в Микроинвест займ полгода назад. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To further expand business

loans.name: John Igwe

texts.fr:
A Nigerian citizen, Mr. John Igwe U. was born November 29th, 1972 in Apachu and is married to Igwe CHIDMAN who is a retailer. He is responsible for two children and is a bag retailer in Lomé’s main market. He has been doing business since 1998 in the same location and always earns the trust of his customers. Realizing that it is almost the end of the school year, he knows that the price of school bags is dropping and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity to stock these bags to sell during the next back-to-school season. For this reason he is seeking for the first time a loan to buy 20 bales of school bags and five bales of travel bags.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

De nationalité nigériane, Monsieur U. John Igwe est né le 29 novembre 1972 à Apachu et s’est marié à CHIDIMAN Igwe qui est une revendeuse. Il a 2 enfants à charge et est revendeur de sacs au grand marché de Lomé. Il exerce cette activité depuis 1998 dans ce même endroit et gagne toujours la confiance des clients. Ayant constaté que nous sommes vers la fin de l’année scolaire, il a su que le prix d’achat des sacs d’écoliers diminue et il voulait profiter de cette opportunité pour faire le stock de sacs afin de pouvoir bien vendre à la rentrée scolaire prochaine. A cet effet il sollicite pour la première fois ce prêt pour acheter 20 balles de sacs d’écoliers et 5 balles de sacs de voyage.

loans.use: Purchase 25 bales of bags for retail

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.en:
Mahmudjon has worked at his small shoe shop located in the main bazaar of the city of Isfara for the past 15 years. Before the fall of the Soviet Union, Mahmudjon worked as a driver for 27 years but, like many in Tajikistan, had to abandon his chosen line of work during the difficult financial times that befell this small Central Asian nation beginning in the 1990s.

Twice a week, Mahmudjon makes the two-hour trip to the city of Istaravshan where his wholesale suppliers are located. There he buys 120-160 pairs of shoes at a time for around 1200 somoni ($350), which yields him a monthly income of at least 400 somoni ($115). Mahmudjon has a wife, who works at a school for the blind, and five children. His youngest son helps him at his shoe store on the days he is not in school. In addition to shoes, Mahmudjon also sells a small assortment of clothing and hopes, with his Kiva loan, to be able to expand his stock and variety of these items.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Abdumerot

texts.en:
Abdumerot A. is 29 years old. He lives in the Utkansoi region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. He has a good reputation as a very hard working, loving family man. Mr. A. is a school teacher, but most of the family’s income comes from their livestock business. Mr. A. has 20 years’ experience with livestock. He raises and sells the animals and also sells their milk and meat.

Mr. A. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 US for 6 months to buy some rams.

loans.use: To buy some rams

loans.name: Salimjon

texts.en:
Salimjon A. is 40 years old and the father of 4 children. He lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Mr. A. has been in the livestock business for 10 years. He has a good flock and rams that provide the general family income. His wife and children help him by selling milk and yarn products as well as meat.

Mr. A. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 US for 6 months so he can build a new barn. Mr. A. thanks KIVA for its work and wishes KIVA lenders all the best.

loans.use: To build a new barn

loans.name: Bisharifa

texts.ru:
Bisharifa has been working with MicroInvest for more than a year. She is 56 years old, is married and raises her 5 children. She sells children's clothing. She has been in business for a long time and this makes a significant contribution to her family's budget. She wants an additional loan from Microinvest to help increase her business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Бишарифа сотрудничает с Микроинвест уже больше года. Ей 56 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 5 детей. Бизнесом занимается давно и это вносит весомый вклад в ее семейный бюджет. Она и дальше собирается получать займы в Микроинвест для увеличения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To increase business

loans.name: Ulugbeck

texts.en:
Ulugbeck M. has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but he has already been a successful borrower. A previous loan helped him to improve his business and increase his income. Mr. M. lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. He is engaged in the family livestock business. Mr. M. has cows and a bull, as well as some rams. He has 25 years’ experience in the livestock business. He also works on the collective farm.

Now Mr. M. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $775 US for 6 months so he can purchase one additional pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To purchase one additional pedigreed bull

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim K. was born in 1968 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 6 children. Though he also works on a collective farm, his primary business is raising and selling livestock. Mr. K. has been in the livestock business for the last 30 years. He has 6 rams and one cow.

Mr. K. dreams of having the large flock so he is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 US for 6 months so he can buy a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Izatbibi

texts.en: Izatbibi K. was born in 1961 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is the single mother of 3 children, and she is enthusiastic about working hard to guarantee her children a successful future. Mrs. K. has been a successful client of MicroInvest since 2004 and she has not any problems repaying her previous loans. Mrs. K. has been working since she was 16, when she worked in her uncle’s shop. Thanks to a previous loan she was able to start her own business, and now she sells sweets at the local bazaar where she has a good assortment and repeat customers. Now Mrs. K. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $350 US for 4 months so she can import new goods and widen her assortment.

loans.use: Widen assortment of goods through new imports

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda sells women’s and children’s clothing and shoes in the “Zebo” shopping center adjacent to the main bazaar in the city of Isfara. She has worked in this location for three years and goes to Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan, 1-2 times per month in order to buy her products from a wholesaler. She sells her nicer Indian-style dresses for 130 somoni ($38) and her ladies’ shoes go for 35-40 somoni (around $10). Her overhead at her current location is fairly high as she has to pay a rental fee of 130 somoni in addition to her monthly merchant’s license that she buys from the government for another 130 somoni.

She says that business is fair and that the months of August through November are best for business because this is the time when many Tajiks who work in Russia come back home to spend time with their family and to buy the relatively cheaper goods of their homeland. Mavjuda is a single mother and has one 14-year-old son who helps out doing chores at the house because Mavjuda has no time to both be both breadwinner and homemaker. She hopes to be able to purchase a wider selection of clothing and shoes with her Kiva loan so that she can expand her client base in order to someday afford to buy her own shop.

loans.use: Further business expansion

loans.name: Phalthy Phang Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phalthy P. is the group leader of five members in SamR. Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a mat maker in the local village. Her business activities have improved but Mrs. Phalthy P. still has a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase more raw materials to make more mats to sell for an income. Thus, Mrs. Phalthy P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Sopheap Chea, is a fisherman. Mrs. Phalthy P. is 44 and the mother of six children, four of whom are students while the two others are staying at home because they are too young. Previously, Mrs. Phalthy P. obtained a loan from AMK to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials to make more mats to sell for an income

loans.name: Islombek

texts.ru:
Islombek sells women's clothing. He is 27 years old and he has two children. His wife is helping him with the business. He has been a client of MicroInvest for the last six months. He plans to use the loan to increase the variety of new types of summer clothes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Исломбек занимается продажей женской одежды. Ему 27 лет, у него 2 детей, в бизнесе помогает его жена. С Микроинвест сотрудничает полгода. Новый займ собирается потратить на увеличение ассортимента новых видов летней одежды.

loans.use: To increase merchandise variety

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo has a very profitable business selling rice. She is 44 years old, married and has four children. She travels to the neighboring Kyrgyztan and surrounding regions for buy rice. During the weekends her husband and children are helping her. She has received a loan from MicroInvest in addition to her revolving capital and it has allowed to increase the business profits. At this time she plans to get another loan to further expand the business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

У Мархабо очень доходный бизнес - она продает рис. Ей 44 года, она замужем и у нее 4 детей. Для закупа риса она выезжает в соедний Кыргызстан и по окрестностям района. По выходным дням ей помогает ее муж и дети. Дополнительно к ее оборотному капиталу она получила займ в Микроинвест. Это дало ей возможность увеличить доходность бизнеса. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ для дальнейшего расширения бизнеса.

loans.use: To buy rice wholesale

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has a small shoe sales business at the busy Central Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She has been in business for over 10 years and currently sells a nice selection of women’s shoes. She has a well-equipped kiosk and offers high quality service to her customers. Eventually, Elena would love to expand her business by opening an additional sales location. Elena is married and has one son.

Elena has requested a loan to add to her working capital and help purchase summer shoes. While shoes are always in demand, Elena can increase her sales by offering seasonal styles. This loan will allow her to continue investing in her business so she can further increase her profits.

loans.use: Add to working capital and purchase summer inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a widow who supports herself and her family with a hair salon business. Her husband passed away in 2005. Since that time she has been raising their three children, the oldest of whom is about 17. Her business has been a very important source of income for her. She has extensive experience in this area, having been in business for over 15 years. She currently has a good location for her business in a prominent part of the city.

Svetlana has requested a loan so that she can have some remodeling done to her salon. She hopes to be able to attract new clients and increase her profits. Svetlana has been a client with Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine since 2004. She has a great credit history and a very good support group. We are excited to have another opportunity to assist her in operating a successful business.

loans.use: Remodel her hair salon

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is an entrepreneur from the central Ukrainian city of Ordzhonikidze. He has a small business selling movies and music from a rented space at a mall in Ordzhonikidze. Andrei started his business about two years ago after recognizing a lack of good video stores in town. His business has done well and he currently makes around $850 in profit each month. Andrei is married and has two children. He is a lively entrepreneur and has gained a reputation for integrity.

Andrei has requested a short-term loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to increase his working capital. He has proven to be a reliable loan client with Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this opportunity to continue assisting him with his business.

(Note: this is a short-term “express” loan that will be repaid in two months.)

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Abduhamid

texts.ru:
Abduhamid is 37 years old, married and has four children. He has been doing small vehicle repairs for the past several years. He has been a client of MicroInvest for two years now and has efficiently used the loans to expand his business. Abduhamid has applied for another loan which he plans to use to buy a new auto parts.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдухамиду 37 лет, он женат и у него 4 детей. Мелким ремонтом автомобилей занимается уже несколько лет. Вот уже 2 года он сотрудничает с Микроинвест, полученные займы он целенаправлено использует на расширение своей деятельности. Абдухамид подал новую заявку на новый займ и собирается употребить его на покупку новых запасных частей автомобиля.

loans.use: To buy auto parts

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling clothing and shoes at the central mall in Ordshonikidze, Ukraine. He is a very experienced entrepreneur having been self-employed for the past twelve years. Business has been good for Sergei. There is always demand for clothing and as the economy has improved in Ukraine, so more people have been able to afford new clothing. Sergei is married. He and his wife, Irina, have two children.

Sergei has requested a loan of 5000 Ukrainian Griven to increase his available working capital. Eventually, Sergei hopes to have his own small store. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and continue to invest in his business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.ru:
Husniddin T. and his wife sell all kinds of miscellaneous items on the central market of Isfara. He is 40 years old, married and has four children. This business is the main source of income for the family. Husniddin effectively increases his commodity circulation and fulfills any financial needs by getting loans. He has shown to be a very responsible client and payed off loans on time. He wants to get a new loan and use it to increase the variety of his merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Туронов Хусниддин и его жена продают разные мелкие товары на центральном рынке города Исфары. Хусниддину 40 лет, он женат и у него 4 детей. Занятие бизнесом приносит в семью основной доход. Хусниддин целенаправленно увеличивает свой оборотный капитал, нехватку средств восполняет получением займов. В погашении показал себя дисциплинированным клиентом. Он хочет получить новый займ для увеличения ассортимента продаваемых товаров.

loans.use: To increase turnaround

loans.name: Đulsa

texts.en:
Đulsa is 58 years old. She is a widow living in the village of Čivčije.

She currently has a monthly pension of 500 KM (Bosnian Marks), and also works to support herself making needlepoint pictures. This is her first loan, which she is requesting in the amount of 600 KM ($475).

She will use this loan to buy supplies to use for making the pictures. She also needs money to buy frames for these pictures, which she then sells. Her wish is to expand her business through this loan.

loans.use: To buy tapestry for stitching.

loans.name: Senada

texts.en:
Senada is a married woman from the town of Derventa. Her husband earns 300 KM (Bosnian Marks) a month, and she works in agriculture. She has 2 children.

This is her first loan in the amount of 1,200 KM ($950). She will use this loan mainly to buy fertilizer, minerals and nutrients for her soil.

She is growing corn in her field, which she then sells. She would like to sell corn to bakeries to make flour and to farmers to feed their animals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and nutrients.

loans.name: Dijana

texts.en:
Dijana is a woman from Derventa. She is not married and has 2 children.

She currently works in production in a shoe factory. Her monthly salary is 400 KM (Bosnian Marks).

This is her first loan, which she requested in the amount of 1,200 KM ($950). To add to her income, she now wants to buy seeds to plant in flower beds, and sell these seedlings to farmers.

She also plans to keep some of the seeds for herself and grow vegetables to sell and to use for food in her home.

loans.use: To buy seeds and plant vegetables

loans.name: Zuhrijeta

texts.en:
Zuhrijeta lives in a small village called Čivčije.

She is 54 years old, married, and her and her husband have had one child. Her husband works full time, and she works to support them through her farming business growing vegetables, corn, etc.

This is her second loan, which she is requesting in the amount of 600KM (Bosnian Marks) ($475). Her intent is to buy chickens with this money and use the corn she has grown to feed them. She will then sell the chickens to make a profit.

Through this loan, she hopes to expand her business and grow her income.

loans.use: To buy chickens to fatten and sell

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly L., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sophat Mao, 43, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have three daughters, one of whom is in school, and the other two are still young, so they stay at home.

Mrs. Somaly has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Sophat has been a silk weaver since 2000 as well. He learned his skill form his wife.

Now Somaly is requesting a loan of US$100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mr. Sophea H., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Kimsroeun Thun, 32, who live on an Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1997 and have four children, one son and three daughters. Three of their children are in school and one is still young, so stays at home.

Mr. Sophea has been a carpenter for seventeen years, a skill he learned from his brother. He does his work in the village and in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Kimsroeun has been a silk weaver since 1997. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Currently, Sophea is in the process of building one kitchen room and one rest room (shown in the picture).

Now Sophea is requesting a loan of US$900 to purchase silk materials for weaving and building one kitchen room and one rest room to use in the family.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and build one kitchen room and one rest room.

loans.name: Ros's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ros U. (shown in picture from the left with his wife) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including him. The entire group members are living along National road number two about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mr. Ros U. (age 51) and his wife were married in 1982.They have nine children, four sons and five daughters. One of their children was married and lives outside the family home. Of the other eight children, five have full time employment and the other three children are in school. Mr. Ros has been motor taxi driver for twenty five years. His wife, Mrs. KhoeU. Min stays at home to take care of the children. Now Mr. Ros is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to repair his house.

2-Mr. Sokrith U., 25, (the second shown in the picture from the right with his wife) and his wife were married in 2005 and have two daughters. Sokrith has been driving a motor taxi for seven years, while his wife is a garment factory worker. Now Sokrith is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one for driving as a motor taxi.

About the group loans

In the group, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: For repairing the house and purchasing a new motorcycle to replace the old one for driving as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en:
Kweku E. is a carpenter. He is married, but his wife's income from selling fish is not sufficient for Kweku and his three children. Demand for his product is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for $400 of additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy works as a vegetable farmer near his home in the Kean Svay district, approximately 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh. He is 37 years old and married with 1 daughter and 5 sons. 

A farmer for over twenty years, Mr. Vuthy grows cucumbers and longbeans, both important vegetables in the Cambodian diet. Each week he drives his cucumbers to the nearby Kean Svay market and sells his longbeans to a middleman, who then resells them at a slightly higher price to nearby villagers and restaurants in Phnom Penh. His expertise and experience have provided a successful farming career, enabling him to support his children. Three of his children work and two are still pursuing their studies in secondary school.

However, the recent worldwide increase in fuel costs have driven up the price of fertilizer, a crucial tool for Mr. Vuthy’s business, as well as the cost of driving his goods to the market. Therefore Mr. Vuthy requests a loan from Kiva and its local field partner Maxima in the amount of $500 to purchase fertilizer and insecticide so he can continue growing his farm as usual. Without the loan, he fears his profit margins will decline significantly and he won’t have the money for his children’s schooling and the necessary costs of repairing the family’s home in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en:
Mr. Ravy, 29, lives with his wife (shown in the photo above, next to the family’s home) and four-year-old daughter in the rural Kean Svay district of Kandal Province, approximately 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh. For the past five years he has worked as a driver selling soft drinks, a very popular Cambodian beverage, to local shops. His wife works with her mother making handmade clay pots to sell to the neighboring villages.

Mr. Ravy’s mother-in-law is growing older though and currently lives alone. The Ravy family wishes to add onto their existing modest home so that she may move in with them. He has requested a loan from Kiva and Maxima, Kiva’s local field partner, of $350 to allow them to build this addition and care for their aging mother.

loans.use: To finish his house

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mr. An S., 52, lives in the Kean Svay district, a rural region about 12 kilometers from the capital city of Cambodia, Phnom Penh. He lives with his wife of nearly thirty years, Jam They, and two of their six children (pictured above). An buys bananas from local farmers and transports them to Phnom Penh, where he sells them in the market. He is also a mason, constructing and repairing nearby homes. His wife Jam collects flowers from farmers and also travels to Phnom Penh to sell them in markets to local customers. 

An is seeking his first loan from Kiva and its field partner Maxima of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for two of his children who work in Phnom Penh. One son works as a bus driver while his sister has a job as a cashier nearby. Because of the rising cost of fuel, and the long distance between Phnom Penh and Kean Svay, they are forced to live in the city. This is both expensive and difficult for the family, who would both enjoy and benefit financially from the two children living at home. A motor taxi costs 20,000 Cambodian Riel (about $5) to drive from Phnom Penh to Kean Svay, much more than the family can afford.

With the motor, An’s children can live at home with him and his wife. They will be able to save money transporting them back and forth to Phnom Penh and can use the money to help expand their banana and flower businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard A. sells audio speakers that he makes. He is married, but his wife's income from selling goods is not sufficient for Richard and his three children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Q. sells rubber and used clothing.  She is married and has 2 children. 
Business is doing very well and she wants to increase sale but lacks enough capital. 
 
She is asking for an additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more goods.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience M. is a seamstress and also sells clothing. She is single and has no child. 
She is focused on expanding her business. 
 
She is asking for additional capital to buy more clothing and sewing materials.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more clothing and sewing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 40 iron sheets to complete houses to rent.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en: Adjowa A. extracts palm oil. She sells her oil to a local soap manufacturer. She is married, but her husband's income from farming is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Adjowa and her eight dependents. Demand for her palm oil is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business extracting palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sewing materials and accessories.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Mr. Andrés Y. lives in his own home in the Bajo Tacagua zone of La Paz. Andrés works as a chauffer and is the owner of a minivan in the city´s public transportation system.

The loan he is requesting will be for maintenance and to purchases tires for his minivan, which is his means of support.

This is the fifth time he has asked for a loan and a socioeconomic analysis rates him favorably for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Andrés Y. vive en casa propia, en la zona Bajo Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Andrés trabaja como chofer y es propietario de un micro en el transporte público de la ciudad.

El crédito solicitado será destinado al mantenimiento y a la compra de llantas para su micro, que es su herramienta de trabajo.

Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: For maintenance and tires for his minivan.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua N. prepares food for sale. She is married, but her husband's income from farming is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Akosua and her three children. Demand for her food is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business preparing food for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
For the past 5 years Elena has been making and repairing clothing, a trade she learned from her mother. When she became unemployed she started working at this full time since her husband earned very little and they did not have enough income to cover all their expenses.

She needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy work supplies such as buttons, material and thread. Now that the school year is coming to an end she will offer her services to make outfits for graduation. With your help, Elena will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Elena tiene 5 años dedicándose a la elaboración de ropa y arreglo de la misma este oficio lo aprendió de su madre ya que cuando ella se quedo sin trabajo se dedico de lleno a esta actividad, debido a que su marido gana poco y no les alcanza con su sueldo para solventar los gastos del hogar.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses, para compra material de trabajo como botones, telas, hilos, ya que vienen los fines de curso de las escuelas y buscara ofrecer sus servicios para elaborar los trajes de graduacion. Con tu ayuda Elena saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase work supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business selling palm oil.

loans.name: Leydi Guadalupe

texts.es:
Two years ago, Leydi started a business selling food. It belonged to her mother in the beginning, but due to health issues, she had to leave the business. Taking advantage of her mother´s clients and with much effort, she has been able to increase production. Leydi´s business is important to her because with the income it produces she can give a better standard of living to her two little ones, who are 4 and 2 years old, and add to her husband´s income.

She needs a loan for US $400, which will be repaid in 6 months, to improve the appearance of her business and she is asking for help so she can remodel and paint it. With your help, Leydi will make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Leydi inicio hace 2 años con el negocio de venta de comida, inicialmente este era de de su mama quien por motivos de salud tuvo que dejar el negocio, entonces ella aprovecho la clientela de su mama y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado elevar su productividad. Para Leydi es importanete su negocio ya que con los ingresos que este genera puede ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 pequeños de 4 y 2 años, y complementar los ingresos de su marido.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para mejorar la imagen de du negocio, pide apoyo para remodelarlo y pintarlo. Con tu ayuda Leydi hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Remodel her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Aracely

texts.es:
Claudia was a department store employee, but when she became pregnant, they terminated her and she realized she needed to start her own business since her husband's salary was not enough to cover the family's expenses. In this manner, two years ago, she began selling seasonal fruits with salt and chilli at school gates. She realized that this was a good business. Now, both she and her husband are dedicated to selling their products at school gates.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in six months in order to purchase more seasonal fruits and have greater options for her customers. With your support, Claudia can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia era empleada de una tienda departamental, pero al quedar embarazada la despidieron, y ella se vio en la necesidad de iniciar su propio negocio ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares, fue así como hca e 2 años empezó a vender frutas de temporada con sal y chile, en las puertas de las escuelas y se dio cuenta que es un muy buen negocio. Ahora tanto ella como su esposo se dedican a vender en las puertas de las escuelas sus productos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar mas frutas de temporada y así tener mayores opciones para sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Caludia hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase fruit.

loans.name: Rodolfo De Jesus

texts.es:
Rodolfo has been selling clothing in the markets for the past 10 years. He started off helping his brother, but because of the need to help his family get ahead, he decided to work on his own. For the past 5 years the sale of clothing has been the main source of income for his family. He has two children, a 17-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl.

He is requesting a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise in order to have a greater variety to offer his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Rodolfo se dedica a la venta de ropa en tianguis desde hace 10 años. El empezó como ayudante de su hermano, y ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia decidió dedicarse al negocio por su propia cuenta, y es así como desde hace 5 años la venta de ropa es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. El tiene 2 hijos un varon de 17 años y una niña de 10 años

El solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y asi ener mas variedad para ofrecerle a su clientela.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa K. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Yaa and her four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business selling palm oil.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en: Adjowa A. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Adjowa and her four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Maria Crisanta

texts.es:
When she was very small Crisanta leaned to embroider, thanks to the teachings of her sister. She began doing embroidery that she was given for regional outfits, but when she saw that it was a good business, she decided to not only embroider but also to make her own outfits. So for the past 10 years she has been making and selling regional outfits. This allows her a good income as people use the outfits at events held in town as well as at special celebrations.
